title: Family trip to NYC
text: I have stayed at several other Editions, but first time at the one in Times Square. I usually stay more in Midtown vs Times Square but decided to try the Edition. Once you were out the front door, you were definitely in the throngs of people at Times Square. However, the entrance to the addition is just off of 7th Avenue and it is possible to avoid the crowds by going the other direction. It’s a central location to shopping, to Central Park, Times Square, Madison Square Garden, and all that Midtown has to offer. The rooms were very small, but most are in Manhattan, so I can’t really fault the Edition for that. The hotel bar was great and we enjoyed the outdoor patio that a lot of places in NYC do not have.  Not sure I would stay here for business travel but for a more relaxing vacation it was a good central spot.  One plus was that Ubers were basically waiting at the front door whenever you had to go somewhere that was too far to walk.

title: Check you credit card bill for unauthorised payments take by them !!!!
text: Hotel was average , however be warned they took an incorrect unauthorised payment from my credit card of $1875 and I have only just received the full refund  nearly 6 weeks later and three failed attempts at them converting the numbers to GBP !!! Wouldn’t trust them , won’t stay again ……

title: The nicest staff of any hotel I’ve ever visited
text: This hotel is perfectly located right at Times Square near all the theaters but with entrance on a quieter side street. The staff are all amazing- everyone from the valets to front desk to housekeeping are so friendly and helpful. The rooms are New York City small with a few functional misses  (bathrooms could use more hooks and room could use more outlets!) but overall a good use of space. The restaurant has nice atmosphere. The staff is really what makes this hotel five stars.

title: Disappointing stay
text: My husband and I recently stayed here for a night and were disappointed with our sub par experience at this hotel.  We booked with a stars advisor and are also titanium bonvoy.  The desk agent was not welcoming at check in and didn’t reference either.  I had to ask her what the stars benefits were.  No upgrade yet hotel had plenty of availability.  The room was extremely small without a proper bathroom, the toilet and shower were in small closets while the vanity is open to the bed area.  We’ve stayed in many hotels in NYC and certainly don’t expect a palatial room, but a proper bathroom seems like an appropriate ask.  We could barely sleep as the walls were paper thin.  The hotel, while new, seems to be in need of a refresh.  Will not be staying here again despite the very close proximity to my husband’s office.

title: I love this property
text: This property makes it worth staying in Times Square! I always have the best time here year after year. Ashley really made my stay this time I really appreciated her kindness! And oh my she makes the best lattes :)

title: Not a five star experience
text:
The edition hotels have seen better days and this one is no different. Booked a large suite to ensure I would have extra space, checked in at 4 but my room wasn’t ready until 6pm. Titanium elites are supposed to get early check in, not have to sit in the bar and wait for two hours while others are whisked to their rooms immediately. And the rooms are simply not functional. No closet space whatsoever, no place to put luggage, and this is in the supposedly largest suite in the hotel. My room had a balcony but furniture was so dirty I stained my pants sitting down and decided not to go back out again. Food is average and $300 to have breakfast delivered to your room is ridiculous, even in New York. Bellmen took 55 minutes to get luggage, they offered me an SUV to the airport and quoted me $150 (Ubers cost around $90-100), I said ok thinking it would be more convenient, then once we got to the airport the driver pretended not to speak English and charged me $190 and still asked for a tip on top, felt like a bait and switch and I’m sure the bellman who set it up got a cut. 

Manager on duty did his best to address issues and offer solutions, but the basic lack of functionality of the rooms remains… and for that reason alone I won’t return.

title: Great stay and location
text:
Great location for time square, room upgraded to a king, room was still slightly small and we had to use our cases as storage due to lack of draw space, rooms were very clean and modern, 
Most staff were very helpful especially the porter(think his name was Fernando) he sorted the jammed door, and thereafter he would acknowlege us at every opportunity wishing us a good day, we loved the bar area and friendly staff, plus the outside  balcony area especially  when the weather is nice which had  great views, would totally recommend this hotel as a great base and amenities

title: A great find...
text:
So excited that we found this outstanding hotel.  Excellent facility plus a staff beyond expectations.  Concierge Daniel Jutt was a wealth of knowledge before and during our stay.  He skillfully arranged transportation after explaining all options.

Everyone raves about the location of this hotel.  They are right!  Can't get a better spot.  Definitely will stay at this hotel every time we are in Manhattan.

title: Great Service prior to arrival makes for a great stay!
text: We are checking in the Times Square Edition this week.  In precreation for our stay, i  revived a lovely email from Ivana Zapata with details of our stay. This is one of the first pre travel emails i have received prior to arrival and it was most appreciated and made us feel welcome! Stay tuned for more reviews as this stay paper's off to a great start!

title: favorite NYC hotel
text: I gave this for 5 star because I pay for the room upgrade and it’s stunning and spacious. The standard room based on the image looks like very small so I emailed the hotel team to pay for upgrade in advance. The room views is wonderful and I like the design of Edition. Be Prepared to some noise during night because it’s time square. Breakfast is good and you have many choices.

title: Christmas stay at Edition Times Square
text:
Pros:
-Location is right next to times square
-upgraded to higher floor with view over times square
-Rooms are well insulated so don’t get as much noise at night; slick modern design of the rooms; standard amenities included
-The reception desk, and bell desk were really helpful - from helping get taxi when it was extremely busy to giving recommendations and helping us book restaurant for Christmas
-35 $ vouchers that can be used for food and drinks in the hotel

Cons:
-Not much storage in the room
-Breakfast

title: Best Hotel in Times Square
text: The location was fantastic--close to Times Square, Rockefeller Center, Radio City, Broadway theaters, and many restaurants. The room was spotless and well-appointed with the absolute best toiletries, fluffy towels, etc. Everyone we met on the staff from the front desk, concierge, bars, doorman, and housekeeping were helpful and friendly. We would stay there again in a heartbeat. We had a late dinner at the bar adjacent to the restaurant, and the meal was fantastic. The chocolate souffle with Grand Marnier is not to be missed.

title: Severe Racial Discrimination and Distressing Service Leading to Tears at Times Square Edition
text:
I am compelled to express my profound disappointment with my recent stay at the Times Square Edition of Marriott, where my girlfriend and I encountered not only substandard room conditions but also disturbing customer service, particularly from the manager, Joseph, which tinged with racial bias.We were also accused of posing a physical threat to the staff.This accusation is not only baseless but also extremely offensive.

The state of the bathtub in our room was appalling - it was cracked and peeling, posing a significant safety hazard. The sharp, flaking pieces of the tub could have easily caused physical injury, a risk unacceptable in any accommodation, let alone one costing $2,600 for two nights. However, the response to our complaint was far from satisfactory. Despite the high price, the hotel was fully booked and Joseph offered no apology or suitable alternative, merely stating the tub was usable. He said " the tub was functional, but cosmetically unappealing"Joseph's impatience and dismissiveness during our discussion over the phone were profoundly disrespectful. He even questioned our calculation and communication abilities and insisted we visit the front desk for an explanation.

Joseph's handling of the situation was not only inadequate but also suggestive of racial discrimination. Despite my status as a Platinum Elite member, Joseph's attitude and decisions implied a discriminatory stance, especially given his refusal to acknowledge our concerns adequately and his insinuation that we were being unreasonable.When we highlighted the tub's condition, Joseph's offers of $250 in food and beverage credits or 3,500 reward points felt both insufficient and irrelevant. He denied us access to another Suite, despite availability shown on the Marriott app, claiming it was reserved for VIP guests. This discriminatory treatment was deeply unsettling.

After complaining to Marriott headquarters, he seemed forced to come to apologize. However there is no sincerity in his apology, when asking if he understands why we felt being mistreated, he refuted every points we mentioned before and insist that every decisions he made were entirely right. This behavior was especially upsetting to my girlfriend, who was reduced to tears by his insensitivity.

Most concerning was Joseph's implication that our presence posed a physical threat to him. This baseless accusation is not only deeply offensive but also a severe allegation that escalates the situation far beyond a customer service failure. His refusal to inspect the room, citing fear of our presence, was both unjustified and indicative of a prejudiced mindset.

This entire experience has left us feeling not only disregarded as customers but also discriminated against. It is unacceptable for guests, particularly those paying a high price for what should be a luxury experience, to be subjected to potential safety hazards and such levels of disrespect.

Moreover, it became evident that the hotel had knowingly assigned us a room with a damaged bathtub. This revelation, coupled with Joseph's dismissive and confrontational approach, severely impacted our experience.
Not only was the bathtub in the room damaged, but the mirror and one standing lamp were also broken, and there were cracks in the sink. The bathrobe even had hair from the previous guest on it. It's hard to imagine this is a hotel worth $1,300 a night. 

This encounter not only reflects poorly on the Marriott brand but also raises serious concerns about racial bias and customer disregard, particularly given the high price we paid for what was expected to be a luxury experience. We expect Marriott's corporate team to address these issues urgently to ensure that such discriminatory and disrespectful treatment is not repeated with other guests.

title: You don’t get what you pay for
text:
Booked as a 30th birthday celebration and left very disappointed. Firstly we were charged $200 a night security deposit which wasn’t mentioned at all when booking.
Secondly my retainer was thrown away by housekeeping staff. No apology provided. Thought the customer service was generally poor. 
Our room was a let down after hearing so much about the design of the hotel. The room was tiny and just had glass toilet and shower cubicles rather than a proper bathroom so 0 privacy. Our sink had a big crack in the middle and many areas of the hotel have scuffed/chipped paint. 
Definitely wouldn’t book another Edition hotel after this experience.

title: Stylish, clean, good location...shame about the injuries!
text:
I wasn't going to write a review but after seeing reviews about the 'deadly bed corners' I thought it was probably worth doing. We stayed in a standard room and the gap between the bed and the desk is not wide enough. On our first morning, as I walked around the bed, I caught my foot in the bedding, causing me to fall to the ground and as the room is small, I also hit my head off the door. 5 days later and my elbow is still in pain. My woolly hat seems to have mostly protected my head! Luckily I'm in my twenties but I'd be worried what a fall like that would do to an older person. 
Although the room is small, it was stylish and clean, with a fairly clever use of space. I particularly liked the lighting in the room which meant being able to use the bathroom without disturbing my partner. More hooks would be helpful, as there was only one in the whole room. Four by the shower to hang a bath towel and a robe each (to free up hangers in the wardrobe), two next to the sink to hang a hand towel each, and a few by the door to hang coats, scarves, hats etc. would be helpful. More storage space in the wardrobe is needed too. A drawer is used for the safe, a large section of it is for the coffee station and the other available space it too high to reach, and as already mentioned, two hangers are used for the robes as there's nowhere else to hang them. The standard rooms are really designed for one person. However, I have to add, that the toiletries and fragrance used throughout the hotel is really nice. And it is a very good location if you are looking to be near Broadway and other attractions.

title: Great hotel. Lethal bed corners
text:
The hotel is in a great location and actually very quiet for Times Square. Smells amazing too. 

Bed corners are lethal. We are both Back bruised heavily in both legs where the razor sharp corners have bruised us. My friend actually ended up in hospital with suspected blood clot due to areas of bruising 

200 dollars per night on top of 41 dollars is a ridiculous deposit compared to other hotels. Was very shocked to see that large an amount

title: Expensive well dressed vibe
text: Stayed at the hotel which is in the middle  of Times Square for just 2 nights. Was out most of the time. We were hosted by illycaffe. The breakfast was superb with the usual bacon,eggs hash browns etc and healthy delicious options too like avo on toast,bruschetta etc. Service is really quick. I was worried bec the hotel is so large. They are efficient ,friendly and troops are clean. Don’t really care for the bathroom layout. Using the coffee machine was too complicated for me with the coffee pods. They sent people to help but really not worth the effort. They should provide free coffee for guests in the lounge like the library hotel does.

title: Signature Scent
text:
The location is perfect if you want to be in Times Square. I have absolutely no problem with the staff, location or amenities. We came and went.  Did not use any of the restaurants. The view of the premier Times Square room was as advertised. Staff was very helpful and friendly.  
The entrance is a little strange.  The lobby is on the 10 floor.  There is also a pretty popular night club in the building.  There's a line every night to get in with bouncers and hot chicks trying to get in...just like in the movies...but it wasn't an issue just walk around it. (the bouncer even told us we were welcome at the club anytime just come see him).  The room is smaller than a usual hotel room but if you're spending time in your room, why are you in NY?
The scent.  On their website they boast about the Edition signature scent. You will smell it. My wife's allergies are triggered by smells and this was a big one. After the first night coughing and gagging down Broadway, she had to cover her face walking through the lobby.  There was no scent in the room fortunately.  The only reason I didn't  give 5 stars in the scent.  It did not bother me but it was a little strong.

title: Dishonest hotel; bait and switch.  What you buy (based on the wedbite and mobile app) is not what you will receive
text: This hotel fraudulently advertises services it does not offer, when questioned about it they explain why they don't offer the service but do not explain why they advertise its availability then when pressed lie in the face of indisputable, tangible, evidence. Specifically the hotel claims on their website, mobile app and welcome letter to offer contactless check-in and a mobile key.  When you check in on their app it assures you that a mobile key is being prepared, however it never arrives.  When I inquired via the mobile messaging service I was informed for the first time that the hotel doesn't offer it to first time guests (according to Booking.com 90% of guests never return to a hotel after the first stay).  They explain irrelevantly that they are doing it for "my safety"; why claim you offer the service if its "unsafe" to give to 90% of your guests AND don't actually give the service you advertise?   I hate being lied to or mislead and I dislike attempts to cover the lies with excuses that are irrelevant and assume the guest is too stupid to understand that they have been lied to.  As for the review of the hotel after the lie.  The good is that staff at the hotel were terrific.  The bad is the rooms are smaller than you can imagine, offer zero privacy for more than one guest and the multiple elevators required to access your room is inconvenient at best.  Don't lie to you guests and don't treat them like an idiot when you are caught.

title: My favourite hotel in NY
text: My favourite hotel in NY. Staff are extremely friendly and helpful. And the premium suites offer an amazing terrace overlooking Times Square. Good gym and large selection of streaming services. It’s always great to be back at this hotel.

title: Beware! Rude management, unbecoming service. The Customer is always wrong.ng!
text:
The good:
Ms. Kunchok at the front desk has impeccably attended to my stays for over a year. Thank you.

The bad & the Ugly:
The property has become a run-of-the-mill hotel serving loud and rowdy conventioneers as opposed to paying attention to their core clients. It has become noisier on the inside than the room facing Time Squares.
Managers (Ms. G.M.) -so I do not break Tripadvisor's guidelines- makes racist and rude remarks that have no other ways to be interpreted.  She is unbecoming for her role. This IS the ugly.
However, she has the backing of her superiors. Circle the wagon, point fingers to the Customer and move on. Modern woke tactic...."there must have been a misunderstanding."

Management believes and states that just because this is a more "casual" and "relax" property, service should not meet with the standards called for by its brand, by common decency and by the asking rates. They are wrong.

Bonvoy's preferences/profiles do not transfer to the this property (so I am told),  nor does the "localized" profile of a Customer (I) who has visited the property on multiple occasions. In fact, preferences and profiles, have no meaning at all. The hotel does not pre assign rooms until just a few hours from arrival.
The room phone batteries are often discharged so one cannot utilize the telephone. (There is currently a project to change all batteries, as there is a project to update all the guests' profiles). As you can see there are many projects but very few hard evidences that progress is made. To the contrary.

It is disconcerting to observe  how what used to be a good property with caring service has become. But I am just the Customer...

title: Great Hotel, For Theatre Going
text: The primary reason for my visit to NYC was to see several plays. I stayed at this hotel 6 nights, specifically so I would be near the 5 theatres I would be attending. Having lived in the NYC metro area for over 30 years, and now living on the other coast, I knew more than to think anything near Times Square would be my cup of tea. However, for the ease of getting to and from the plays via a short walk, hands down, there was nothing better. Thankfully my room was at the far end of the hall, on the 30th floor, far enough from the hubbub (to put it mildly) below, but still able to see the TKTS red stairs and all the crowds. I could hear the occasional sirens and loud music, but nothing after 10 pm. I sleep with white noise, so if there was any street noise, it was not noticed by me. Now, the good things-I had a king bedded room, which for one person was fine. If there were two people sharing this room, it might be tight. I took room service for several meals, and the only place to dine was the long, narrow ledge-desk area beneath the wall mounted television. There was just one chair beneath it, which when pushed underneath, gave one just enough room to walk in front of it and the foot of the bed. The white leather armchair and ottoman were comfortable for reading beside the full length window with a standing lamp. Should you be sharing the room with another, there was a full length, blackout style drapery that could be drawn across the width of the room, dividing the bed area from the entry/bathroom. One could turn on separate lights (the nightlight, although a nice touch, is way too bright to act as such...a fault I have been experiencing in hotels of late) and shower or get ready for the day. A non-lit, tilting makeup mirror was a welcome addition (the lit mirror over the sink giving ample light), as was a hand-held steamer, which I used several times. So much more efficient and easier to use than an iron! The one-size-fits-all robe was much more plush than any hotel offering I have had in a long time. And also useful, a little mini refrigerator that one could temporarily move a few items to the upper shelf of the closet to make way for a few locally made purchases. The toilet and shower areas are made of heavily frosted glass (thankfully, fully and heavily frosted, to the point no shadows are visible) and consist of a shared center panel between them. Again, thank you for the complete sense of privacy, should one be sharing the room with another. The shower comes with a rain head fixture, but I made most use of the very sleekly designed hand held shower. Thanks to the designer from all us women who use shower caps. I loved the high-medium-low light setting for all the built in lighting in the room, which added a nice ambience. There was just enough room for my hanging clothes, and those I placed in the 2 drawers in the closet (a third was given up to a locking safe, which I also used). But given the shelving in the closet, more items could be stored if the room was shared. Now, what I wished was in the room-towel bars! I seems having a sleek design means forfeiting such a practical item, but I did not want to use a new towel each day. I find it unnecessary. I had a robe knob (not a hook) which, if one desired, one could place a damp towel. However, the towel folds and does not get adequately dried...I would rather have folded my towel over a bar and used it several days, which is also more environmentally friendly. Nowhere to hang a hand towel, either, nor facecloth. Or my wet raincoat (the frosted walls of the shower/toilet stalls were too tall to reach). I am a Marriott Bonvoy member, but don't know if this was the reason I received a text a few days prior to my stay, asking if there was anything I would need in my room. What a nice touch. My request was answered promptly. I checked out and stopped at the concierge desk to offer my compliments, stating that the room service staff were incredibly well trained and pleasant. Really-above and beyond, genuine and very upbeat, all of them. I was pleasantly greeted by a gentleman as I was waiting for the elevator, and asked if he was part of management? Yes, he was...so he received my accolades on how I enjoyed my stay. Then, as I entered the elevator, two women nicely greeted me, and seeing their ID tag lanyards, I asked if they were part of management? They acknowledged in the affirmative, so I gave them the same message of how pleased I had been with my stay. So, I covered all the bases.

title: Stay far away from this property
text:
Extremely poor experience, waited forever to check in, no recognition of titanium status except ‘we have added a 1000 points’.  Room is extremely small, cramped, poor quality - does not deserve even 3 star status, let alone 5 star.  Will never return here.

Other things that happen - Fire alarm randomly goes off..

title: Horrible Customer Experience ; Manager Ivana Zapata
text: Manager On Duty, Ivana Zapata should not be in charge of guest experience.  from the time I made a reservation and moved dates and then cancelled, no where did they share a deposit and loss of funds if you didn't cancel within 24 hours.  I clearly made a reservation 4 weeks in advance.  I am a Titanium member and have never been treated this way by anyone in in the customer service industry.  I will never stay at an Edition property and recommend others there are better hotels and "guest experiences" in the city

title: Clean Luxurious Hotel with Friendly Competent Staff
text: Booked four rooms here recently for extended family ages ranging 2 to 80.  Everyone was happy.  Hotel was conveniently located, rooms were beautiful and clean, and staff were extremely helpful.  Our every need was met instantly.  Can't imagine any way to improve this place.  Front desk, concierge, restaurant staff - all above and beyond at every encounter.

title: Anniversary Trip
text:
A great hotel for a special occasion!   The staff was awesome and made our weekend memorable.  

In the center of Times Square, so the is plenty to do.   Minutes from the theater district, so very convenient 

The noise was a little loud on the lower floors of the hotel 

The in house Paradise Club is a must do.  While pricey the food and show were well worth the extra cost

The drinks and food were good but pretty expensive but the hotel is in the heat oof the city, so this shouldn’t be a surprise 

Highly recommend this for couples but would not recommend for families 

Very nice for a special occasion.

title: Central hotel
text:
Very central in Times Square. 6 minutes walk from tube station for E & C lines. E line for Jamaica road for JFK airtrain
Ellens stardust diner a few mins round the corner. Rooms comfortable, plenty of bathroom products.
We were on the 18th floor facing Times Sq, great views

title: Interesting hotel
text:
If the nearby W and JW had a baby, and the W had dominant genes, it would result in the Times Square Edition. This hotel is strange, it's billed as a luxury hotel, and the prices reflect that. However, you need to have realistic expectations to avoid disappointment.

What's good: Efficient front desk, great lobby bar, the location, room service is fast and tasty, everything is new, photos of the rooms.

What's not: The actual room was tiny, iron only on request, no parking or valet.

This is a good hotel for younger people, but I'm unlikely to stay here again.

title: Super gelegenes Hotel
text:
Das hotel ist extrem gut gelegen, mitten im Geschehen am Times Square. Wir waren in der 35. Etage (von 40) und hatten einen super Blick. Es gibt jeden Tag gratis Wasser. Sollte dies mal fehlen, kann man an der reception Bescheid geben. Man zahlt für jeden Tag Resort fee iHv. 35 euro. Dafür kann man sich etwas beim Zimmerservice bestellen. Das bad scheint nachträglich eingebaut worden zu sein. Das Waschbecken ist mitten im
Raum und Toilette und Dusche sind festrennt voneinander in einer milchglaswand eingebaut worden. Die Lautstärke war auch nicht zu stark im
Hotel.

title: Edition is an Oasis in the Big Apple.
text: This is our new favorite NYC Hotel. Excellent location, restaurant and bar, with beautiful rooftop patios. Service is good to exceptional. Food was great and the vibe is cool and relaxed, not crowded like most of the rest of the city, giving it a feeling of exclusivity. Edition is the big apple’s secret oasis.

title: Best Times Square NYC Hotel
text: I am normally loyal to another hotel brand, especially in NYC.  However, I had been wanting to try this hotel since before covid.  So, I jumped at a chance to use my points to book this for my upcoming work trip.  To be fair, I tend to avoid Times Square, as most New Yorkers/former New Yorkers do.  But, I was willing to break this rule to try this hotel!  For starters, it is smack dab in the midst of all the crazy.  We are talking about the noise and crowds, etc.  But, I did not hear anything in my room.  The first-floor entrance was barren.  All you see there is the valet stand and a sculpture.  I am not sure if this was meant to showcase an aura of exclusivity.  It was not impressive.  The signature hotel scent is reminiscent of smoke embers and man cologne.  I was not a fan, and you can smell it as soon as you enter the door.  The lobby is on the 10th floor, which was a little odd.  It’s not an inviting lobby at all.  There is literally one chair to sit on and someone was always sitting in it because there was always a line.  There were seats in the bar area and a sitting room to the side.  But, it was not as convenient to sit in there if you needed to stand in the line.  The theme I assume with this hotel is minimal.  The lobby evoked this.  I was apparently upgraded to a larger king room.  But, I would not have thought that had the room service attendant not told me.  If this was a “bigger” room, I shudder to know what was smaller.  It was VERY clean.  The décor was again, basic and minimal.  It literally looks like the Public Hotel downtown, but a little nicer.  You can tell they are both Ian Schrager-designed hotels.  They could be the same hotel.  Everything was white and wood.  My room had a low to floor frame king bed, tiny nightstands, a window seat and a wall ledge used as a table with chair.  It was almost too much for the space.  You would not have noticed it was a tight fit until you attempted to walk around the bed.  Unfortunately, my shin found out as the frame of the bed juts out past the edge of the mattress.  You will bang it.  It will hurt.  The “bathroom” was the no wall type that many modern hotels use nowadays.  There was an open sink area with open shelves underneath.  I did not love this as I had to keep bending down to look for things I needed.  The toilet and shower were housed behind frosted glass doors.  Make sure to shut these if your window curtain is open lest you give someone in the Renaissance Hotel a peep show.  There is a nice Nespresso machine.  Snacks and alcohol are provided (for a price).  Room service was delicious (cobb salad) and very quick.  My attendant Habeeb was lovely and very friendly.  I had a breakfast meeting at the Terrace and Outdoor Gardens the next morning.  Mauro and Brohan were very attentive and kind to all our needs.  The food was amazing.  I had no issue with the price because it was all worth it (mushroom omelette, duck hash, cappuccinos, fresh OJ).  The view from the terrace was just the right juxtaposition of cityscape with a garden setting.  I also got the loveliest amenity of US Open macarons sent to my room due to my status.  They were delicious as well.   When I checked out, I showed my bruised purple shin, and Andrew, the acting manager, was kind enough to assist me in a resolution.  I wish I had gone to the gym.  I heard it was nice.  But, I only stayed one night.  I think the atmosphere of minimalistic and cool works for some, but not for others.  It was fine with me.  I have stayed at more “luxurious” hotels, but the service here was quite impressive.  The service is the reason I would stay here again.  That, and the proximity to the subway station were the biggest wins.  If you want to have a cool NYC experience with a boutique hotel vibe (albeit not in size), stay here.  The service is second to none!

title: Many good qualities unfortunately overshadowed by the misrepresentation of the accommodations booked.
text:
I booked two rooms, a deluxe king room and a one bedroom suite, with a separate living room and bedroom, at the Times Square Edition for a total of six nights through Booking.com.  

An issue arose when checking in.  The one bedroom suite, as described on the Booking.com site, was not what we were provided.  Instead, what they called a suite was simply a larger bedroom with a sofa in addition to the bed.  I addressed the problem immediately with management.  Their contention was that it was Booking.com's error.  They claimed once I reached out to Booking about the matter and received their "blessing" they would adjust our bill for the "inconvenience". 

I did immediately contact Booking.com, apprised them of the situation, and they willing agreed to authorize the Times Square Edition to compensate us.  In contrast to what I was told by the hotel, a total of two different Booking.com, representatives, categorically stated that the hotel is solely responsible for the content they provide to Booking.com when listing their property.  Who should I believe?

The Times Square Edition did adjust our hotel bill by $450 (for a $6,300 room charge).  Although this seemed inadequate given the inconvience the misrepresentation caused us, I was prepared to table the entire incident until I checked back on the Booking.com page and found the same, incorrect description of the Times Square Edition remained on their site.  I sent a online complaint through Marriott Customer 
Service.  Their response was to refer me back to the hotel.  The front desk manager emailed me with the offer of a 60,000 credit to my Marriott Bonvoy account, which I subsequently discovered could not actually be applied to  since the reservation was booked through a third party.  

I then spoke directly with Marriot Customer Service and they showed little concern about the misleading practices employed by a member of their Marriott chain.

It is a shame, because so many other aspects of our stay were wonderful.  The staff, without exception, were kind, cheerful, and helpful.  The restaurant and bar served amazing food and drinks and the housekeeping staff were some of the best I've ever come across.

If you do choose to stay at the Times Square Edition you may well have a great experience, but  if you have any specific requirements or needs that are "advertised"  I would suggest questioning them closely, if lack of these amenties would seriously impact on your stay.

title: Customer service is above and beyond
text:
I stayed here for 10 nights when visiting NYC for pride. 

Customer service: First and foremost, the customer service was out of this world and the BEST customer service I’ve ever received, from the second I stepped foot in the hotel. Everyone was so warm and friendly - the doormen, front desk, housekeeping and every single person I simply shared an elevator with or walked past. I was truly blown away as most guests seemed to be staying for business and were dressed very formally, whereas I was there for pride/concerts and always dressed comfortably yet I was always treated with respect. I was super impressed by Nicole who was extremely kind and helpful and did an amazing job at explaining all the services and amenities when checking me in. 

Location: This hotel is located in the heart of Time Square, minutes away from many tourist attractions. I was very lucky to be moved to a room overlooking Times Square and there are also great views from the gym and Terrace. 

Room: The hotel and rooms are stunning with minimal wear and tear. The rooms with a view of Times Square do not have bathrooms but this wasn’t an issue as I was staying alone and there is a curtain if needed. There is Showtime, complimentary water and amazing daily turndown service. My belongings had been tidied up whenever I returned and I never had any issues with theft so it was a relief to not have to worry about locking away designer or expensive items every time I left the room. I often didn’t leave early enough for housekeeping but I was still able to request soap etc through the app and it was always delivered immediately. 

Value: The room was extremely great value for money because of the incredible customer service and perhaps the best location in NYC. I would definitely stay here again. However, I was disappointed to have to pay an extra $475 because of the destination fee. I was aware of the fee before checking in but unfortunately I didn’t enjoy the food so eventually stopped redeeming the food and beverage credit. I also did not use the MoMA tickets, Soul Cycle or TMPL passes, although I wish I did. If you redeem all of these things and like the food then the destination fee is worth it.

Restaurant and lobby bar: The restaurant and bar is beautiful and I loved that they had special cocktails and soufflé for pride! I personally thought the food was bland so I barely ate any of whatever I ordered but I think other people may love it.

This is an LGBTQ friendly hotel with diverse staff that treats all people with kindness and respect and does not discriminate. I felt very safe and thoroughly enjoyed staying here and hope to come back. Thank you!

title: Super Helpful Staff. Thank you, Manny!
text: This review is based on my trip to NYC next week. I just booked my room at The Times Square Edition and wanted to see if I could upgrade. I called the front desk and had the pleasure of speaking to Manny. He was incredibly accommodating and made the process of upgrading my room smooth and stress-free. This is a big trip for me, and I feel like it's off to such a great start! Thank you again, Manny!!

title: Amazing Birthday & Engagement weekend.
text:
Late review on this amazing experience, my apologies on not having everyone’s name. Enjoyed & was amazed by this hotel property, location & the staff.

Front desk agents were very welcoming & swift to assist us with our arrival & departures. To all kudos.

John on Concierge was more than great booking us a couples massage in a spa close by: Nuansa Spa. Amazing couples experience in the middle of the hustle & bustle.

Christopher on the main restaurant bar was absolutely lovely. The Lobby bar was superb & just the right ambience for cocktails. Bartenders where excellent.

Main restaurant servers were amazing as well. & Ashley from Rooms Service was absolutely spectacular with her gesture upon knowing we got engage during my birthday. The chocolate cake was delicious. Thank you.

Doormen Jay; was an absolute boss calling a cab for us on our departure. Literally stop a cab on the extremely busy avenue & were able to depart for our next stop.

We cannot thank you enough for an amazing few days, celebrating my birthday & my surprise proposal to my now fiancé. From our bottom of our hearts, truly thank you. We will come back & definitely stay at this property once again.

title: Pretty place but when it comes to issues, too little, too late
text: While I loved the peaceful, pretty room, and my first night of sleep, I did not give five stars because of my experience my final night. I had a view of Times Square and knew there would be street noise. I’m n my final night, however. I was jolted awake at 3 am by a shouting man who was in the room next to ours. I figured it’d stop but thirty minutes later, I realized it was not. I called the front desk and messaged them on the bonvoy app. I asked them to intervene because I worried about getting into a confrontation with a guy who was screaming that loudly, and for that long. After an hour of the hotel not responding, I went over myself, leaving my teen daughter behind in our room. The man did not appear to hear my knocking so I retreated and called the front desk who promised they send security up. Around 4:30, he finally stopped speaking so loudly (he appeared to be shouting words to someone on the phone or maybe he was talking to himself). Either way, I did not enjoy having to beg the hotel to handle him and I’m exhausted today. We moved to a new hotel today. Staying at Times Square was fun for our teen but next time we will stay nearer Central Park or an otherwise quieter spot to ensure a restful night of sleep.

title: Quiet Oasis from the chaos outside
text: A very chic hotel that is so much quieter then u would expect. The rooms were small but completely comfortable. I had a times square view and i was worried about the noise and yes at 9:30 it was noisy outside but by 11:30 somehow it was quiet. Didnt get a real chance to check out the bar and restaurant but it looked very inviting. Next to the Hershey store for ur sugar needs i had to trek down a few blocks to get to Little Italy pizza which was quite good. The two elevator ride to room got a little old but i think it keeps the creeps outa the lobby.

title: Wish we had more time!!!
text:
We used our points for just a quick stopover on our roadtrip and we were very happy with our choice! The staff were very warm and welcoming, they were very sweet to upgrade our room to a high floor view of Times Square and a dessert for my partners birthday! The room itself is small, you'll get that in the city, but it's very cozy and most of it is designed very efficiently. They don't have on site parking so we parked with an affiliated garage and they discounted our parking. 

I'd say the couple complaints I had was their very limited food menu and the pricing of such. Given it is a luxury hotel, it will have high food pricing, but I expected more offerings considering that. The dinner selections were just ok, but the breakfast was fantastic. The pillows were hard to sleep on they were so soft, so maybe an extra (on top of the two pillows) might help. Overall, it was a very relaxing stay and we will definitely be back to stay.

title: The Time Square Gem
text: Absolutely amazing experience. This is the hidden gem of Time Square. Absolutely amazing staff (shoutout to Johny the bellman, Stamos at the concierge, and Dana in Housekeeping) who all are absolutely amazing at what they do and the beyond 5 star service they continue to provide. The rooms are beautiful and cozy. Attention to detail is impeccable. The overall service, decor, and comfort of this property is 5/5. I cannot wait to go back.

title: Worst experience
text: I prepaid my stay through Expedia, they charged me $200 per night deposit which is understandable, I didn’t use any of the facilities or mini bar, they didn’t have anything to charge so they charged me $45 per night destination fees, the front desk morning agent, she was very unprofessional and very rude for a 5 stars hotel, very disrespectful I make 10 times her salary talking me down telling bottom line this is what you will be charged and long story short etc, i feel ashamed and sorry for her and her costumer service, I think that’s why she is doing the graveyard shift, because her attitude stinks more than the trash in around the hotel, I stayed so many times at the edition hotel in many cities, by far this is the worst. I checked out Wednesday June 28th at 6:45 AM if any of the hotel management reads this review so they can know who’s the person and the type of employees they have.

title: Cool View!
text: I stayed for one night on business and I really loved the decor of this hotel. The staff were all very nice and accommodating. I ordered room service and enjoyed my steak (they also delivered it in a timely manner). The bed was clean and my view of time square was awesome. Noise level is not a concern and they have handy blackout curtains. The room could’ve been a little cleaner but overall I’d definitely stay here again!

title: Great location, Amazing Views & Great Staff
text: Absolutely loved our weekend at The Edition! We had the best views and took full advantage of this location being the perfect jumping off point. It’s worth spending some extra $$ to stay on a higher level of the hotel. Rooms are compact (as most are in this city) but bright and modern. Super fun night club with awesome music & dancing. The lounge was a great spot for afternoon cocktails. The one and only complaint was the terrible service at the breakfast restaurant (which I understand is not operated by the hotel). Make sure you save yourself the unpleasant experience of dining there.

title: Time sqr location not for me
text:
Actual the edition in Times Square is not a bad property but it isn’t for me. The hotel staff are amazing and front desk staff very efficient in fixing my problems . 
The check in was smooth and excellent and our driver had no issue finding door to hotel so don’t believe that negative remark people post .
The standard room is basically a closet ,if you both have luggage good luck finding closet space , good luck not banging in to each other just to actually move around in your room . Having said that , I called down to front desk and said I need a bigger room and with great ease and a wonderful up charge . I was given a terrace corner suite over looking time sqr .
The location is not for me , the standard rooms
are seriously small don’t trust the photos from Marriott web site . But thanks to staff for finding me a great room

title: Das optimale Preis Leistung Verhältnisse nur zu 80% erreicht.
text:
7 Tage im Mai 2023. Der Times Square ist laut, auch in 35 Etage! Nach drei Tagen ist der Wow Effekt verflogen. Das Personal im Service ist freundlich und professionell. Die Rezession zu arrogant.
Zimmer sind klein, gut ausgestattet, elegant mit Bodentiefen Fenstern. Bad und WC praktisch und modern.
Gutes aber teures Essen. Frühstück im Preis Leistungsbereich angemessen zu teuer.

title: Great location!
text:
Staff was very friendly and professional. They were quick to help and suggest solutions and give new ideas. Especially Shah at the reception was overwhelmingly positive and helpful.

Location was immaculate. You could even see how long line there was on TSTK-ticket boot just looking from your window. It took around one hour from the airport (90$) the taxi. Gym was good and we had nice jog every morning in Central park. Easy access everywhere from the hotel!

title: Stolen items
text: This is the second time I have stayed and I will not be returning. Two designer things got stolen from my room and when I decided to make a claim. The hotel says it isn’t their fault and they will not do anything about it. So if you decide to go please close your bags every time before you leave or don’t bring expensive things there.

title: Mala experiencia
text: Fue nuestra segunda oportunidad en este hotel y nos robaron  un sweter y una cartera de marca  que estaba en nuestra maleta  hemos hecho varios reclamos y según ellos no responden por objetos robados en el cuarto recomiendo cerrar bien su maleta al salir ya que uno viaja a Ny de vacaciones no para cuidar sus maletas

title: The staff is amazing
text: Amazing service. Small, but nice room. So close to Tome Square you are practically in the middle of it. The food at the end hotel restaurant was so good that we ate there at least one meal a day for the four days we were there.

title: In the heart of Times Square
text:
An exceptional stay, spectacular views,
minimalistic serene design and wonderful staff.  Angelo in Guest Services was very welcoming, warm with attention to detail and just a gem.

Thank you Times Square Edition!

title: Exceptional
text:
What a phenomenal hotel, and real asset to any Edition hotels we’ve been to and a luxurious sanctuary amongst the madness of Times Square.

We checked in early, around 1130am and our room was ready!  But just going in to the hotel and in to the reception it was breathtakingly beautiful.  The lady on reception was very sweet and treated us like royalty it felt like.  We were on the 15th floor, with an outstanding view of Times Square…..it was so surreal to be in this beautiful room way above Times Square with all the lights and crowds below.  The room was just about the right size, the bed was HEAVENLY, an amazing seat with foot rest situated in the window allowing you to admire the view below.  Wonderful shower and fluffy white towels, super comfortable dressing gown, complimentary cartons of water, Le Labo amenities…..the list goes on.  There are a few bar areas to choose from, high end style with excellent customer service, we had some wine one night and nearly fell asleep on the comfy chairs!  We passed though the restaurant at breakfast time one morning and we were so disappointed we didn’t get to eat there for breakfast as it looked outstanding.  We did have dinner there one night and the food plus service was exquisite.  There is also a terraced area which we did have a peep at but as we had so much to see and do we didn’t return when it was open.  Very friendly staff, doormen were exceptionally friendly is there is not really anything you can fault!  

Cannot wait to come back for a revisit.

title: Stylish and centrally located
text:
Very comfortable.  Excellent location. Great outside terrace.  Rooms a reasonable size.  Not much privacy in bathroom area as toilet and shower just separated by glass (frosted) petitions.  Not great for friends sharing or couples worried about privacy.  Some rooms have curtains separating the wet area to the bedroom but ours didn’t.
Only used restaurant for breakfast one morning and it was excellent.  
Great views depending on room type.

title: DEFINITELY DO NOT RECOMMEND
text:
This is the lowest rating I have ever given a hotel. The reasons are all related to service. You are paying for a five-star "destination" hotel, but you would be getting two-star services.

First, there is no express check out. I had an early morning departure flight, and asked to settle my accounts at around 10pm the night before. I was told that this could not be done because the hotel's system only close out expenses for each day at mid-night and not before. In 30 years of global business travel, I have never encountered this at a hotel in this class.

Second, beware there is something shady going on with the bell service and transportation arrangements. The bell service team has its own arrangement with a driver: they told me that it would be much more expensive if I were to make transportation arrangements with the reception. Then two different bell men quoted me two different prices for the ride to Newark Airport: $120, or $100 with a 10% surcharge for credit card. On the morning of departure, a third bell man asked me "What price were you told?" Again, this is not the kind of experience I have ever had at this class of hotel.

Third, the front desk service was inconsistent. I had booked the room from Saturday to ensure that I would be able to check in when I arrived early on Sunday morning (I noted my estimated arrival date and time in the Marriott booking). When reviewing my bill the night before my departure, I noticed that on Saturday my room charge was shown as "No Show." I asked whether this could be corrected so it wouldn't cause confusion for reimbursement, the person promised he would take care of the issue. The next morning, of course it was not fixed, and I was in a rush to get to the airport. Fortunately, the early morning reception agent was much more responsible than his colleague the night before, and did ultimately email me a corrected invoice. 

Finally, I experienced incompetent and rude guest services. I was ordering room service and asked for the "Edition Lovebird Lager" that was on the menu. The woman named Claudia taking my order said it was out. So I said any beer would do. She said: "No. There is no beer." Incredulous, I asked "There is on beer in the hotel?" She said: "No." I asked "Even in the lobby bar?" She said: "No. And you are not allowed to yell at me." I wished there was recording to demonstrate that asking incredulous questions was not the same as yelling. I went downstairs and spoke with the manager. He did apologize but also stated that the specific beer was not available, but I could get another beer at the lobby bar. I went to the lobby bar and asked the bartender to recommend a beer. Guess what he gave me? The Edition Lovebird Lager.

In addition, there was the minor issue that I had requested foam pillows and got feathered ones. 

I chose this hotel for two reasons: its proximity to my business meetings, and its newness. The hotel did not really feel new: it actually was already kind of worn. And if you didn't need to be in this location, I would recommend staying away from Time Square: it is loud and touristy.

I will not likely choose to stay here again, even if it is close to where I need to be.

title: Lovely hotel, Great location
text:
From the moment we stepped inside, the signature scent hits you and its a delight all around the hotel. 

The concierge team are fantastic and cant do enough to help and assist. 

Check in and out was smooth and professional. 

The room was fine. High floor and Times Square views. We requested an iron and ironing board which was given straight away. 
Everything in the minibar and tea tray (except coffee) is chargeable but no price list so be careful. 

The location is in the heart of NYC with some great bars and restaurants close by. It was also so easy to access to the subway!

My only reason the hotel didnt get the 5* from me was due to no acknowledgement of our honeymoon. Even at 3*/4* establishments a simple card makes all the difference to create wow factors and memories to last a lifetime. 

All in all a great hotel in a great location. I would 100% stay again.

title: May be in the middle of Times Square but feels like a ***** luxury resort.
text:
Loved this property. 

There’s some narrative of micro rooms macro amenities. Not huge, the rooms still offer ample space to relax and store your things for a few days. 

What got me the most were all the amenities on site.
-Great Gym
-F&B was delicious, good service, and a robust enough menu to come back for a few meals
-Concierge team on site is so knowledgeable and was able to set me up a few last minute reservations for business dinners
-room views of Times Square, very cool without the sound. 

Amazing for business travel or when you want to be in the center of it all.

title: Amateurs
text: Payed for my room at 10:30,  5:15 still no room. I guess reservation means nothing. I need to be at a function tonight at 7pm. I guess no shower for me, no nap... But they did offer a complimentary water. Maybe I can change in the public restroom. Poor excuse very amateur.

title: Special Times at Times Square EDITION by Marriott
text: A fresh modern hotel at Times Square. The lobby is on the 10th floor where you will be greeted with very hospitable staff and a carton of spring water. The check in is slick, and perhaps you will have already done so on your Marriott Bonvoy app. The room with King bed are  spacious with an open concept bathroom counter - shower and toilet separate entrances. The rooms are bright and totally modernized with all the amenities.

title: Perfect NYC Stay at The Edition Times Square
text: I called the front desk the day before our stay to let the hotel know that we'd be celebrating my daughter's 21st birthday and that we also requested an early check-in and room upgrade if available as included in our Bonvoy Gold Elite membership.  I thought it was a big ask of the hotel manager Andrew, until we arrived at the front desk at the Edition and Vlad, who checked us in told us that we could do an early check-in to our upgraded suite and he also mentioned that the staff was aware that we were celebrating a birthday.  He also said that we could enjoy a 2pm check out. The suite was spectacular! It was a corner room on the 31st floor with a super comfortable king bed, beautiful lighting design, living room area with huge TV with free access to Netflix, Pandora, HBO and more. The suite also featured a huge balcony overlooking Times Square--gorgeous, ultimate NYC views.  The bathroom included a huge soaking tub that I wish we'd had time to use.  Plenty of storage, fluffy robes and Le Labo products. The staff of the hotel, from the doormen to the front desk and housekeepers were all super friendly and provided excellent service.  A first for us, upon check-out, once out of our room, our daughter realized that she left her NYC pickles in the room fridge.  The bellman who was helping us with our bags (I am so sorry that I forgot his name but he was a real gem!) said that he would happily retrieve the pickle for her so that she would have it when we finally left the city later (we stored our gear with the bellman for the afternoon).  When we got back to the hotel to get our stuff, the bellman handed us our daughter's prized pickle in an ice-packed bag! How very kind--what a sweet gesture! Staying there next time we are in the city for sure.

title: Kid Free NYC Weekend Getaway w/the Hub
text:
Spent an amazing NYC getaway at the Times Square Edition hotel. From the moment we arrived, the staff went above and beyond to ensure our stay was comfortable. The lobby bar offers sweeping views of Times Square and the wide array of cocktails/wines/spirits ensures there is something for everyone. The hotel is beautifully appointed and their restaurant on the 9th floor was delicious (I recommend the Burger).

Definitely looking forward to another stay at this wonderful hotel.

title: Modernes Hotel
text:
•	Sehr modernes Hotel mit freundlichem Personal und schöner Bar im wohl lebendigsten Quartier von New York
•	Genügend Transferzeit einberechnen
•	Gut gelegen, um viele Sehenswürdigkeiten zu besichtigen

title: Vacances entre filles
text:
Petite semaine à New York. L’hôtel est situé en plein Time Square (très bruyant le soir). 

L’avantage c’est d’être en plein Manhattan donc tout est à proximité ce qui est très bien. 

Le seul bémol est que time square est bruyant le soir. 

L’hôtel est propre. Les chambres sont un peu petite mais agréable quand même. 

Eva

title: Best Hotel and staff.
text:
My boyfriend recently surprised me with a trip to NYC for my birthday. We stayed at Edition Hotel in Manhattan, Time Square. The hotel was great, but the staff was wonderful and helpful. We had the privilege of meeting Ashley Carrera who was absolutely AMAZING. She made us feel welcomed. She was very personable, funny, engaging and a great conversationalist. She made you feel special. Edition, she’s a keeper so give her a raise. Keep up the good work Edition, we will definitely be back!!
Sharon and Roland Brown.

title: Zeer kind/familie onvriendelijk
text:
Zeer kindonvriendelijk.
Zoon had de sleutel van de kamer vergeten en kreeg geen copy, zelfs niet na telefoon en Whatsapp bericht aan receptie, om zijn identiteit te bevestigen.  Nul flexibiliteit.  
Liever een kind van 16 op straat zetten dan dat creatief naar een oplossing wordt gezocht.

title: Modern hotel, at super busy area
text:
Stayed here couple of nights before continuing our trip to Europe. The facade of the hotel is kind of blended with the other buildings next to it, it doesn’t really pop up. A modern foyer will lead you to the elevators which will bring you to the lobby area. Friendly check in staff. 

Our room has a partly view of the roof of other building and partly time square. Although it is up high, the hustle bustle sounds from time square is still quite audible. Room is tidy and clean. Modern bathroom. 

Housekeeper that cleaned up our room was very friendly too. 

Most place of interests are within walking distance. We definitely had pleasant stay here, but will considerate to stay in quieter area next time around.

title: Overall beautiful hotel and lovely stay with a few hiccups
text:
The first thing I will mention is that the hotel is 5 star and is expectedly, very expensive, being in the heart of Times Square. I took this into account when writing my review. If I am paying that much, my expectations would be higher than normal.

I stayed for 12 nights over the Christmas and NY period so I obtained a very comprehensive view of the hotel and everything about it.

Overall it was a very comfortable stay and the staff were always there to attend to any requests and issues.

The moment I got out of my transfer car, there was a lovely young gentleman waiting to get all my bags and transport me upstairs to the reception. The check-in was reasonably flawless but there was a bit of confusion around the payment because of resort fees the hotel charges daily. I prepaid my booking and there was confusion over whether it included or excluded the resort fee.

The reception area is immaculately presented and the bar and restaurant are both located here. I intended to use the gym during my stay, but didn't have time to even take a peek. Nor did I visit the bar or restaurant. There's way too many options outside to do that.

The very polite and courteous young gentleman then took me up to my room. He showed me everything and away he went.

I got a bit of a room upgrade which I highly appreciated and had a beautiful view of Times Square. I was on the 2nd highest floor, floor 39.

The room is not big. It was adequate for one person but nothing more. I don't think I would be able to stay here if I was with another person. It would be too uncomfortable and I had to find space for my 2 suitcases and carry-on. 

The bathroom is open plan, with a door for the shower and toilet. A big problem I had in my room was that if it was windy you will hear a loud whistle coming through the bottom of the front door. It really annoyed me. I had to take the cover off the bed and make a snake shape to block the gap underneath the door to stop the noise. Even a bath towel didn't work. They need to fix this.

The hotel is very new and the rooms are very beautifully equipped, presented and maintained. I was pleased to see that most of the things I requested before I arrived (some extra bath mats, bath towels, hand towels, face towels, mini fridge, bathroom scale) were mostly there upon arrival. I quantified the number of towels I needed as I was not getting any housekeeping during my 12 night stay but I did not get the quantity requested. I expected a bit more attention to detail for a 5 star hotel.

Before I arrived I was asked if I was celebrating a special occasion and Guest Services pushed up my expectations as I was celebrating a special occassion and they said something nice, I assume maybe a cake or some alcohol would be waiting for me in the room. When I arrived there was nothing. And there was never going to be anything throughout my stay. 

I didn't mind and only remembered towards the end of the stay. When I enquired via email I was met with silence. They addressed the rest of my email but didn't want to address that. Cheeky. And not really 5 star behaviour.

The bed was lovely and I had a great night's sleep every night. Very comfortable and quiet room. I enjoyed coming back to my room every night after a very cold day and opening my curtains to see the world go by downstairs. 

Before I arrived I asked if it was OK to get some parcels sent to the hotel. I wasn't told about fees or anything or the sort and was invited to send them to the hotel. When I arrived they asked security to bring the parcels up to my room. They did that swiftly and politely and all security staff are helpful and friendly .

The issue here was that I was being told I would be charged a $10 fee per parcel and was confronted with a few sheets of paper asking me to sign the charge. I was pressured to sign the papers and off they went. I was very concerned as I had quite a number of parcels which would have amounted to over a $100 charge.

I abruptly called the Guest Services line and spoke to a very nice lady by the name of Nephi. She was brilliant throughout my stay. She helped clarify that there would be a cost going forward from 2023 but they would waive the charge for me. This was not a good experience but Nephi made sure she sorted it out for me and I wasn't charged. 

In the lead up to New Year's Eve, I had a party in Times Square and I was well aware that anyone staying in the vicinity of Times Square would require security passes of some sort to get through the police barricades. There was no letter or information right up to the night before NYE despite me asking several times via the Guest Services Line, reception and various people around the hotel. 

The night before when I called the Guest Services line, I was told that they had just despatched all the letters to the room but I didn't get one and they missed me. They then swiftly organised to get both the letter and pass sent to me my room. Again not a good experience. Most guests who stay at the hotel on the 31st December are likely going to go somewhere and need to be able to get into and out of the hotel. You need to let people know about this several days beforehand so people know what is going on, rather than have to circle around helplessly to find the information. This was not a good experience.

Bear in mind it is incredibly busy over the holiday season so getting into and out of the hotel is not easy for those that don't like excessive crowds. I stayed here because I have never stayed in the middle of Times Square and I needed to be next to my NYE party venue so I could return to the hotel easily. 

Would I stay again? For NYE yes but otherwise I would prefer a quieter location with a larger room for normal trips, and yes it cost me a fortune to stay here so would prefer something more modestly priced for a long stay. Perhaps if there weren't so many glitches I would stay here again.

So the one star taken off was for the glitches mentioned above. Otherwise it is a very nice hotel.

title: Awesome Room Service
text: Ashley (room service) made our day! She has a vibrant and positive attitude that made us feel so warm and welcome--like we're at home. The rest of the staff has been nice and accommodating but she went above and beyond. Recommend the corner suite with balcony and oversized soaker tub.

title: What a gem around Times Square
text:
I had a spontaneous staycation with my partner just one day before our 2 months honeymoon. We had some extra points and wanted to get our vacation mood started, and we always wanted to stay at the EDITION beside times square, as it was where we met.

Stay was excellent. Even as a titanium elite, im already entitled to some small benefit, but the hotel spared no effort in ensuring my stay is beyond expectation. And beyond expectation it is.

I wont spoil what they did to me, but I was shocked times and times again. The hotel is super busy, i dont know how they manage to please just a random guest like me.

I have always loved the EDITION brand, stayed in LA and Turkey before, and each one feels very unique and conforming to the local environent. While LA was the openess theme, turkey was ocean and Mediterranean, this EDITION in times square, feels very New York, yet an Oasis for amidst the bustling city.

I also feel that team members here are empowered with decision making flexibility and discretion, that is great, because they can actually solve problem on their own instead of always seeking approval from the higher up, and thats great for guests.

I want to extend my gratitude to Front Desk Dennis and Shah, from first point of contact til the very end, it was a pleasure knowing that im being taken good care of by them..

I love this hotel, and despite not having stayed in too many EDITION hotels before, they have never once disappointed me, not once! Each time exceeding my expectation by miles. I have to mark this hotel as one of my to-stay-in hotel list in NYC now

title: Great hotel, location, and service
text: Great location for visiting NYC. This hotel is very well maintained the rooms and lobby are all impeccable and have Editions iconic scent (which we love). John at the concierge was phenomenal! He helped me get last minute flowers for my wife, which made the trip. The room service is speedy, friendly, and delicious. We will definitely be back.

title: Great hotel in Times Square
text:
Room - Clean and modern. Spot on for nyc.
Staff- nice and Courteous
Food - didn't try
Bar - nice bar by the reception, but needs to be updated to host more people and the furniture is getting dirty 
Bill boy - They are good, but they can be better. 
Location- in times Square which is great for tourism

title: Viaggio per capodanno
text:
L'hotel è ricavato in un palazzo dove la Hall è al decimo piano.
Le stanze sono davvero piccole inoltre il bagno è un tutt'uno con la camera (si può tirare una tenda per separare le due aree, non particolarmente comodo).
Il personale è come in tutta New York, poco attenti ai bisogni del cliente e poco servizievole. 
La dotazione delle camere non è da 5 stelle. Lo è quindi solo la posizione a letteralmente un passo da Times Square. Si può fare di meglio.

title: WOW, WOW, WOW - BEST HOTEL IN NYC
text:
Ok, where do I start... I normally do not like staying in the Times Square area (better to visit Times Square and stay elsewhere in NYC), but Edition Times Square is a GAME CHANGER.

We took a lst minute New Years getaway to NYC. We booked Mariott Marquis to get the full NYC New Years Eve experience, but as soon as we checked in to Marriott Marquis Times Square, we realized we made a huge mistake (I felt like we were in the middle of a 1990's stuck in a 2nd tier shopping mall)... Add long lines, cattle car mentality, zero customer service and a $2500 UPCHARGE to get a room with a NYE view (and no room by 3pm on December 28 checkin (marriott Titanium Elite status))- we decided to  run far away to seek relief....

I had heard about the EDITION HOTEL TIMES SQUARE hotel, but it was never on my radar to stay. From the moment we walked into the lobby, we knew we made the right decision.

WHAT A BREATH OF FRESH AIR... EDITION Times Square had amazing front desk staff that were attentive to all our needs... Incredible food at the Bar/ restaurant on Floor 9... CHIC / RELAXING hotels had an incredible vibe... Clean Rooms with incredible bedding and amenities.

I travle 50-60 nights a year and stay in hotels all over... EDITION Times Square was TOP OF THE TOPS.... We've also stayed at many of NYC's top hotels (St Regis, Ritz by the Park, Trump, Peninsula and many others), but Edition Times Square had an even better vibe and feel that all the others.

Again, not a huge NYC fan and definitely not a huge Times Square fan, but EDITION TImes Square, but I would go back to NYC and stay at this hotel in a heartbeat !!!

title: Poor NY
text:
Hadn´t been in town for 10 years. What a downgrade! City is a mess, dirty, packed (especially this time of year). Time Square is even messier. Stay away, go to the Hudson yards area.
The hotel is just ok. Boutique formula. Pretty diferent from Edition Miami and Istambul, by the way (this two amazing).
No lobby in the Ground level, kind of dark atmosfere, tiny room.
Staff helpful though.

title: Not suited as a business hotel
text:
Due to its location, the hotel is extremely loud at night because do time square, and currently nov 2022 - there is a massive neighboring construction on the outer part of the hotel, which is beyond loud from morning to night - which would be good to know in a description when booking. 
Would not recommend as a business hotel as you don’t have a good space to work if needed after office hours. 
Besides that, its clean as expected from the Edition hotels, rooms are small though - assuming it’s NYC Times Square standards?

title: Great location and room; Best hotel staff ever
text: Don’t let the stark street lobby put you off - staff will direct you to tenth floor actual lobby which features a communal gathering area that morphs into a bar in the evening.  Rooms are not that small as some reviewers have commented and they’re very modern with a nicely stocked minibar and free nespresso machine.  Very clean and kind of European modern in design.  Very nice shower - need to push the child guard button the shower valve for truly hot water - wonder how many guests miss this trick and think water in shower is only luke warm?  Hotel elevators work well and there is a surprisingly large and nice restaurant on the hotel’s ninth floor.  But the most striking feature of this hotel is the staff, to a person went out of their way to recognize you as a guest and ask if they can do anything for you.  Super nice bell staff, cleaning staff, and restaurant staff - very impressed with the culture or training of the team.  As nice and helpful as any hotel staff we’ve encountered anywhere we’ve ever stayed.  Hotel location is steps off Times Square and many rooms have a side view of the action.  Recommended hotel for sure.

title: Elegant and stylish
text:
Very beautiful hotel in time square. 

the staff is very good and friendly, the touch is 5 star. Rooms are very beautiful, but small, very small. (we are in NYC) 

The restaurant in the ten floor is great, peaceful and the staff is excellent. 
My cocktail and tempura calamary very well done and will be there again for the same.

title: Soggiorno stupendo in una città incredibile ❤️
text:
Hotel in pieno centro a manhattan.a 2 passi da time square. Posizione incredibile nel pieno della frenesia della New York city. Ma come varchi La porta entri in una calma, classe ed eleganza che ti fanno vivere una realtà parallela. 
Hotel pervaso da un profumo delizioso. Tutto lo staff, dalla portineria alla reception al serviIo camera estremamente gentile disponibile professionale e attento. Le camere non sono immense, ma in linea con lo standard di ny. Oggettivamente armadio piccolo, specie se come noi avevamo una camera x 4. Ma tutto sommato questo e’ stato un dettaglio presto risolto lasciando le valigie dei bambini da disfare. 
Letti comodissimi. Il servizio in camera passava 2 volte al gg. Personale attento ad ogni esigenza. Con tanto di regalo x me L ultimo gg e biglietto scritto a mano e regalo ad una bambina mentre aspettava nella hall. Ristorante ottimo. Colazione ottima. Noi abbiamo sempre prefiggo farla in camera x gestione delle bimbe. Camere silenziosissime. Sinceramente penso che più di così non si possa chiedere nulla ad un hotel. Che x altro e’ caro ma non carissimo visto la posizione. 
Cena ottima sia come panini al bar che come ristorante. Ristorante con i prezzi in linea al mercato. 
Leggendo alcune recensioni prima di partire avevo quasi pensato di cambiarlo. Menomale non lo abbiamo fatto. Perché sarebbe stato un enorme errore. Meglio di così non si può. Stupenda palestra e giardino esterno. 
Consiglio vivamente e assegno 11 stelle🎉

title: Smells awful
text: Nice enough although not loving the bathroom open to the bedroom but the worst is the fragrance they pump through the lobby and public spaces.  It’s like the worst cheap men’s cologne you can imagine on steroids.  Looking for another hotel as we speak.

title: Great Location, thats about it.
text:
We booked this hotel as it was our first trip to New York.
The location, bang in the middle of Time Square was the selling point.
We arrived early afternoon and entered what looked like a temporary entrance.
There was an employee who told us the desk to check in was on the 10th floor.
No one offered to take or help us with our bags, which I found very strange.

The check in was swift,, they take a resort fee of about £35 per day which I'd expected.
The room had a great view over Time Square.
Bed was very comfy.
What the room needs is more storage, and places to hang your coats.

We had an absolute blast in NY.

title: Excellent Hotel
text: The smell is so inviting! Small rooms but it is NYC so it is expected. The bath area left a little to be desired. No privacy here. Bar is happening but service is quick, and drinks were perfect. Great location

title: DO NOT LET BAD REVIEWS STOP YOU FROM STAYING HERE
text:
Upon arrival we were absolutely delighted to debunk some of the bad reviews about this hotel. I cannot speak for a king size room but the double queen is plenty big enough and a gorgeous room. Two adults mother/daughter so not sharing our space? Had plenty of room for a week long stay. We had two large suitcases and two carry ons and they fit in the room fine we were able to keep one large suitcase open at all times and the two carry ons open at all times and put the other away. The room has a closet and drawers for storage. We were told by the booking agent (who was really helpful) there would be no time square view because the doubles do not face that way. The guest experience manager emailed before the stay and we asked for the best view and were THRILLED with the view! Furthermore people complain about the housekeeping, literally no idea why the room was spotless and had been cleaned every time we came back also with turn down service and replacing the free waters. You have to pay a destination fee at most luxury hotels well here you can use that fee ($35.00) towards room service, a spin class, the bar/restaurant or MOMA tickets. Had a lovely time at MOMA and ordered hot tea to the room almost every night, chicken fingers meal one night, and a cheese board and tea another. These all range up under 35$ with tip and came SO FAST. What a lovely feature. Last but not least the staff are wonderful wonderful people special shout-out to Jerome who has to be one of the nicest guys ever. Door men were always great to see and the theme of the hotel is so cool after being outside in the stinky street.
Love that the lobby is lifted and never waited for elevators. Having the lifted lobby cuts down on noise smell and unwanted traffic. Would love to stay here again and will definitely look into other Editions

title: Hotel in Times Square
text: Review: Stayed here for my sons' 17th birthday. Location was amazing, beautiful views. Housekeeping was perfect, every time we left and came back the bed was made and the room was immaculate. Also, when I spoke with the housekeeper she was so sweet and helpful. Further, the Lobby bar staff was lovely. Only complaint was the food was average. The men working the door out front always helped us find a car and were so welcoming and provided assistance. I can not say enough about our experience and I feel like I am a hotel snob. Room was small, but we loved it. Thank you for a wonderful trip! Worth every penny.

title: THE place to stay in NYC
text: We have stayed at the Times Square Edition a few times now.  It is our goto place to stay when we are in NYC.  We just recently celebrated our anniversary and Ivana Zapata, Guest Experience Manager, helped us out in making our experience a trip to remember.  The service is fantastic.  You walk in from the hustle and bustle of Times Square and you enter this oasis.  There is so much to do in NYC but you start feeling that you don't want to leave this hotel, as the place is just THAT great.  Lou Tufano, the restaurant manager, was just fantastic during our time in the restaurant and really made it a special occasion.  Customer service here is the best we have received from the many Marriott properties that we have stayed at when traveling.  Great bar and restaurant atmospheres as well.  We will be going back soon.

title: L'ombelico del mondo
text:
Più centrali di così è kmppssibile: l'hotel è a pochi metri da Time Square, il centro rumoroso e incasinati di Upper Manhattan, eppure appena entrati tutta la frenesia e il rumore di NY restano fuori. Ambienti molto belli, curati e gestiti da personale assolutamente cordiale e premuroso. Le camere sono decisamente piccole ma anche qua a fare la differenza è il servizio, sicuramente di livello.
