Onestamente, l'unica pecca sono i prezzi: capisco che la qualità si paga, ma qui siamo oltre il sensato. 2 cocktail 50 dollari (per fortuna nel soggiorno son compresi 35$ di "sconto" al giorno), minibar a prezzi ridicoli, servizio lavanderia idem, colazione/cena inavvicinabili. Tra l'altro, all'arrivo chiedono un deposito cauzionale FOLLE (nel mio caso, 1.400$...)
Consigliato per turisti che vogliono partire ogni mattina dal centro.

title: Vomit & Blood
text: Stayed at this same hotel many times “before Covid”- it has changed. The room was not even sanitary. There was vomit residue in the rug and blood splatter in the curtains when we closed them. We had been giving a 4 PM checkout…but opted to leave early morning instead. We will not be returning.

title: Great choice if you want to stay in that area
text:
I stayed here for 5 nights in a room on the 39th floor with 2 beds.  I accompanied my sister on a business trip, otherwise would not have chosen to stay in such a hectic Times Square-ish location.  The hotel entrance is on 47th St., and the moment you step off the sidewalk, it was much, much quieter.  The staff is terrific all around, starting with the super helpful and nice doormen. The spaces are serene and comfortable  (not spacious by any means, but you won't hit your knees on the wall when getting out of bed either, unlike some NYC hotel rooms I've seen).
Our room had a proper bathroom door, but I think this was because we had two beds, as some other reviews I read mention that bathroom privacy is an issue if you have a one-bed room).
 Everything was super clean and comfortable, with nice Le Labo amenities.
Their is a great hand-held steamer in place of an iron, but no where to hang your clothes while using the steamer as there is no outlet in the closet.
Overall, the Marriott brands have a real lack of hooks, places to hang towels, etc that  is non-sensical and annoying (for example , at The Edition, there is exactly on peg on the wall in the bathroom, zero towel racks, and the shower glass is floor to ceiling, so no hanging anything on top of the shower either).
The wifi was reliable, the gym was excellent.
I went to The Terrace restaurant one morning for breakfast. Beautiful space! The food was good, and the service was spotty (example, we ordered an Americano, and after 25 minutes of being told it would be a few minutes, we gave up and left). Two other parties were overhead complaining about the service during that breakfast. The server himself was very nice, and I don't know if they are understaffed or just don't really have it together.
The other restaurant looks gorgeous, but it seems to have been closed since the beginning of Covid.
Overall, I'd stay here again if I needed to stay in that area, but given a choice, that ultra-hectic spectacle of a  neighborhood is not my scene.

title: Woken up daily at 6:30am by a pneumatic drill!!! It’s opposite a building site!!! Beware!!!
text:
Be prepared to be woken up at 6:30am everyday by the sound of a pneumatic drill!!!

The hotel is opposite a building site! There is huge construction taking place. I was personally very disappointed that I was not made aware of this before booking! We traveled without our children and we were looking forward to enjoying the city & enjoying sleeping! However the building work taking place is so loud that nobody could sleep through that amount of noise! The drill noise literally penetrates through your brain early in the morning everyday!!! I would strongly avoid booking this hotel if you actually want to sleep!

We did complain and we were told as they were fully booked the only alternative was a room on a lower level. We were all the way up on the 30th & so we all agreed that a lower level room would only intensify the noise. We were told we could book a different hotel, I mean who’s going to start looking for a new hotel to stay whilst on holiday abroad. We settled for a mere £100 food credit! 

I’ve left feeling so upset that we weren’t made aware of the building noise before booking. We booked with booking.com and they had no disclaimer up either. I feel absolutely cheated! I can’t believe that they are actually getting away with booking in guests opposite a building site & charging full Times Square prices. They should be ashamed of themselves for cheating customers. We paid for a few nights sleep in a hotel & that’s not what we got.

Avoid at all costs & book somewhere else. There are loads of hotels around here that aren’t opposite a construction site!

title: My NIGHTMARE experience at Time square edition
text:
DO NOT GO TO THIS HOTEL. The service I received was so terrible from the manager of the hotel up until the bell man, there rooms reek of cannabis and do not match what they portray online and my overall experience at this hotel was just shockingly terrible especially because it was my first time in New York this really ruined my experience.

They also charged my card an extra £255 days after I had left the hotel because they thought I had smoked in the hotel because of the fact that there rooms reek of cannabis. Bare in mind I do not smoke and they had no evidence of a blunt or any type of cannabis in the room yet they refused to process a refund and I had to dispute the payment.

They are unprofessional and for the location of the hotel I expected much more if it’s your first time in New York and you don’t want your experience to be ruined. STAY AWAY from this hotel.

title: Amazing Hotel
text: The Times Square Edition should be your go-to hotel for business and personal travel. Over the last few years, I have stayed at the property for ~40 stays and 100+ nights. The rooms, restaurant, bar, and fitness center are luxurious. Centrally located, you get the best parts of being next to Times Square, but with minimal noise and outside light when it's not desired. As important, the team does an incredibly job of making you feel at home. Andrea, Ivana, Vlad, Joey, and others constantly go the extra mile to make the experience special. Having stayed at most hotels in Manhattan, the Times Square Edition is by far my favorite.

title: Hard beds are considered luxury!
text: Dubbed "AN ELEVATED EXPERIENCE ABOVE TIMES SQUARE. The Times Square EDITION introduces the next generation of modern luxury".    Upon entering the property the low lighted reception desk inspired me to assumed I had found a new favorite hotel brand away from the fast passing times of the W Hotel brands that many have not been updated in the past 20 years. I was hoping to find a new modern luxury oasis for my travels and the Edition seemed to be my new haven. Entering my deluxe city view room over looking Times Square the room appeared to meet my expectations. After dropping off my luggage I arrived at the 9th floor restaurant and while the ambience was fantastic the menu offerings did not meet my desires and therefore I decided to return to the lobby bar due to it being much more social atmosphere and having a better small bite selection. As I sat at the bar enjoying a well made Manhattan I noticed the bar had small chips in the stone and it had also been mended from pieces instead of being one solid slab of stone. This caused my luxury radar to be heightened a bit as I began to take a closer look at the Edition Luxury standard. My next encounter of a sub par luxury offer by the Edition Hotel brand came when I hopped in the bed for a nights  sleep consider I needed to rise at 5am for my morning workout. I assumed it might have been the long day of traveling that was making the bes so uncomfortable but the more I tossed and turned I realized the bed was just hard as stone and a far cry away from the plush beds I was use to from the W Hotel. I could not believe this was what the Edition Hotel was calling "the next generation of modern luxury". If this was what modern luxury bedding felt like I would happily stay in the past luxury setting I had grown accustom. All a great looking hotel with excellent service but for the price of new modern luxury I would expect more luxury in the things that matter the most, beds, shower, towels ect. If you cant offer a wonderful night stay its no way no matter what the hotel looks like it cant be classified as a luxury brand, no matter how many people with money frequent the brand.

title: Excellent Hotel in the middle of Times Square!
text:
Edition

My stay at The Time Square Edition by far exceeded our expectations specially after having been disappointed with our stay at the JW Marriott, Washington DC for few days right before we checked in to this hotel in the middle of otherwise a “chaotic” center of the city. Traveling is my passion and as a Marriott Ambassador elite member, I have very keen awareness of what an exceptional hotel is. The Times Square Edition checked all the boxes for me. From the moment we arrived, the guys from downstairs immediately made us feel so very welcome! At first, I felt weird because where the Uber dropped us off looked like a creepy alley but the The Times Square Edition Staff waiting for guests there proved me wrong and made me feel at ease immediately. Shout out to Jerome Canseco for going above and beyond in welcoming us, being greeted and taking care of our luggage and collaborating with our check in, including some tips and recommendations that are totally very much out of his scope of work! Checking in on the 7th floor I believe, we were welcomed by very friendly and attentive guys. I want to specially thank Mr. Angelo Esteban for going above and beyond in accommodating our requests and being so very knowledgeable and responsive for everything that we needed to make our stay not only comfortable but definitely extraordinary! As a California traveler and a self proclaimed foodie from Los Angeles, I really wanted to make my stay here in New York very memorable. We have enlisted the help of Mr. John Sieber, the concierge to recommend and create amazing experiences for us. Mr. Sieber did not disappoint and definitely made our stay here in New York absolutely memorable not only in terms of experiences, but also his willingness to make all things perfectly planned and done. We wanted to watch Hugh Jackman’s The Music Man and MJ the musical, both of which were sold out, but he did his best to make things happen for us! His dining reservations and recommendations were totally at par for us, including our not usually our “taste” of club but glad we experienced it at the Paradise Club. Dinner at the Ardor for sure was superb and our table was excellent!
This location will remain on my top 5 locations to stay while I’m in NYC. Convenient location yet secluded from the bustle of the city once you enter. Our room was on a corner top floor of 29th with the view of Times Square and it was just amazing to wake up to in the morning and at night, the bright city lights make a very unique experience as well. Comfy beds and chic minimalist interior design as expected. 
The Times Square Edition by far is one of the most special hotels I will keep wanting to go back to, and will definitely send  all my friends and family to stay there. As a matter of fact, I’m sending my newlyweds son and his wife there this weekend to experience what I just experienced from this amazing hotel! Cheers!

title: Una Enorme, inaspettata, DELUSIONE!
text: Siamo appena rientrati da New York. Avevamo grandi aspettative in questa struttura, dove abbiamo soggiornato una settimana, sostenendo una spesa impegnativa, in quanto pensavamo fosse di una categoria superiore. È stata una grande delusione… fino da subito… arrivati alle ore 15 dopo quasi una giornata tra volo e trasferimenti vari abbiamo dovuto aspettare fino alle 16,30 in quanto la camera non era pronta… in sede di check in ci è stato pre-addebitato sulla carta di credito un importo  molto superiore al visto del soggiorno … cosa che mai nelle numerose precedenti esperienze passate presso altre catene alberghiere ci era mai capitato. La camera si presentava abbastanza difforme da quella prenotata sul sito sia a livello di metratura (pubblicizzata a 22 metri quadri) sia a livello di confort (un solo mini armadio a un’anta, con tre cassetti,  occupato quasi interamente dal banco-frigo… “locale “ doccia e “vano” bagno di circa 1 metro quadro ciascuno delimitati da vetri trasparenti opachi e da una tenda che divideva la camera da questi servizi…) … Già il secondo giorno, al nostro rientro, abbiamo trovato la camera alle 7 di sera senza che fosse stata pulita… informata la reception a tal riguardo la Camera è stata pulita alle ore 20… anche l unico servizio di cortesia compreso… due bottigliette di acqua per camera… ha lasciato a desiderare in quanto in due dei sette giorni di soggiorno non sono state proprio fornite… che dire … una bella delusione , inaspettata… la decantata vista della camera da noi prenotata su Times Square, vista a dir poco parziale in quanto vedevamo uno spicchio di scalinata parziale … Abbiamo speso circa 500€ al giorno (senza colazione!) , un’esagerazione per una sistemazione non all’altezza e come detto totalmente diversa da quella per la quale avevamo prenotato!

title: Very good if you like Times Square
text: Almost all the rooms are quite small but this is normal NYC.  Room was minimalistic like Scandinavian style.  We did not have the cheapest one but it is hard to say how those could offer much less.  At least we had a really nice view of Times Square.  That was of course a little bit noisy but otherwise the place was quiet and even AC so sleep comfort was at the right level in that comfy bed.  Location is good if you like to see Times Square and theater venues around it.  Otherwise I prefer to stay in a quieter neighbourhood.  Package price ($75) for the breakfast was outrageous.  Restaurant looked very nice but we did not have time to eat there.  Some of the facilities were still closed.  A really good place to stay but it did not feel like a 5* experience.

title: Schick mir Hindernissen
text:
Es gab leider keine Information vom Hotel, das die Zufahrt aufgrund mehrerer Sperren nur schwer bis nicht möglich ist. Das recht unfreundlich geführte Telefonat ergab nur : bringe das Auto in das Parkhaus und komme zu Fuß . Das war bei 29 Grad und fast 100% Luftfeuchtigkeit nicht lustig mit dem Gepäck durch Manhattan zu laufen. Valet hätte es auch sonst nicht gegeben.  Das deposit des Hotels bei Anreise (4 Tage, 2 Personen, KK hinterlegt) war 800$. Die Suite ist nett gestaltet, ein etwas größeres Zimmer. Das sehr angenehme plus ist der Balkon!
Der Schrank (60cm) reicht für 2 Personen für 2-3 Tage im Sommer. Zusätzlich enttäuschend: kein Tee zum Morgen! Es gibt eine Nespressomaschine , 500ml Wasser dafür zu 9$ . Plus Pappbecher. Kein Löffel etc. Das ist dem preislichen Niveau nicht angemessen. Wir schauen jetzt mal, was Gastronomie und der Rest des Hauses zu bieten haben 🤨

title: Clean hotel at Times Square
text: Times Square EDITION offered a prime location and decent view for my Memorial Day week stay. While it is rated to be a 5 star hotel, I wouldn’t say there’s anything special about it (not said offensively). My room was clean, but small. The staff were friendly, and the on-site restaurant and lounge were nice.

title: Wo bekommt man diesen Duft!!??
text:
Hotel war super 
Es gab da ein duft der das ganze hotel umschlossen hat sowas von gut ,,man könnte eine Kerze kaufen mit diesen Duft. Die hab ich aber weiß jemand ob es ein parfum gibt das diese Geruchs Note hat oder ein raumduft

title: Edition Time square
text: Low price,  tiny room size but good service and nice food. Since this is New York, it's the lowest price 5 stars hotel. I think if you come to visit friends or any business purpose,  this Edition might be a good choice. I experienced two rooms, the king size bed room facing time square and the double bed one. The double bed room is much bigger than the other.

title: Very small rooms
text: Excellent  location, courteous staff, bad room service , very small room and not worth the money one pays. No space to keep even one suitcase. Wash basin in the room. As a Level 15 Hotel Expert, I will not recommend a stay.

title: Perfecte locatie en heerlijk hotel
text: Prachtig hotel, mooie kamer, zeer proper. We zijn hier 6 nachten verbleven en enige nadeel was dat er 200$ insurance / nacht geblokkeerd was op mijn credit card zonder ons hiervan te verwittigen. (Ook niet vermeld aan receptie bij check-in, op website en Booking.com). Pas na contact name met de bank kreeg ik de info dat 1200$ extra gereserveerd was op mijn kaart door het hotel. Als tegemoetkoming voor het ongemak kregen we 200$ dat we konden spenderen in het restaurant. Houdt hier zeker rekening mee want was flinke hap uit ons budget.  Voor de rest zeer centraal gelegen en uniek hotel

title: Right on the edge of the action
text:
This is a great hotel for families as it is right in the heart of the action. 

Literally on the edge of Time Square, you are perfectly placed for Broadway theatres, and access to subways to go up or  downtown. 

The hotel room itself was great, two large queen beds were perfect for two adults and two kids for a few nights stay. The hotel atmosphere is super cool, very black and white trendy decor throughout. It’s so cool that Beyoncé had her album launch party there a few days after we left!

The concierge team also really helpful given us useful tips on getting around and places to eat. Would certainly stay here again.

title: Séjour du 3 au 7 août 2022
text: Chambre très petite. Réservation de 2 chambres pour 2 adultes et 2 enfants bas âge chambres situées 12 étages de différence. Séjour de 4 jours pas de recharge de savon ni de gel douche,avons été acheté tout ça au supermarché du coin. Dame à la réception au moment du checkout  pas souriante ni sympathique n’était pas du tout intéressée à savoir si nous avions passé un bon séjour. Seul point positif l’emplacement quoique un peu bruyant immeuble en construction en face début des travaux à 4 heures du matin

title: Wow! The best hotel ever!
text:
The most attentive staff, some days they cleaned the room twice , or came in and remade the bed, put the lights on and the tv etc for when I got back from a show, amazing facilities , the gym with the view of Times Square is a must see. 
Everyone was so polite and made me feel so welcome . Thank you so much. 
( got upgraded on arrival to a Times Square view room and it was epic)

title: Fantastic Service
text:
We stayed at this boutique hotel with family visiting from Australia. The staff from checkin, house keeping to the bar were kind, patient and genuinely cared about the guest having a great experience. A special shout out to Aaron at the bell stop who helped us find hidden gems to eat at, arranged a car service and directed us on places to go and see.

The rooms were clean and had a modern minimal esthetic. 

The location is ideal for a first time NY visit. Well located in the theatre district to book tickets and all the shopping on 5th Ave. 

We happened to stay at the Marriott Marquis a week before the Edition for one night and it was not as personable.

title: Unacceptable
text: From check in the staff were not helpful and gave us  false and wrong information. After a 14 hour direct flight, we got our rooms at 5:45PM while regular check in time is 4:00PM guaranteed and being a platinum member and a silver elite member this service is not acceptable! After 2 nights, They requested us to checkout and pack our bags to checkin to our second reservation since we added 2 more nights closer to our checkin dates, after doing all the fuss and hassle they tell us its going to be the same exact room we were actually in. I really dont think this hotel is up to the edition standard and especially a marriott bonvoy!

title: Great location but..
text: Third visit to New York and staying in Times Square. The location of this hotel is perfect if you want to be slap in the centre of the hustle. Our room was on floor 18 and opposite a construction site which was pretty noisy at times along with the craziness of Times Square but a small price to pay for a great location. The room was lovely but the most impractical to stay in with more than a few nights clothing because of the lack of space to hang/store stuff so we pretty much lived out of our suitcase for the entire time. Would not return because there are plenty of others.

title: Great Hotel on Time  Square
text:
Very nice modern clean hotel just off time square with excellent staff and amenities.if you want to stay on time square you won’t go wrong choosing this hotel and it’s location.
However I wouldn’t stay on time square again because of the homeless situation and crazy people that just seem to congregate their and it was filthy dirty and we just didn’t feel safe walking around time square.

title: Nice Hotel Close to Broadway and Times Square
text: I recently stated here on a business trip.  I actually got it confused with the Edison Hotel - don't make that mistake -fortunately, they are only about 100 yards apart.  The entrance is a bit odd -you walk down a corridor to some elevators and go up to the 10th floor to get into the lobby.  The attendants at the entrance were always friendly and helpful.  After you are on the 10th floor, you have to walk across the lobby to another elevator bank to take another elevator to your room floor.  So, if you get caught in the morning or evening crowd, you will be waiting a bit to actually get in and out of the building (especially if there are business groups that adjourn and hit the elevator/lobby all at the same time).  The location is literally a few strides from Times Square.  So, if you want to hang out with the tourist crowd and eat at the tourist food joints, this is the place.  You can easily walk around or go a few blocks to get something to eat.  I would typically leave the hotel to eat or grab takeout from somewhere and bring it back.  One oddity I found was that the room did not have an iron/ironing board.  The staff was real good about bringing one up and I kept it for the time I was there.  Overall, it was a good stay but I might not pick this place if I was staying with my family given the price.

title: Amazing hospitality, comfy bed, toiletries and Bonvoy points!
text: This is my go to property for stays in Times Square. I think what distinguishes this hotel clearly from the other properties and keeps me coming back is the hospitality and the communication. Two people who have really stood out to me so far are Andrew from front desk and Andrea Pendley who have simply been phenomenal. I look forward to visiting them again pretty soon!

title: The best in TS
text:
So, one wouldn’t really choose to stay in Times Square for pleasure, but this is the best hotel in this part of Manhattan.

It’s newly opened so everything feels crisp and modern. The service is good, the manager (think his name was Anthony) was excellent. When I stayed there were horrifically noisy building works opposite, “Anthony” was very quick to move me to the other side of the building with made a big difference.

Rooms are well laid out, everything you need. Still small by European standards but perfectly adequate for NY. 

Bell staff also great.

Didn’t eat in the hotel so can’t comment on the food. The gym was very well equipped and always empty, with free water and a great view.

If I need to be in midtown / TS, I’ll stay here again.

title: Great location, but needs work on the room and service.
text:
* First of all, nobody was waiting downstairs to greet us or take our bags when we arrived, but at least bag carts were available on the ground floor, so we grabbed one and took our luggage to the lobby on the 10th floor.
* On 10, after waiting in line for about 5 minutes to check in, a bellhop noticed us and told us that “for liability reasons,” we couldn’t handle the carts, so he would have to bring it up with us. Fine, I wish he had been down below and done the actual work to earn the tip, but whatever. For the record, I firmly believe this to be a bald-faced lie, because if the hotel were actually worried about liability they wouldn’t leave the carts alone on the ground floor. Plus, all the other Marriott properties that DO let you use the carts? So stupid.
* Then, when we finished checking in, he was nowhere to be found and our bags were still sitting on the cart, so we said screw it and carried our bags up ourselves, without the cart. We had multiple delays getting to the hotel and didn’t want to wait anymore.
* Also, during the check-in, despite having reserved the room with my Bonvoy Amex, which was on-file, but not on my person, and having used this method to pay for MANY rooms over the years and having just used the physical card for incidentals, Edition refused to do this and said the full charge would go on my physical card, which deprived me of a fair number of points.
* The room was tiny, despite my Titanium status upgrade capability, and even had a sub-par, squeaky inner-spring mattress. It didn’t keep the street noise out, either. It could use some serious upgrades and soundproofing to deserve 5-star status. Finally, despite it only getting up to 80 degrees outside that day, the AC couldn’t cool the room down to 70.
* On the plus side the Le Labo toiletries are fantastic and if you’re looking for a centrally located, downtown hotel, the location (and view from a high floor) can’t be beat. You’re a short walk from 5th Ave, Madison Ave, Broadway, Rockefeller, Grand Central, etc…

title: The place to stay!
text: Wir haben wirklich tolle Tage hier verbracht. Das Hotel liegt direkt am Times Square und lässt kaum Wünsche offen. Wir haben unseren Aufenthalt sehr genossen. Der Service war wirklich klasse. Wir wurden sehr gut umsorgt. Wir sind regelmäßig in New York und werden - wenn der Preis akzeptabel ist - sehr sehr gerne wieder kommen.

title: Times Square Stay
text: Stayed for 3 nights at this hotel recently. Fantastically located - smack bang on Times Square but once in the hotel it is very quiet and peaceful. Room small and compact but clean and with everything you need for a couple of days stay. Staff friendly and helpful. Ate dinner in the hotel restaurant The Terrace one evening, food was very good and restaurant beautiful. Good base when visiting N.Y. Looks like a very interesting club night happens on Saturdays at the hotel too - The Paradise Club, if we ever visit again we will check this out!

title: Luxury in Times Square!
text: First time to this property and it did not disappoint. Literally just steps from Times Square. Front Desk team was super efficient and friendly, granted us an early check-in and had helpful suggestions for a nearby lunch. Elevators were fast and never crowded. Would definitely return here when travels bring us to the city & need to stay near Times Square.

title: Do not waste your money
text:
We had stayed at The Edition close to Madison Square Garden and had wonderful stay.  We were going to see Tina the Musical and decided to stay at this location in Times Square.  What a huge mistake!!!!!!  The only good thing was we were on the 36th floor and had a great view.  I realize NYC hotel rooms are small, this was beyond small.  Our master bedroom closet is bigger than this room was.  There was no space to put luggage, the "bathroom" was a joke.  It was a glass partition with a shower on one side and the commode on the other side, it was awful. If one of was sitting at the desk and we wanted to get by, the person at the desk would have to move or someone would have to walk on the bed to get by. There was no space on the vanity to put anything making it nearly impossible to get ready.  They don't have ice machines, you have to call guest services and they bring ice up to you.  So you have to tip them every time, which is ridiculous!!!

We went to the bar on the 10th floor just to have a beer and an appetizer.  The menu had a VERY limited selection.  We ordered the cheese plate for $16.  It was like no cheese plate I have ever seen.  Had maybe 10 grapes and extremely small pieces of like 3 cheeses certainly not worth $16.

We checked out on Sunday the 22nd.  They charge $200 a night for incidentals.  They charged our card $400 and said the charges would be refunded in 3 to 5 business days.  It is now Sunday the 29th and not only have the charges not been refunded,  they have charged the card another $400  as of yesterday.  They are saying that the credit card company has to release the charges, the credit card company says the hotel has not notified them of anything.

We used points for the stay and I told the manager I felt like the entire stay should be refunded.  He "generously" refunded 20,000 points which makes up for NOTHING. Of course those points have not showed up in our account.  We absolutely positively will not stay at this hotel ever again.  This was our first trip back to NYC since Covid and we were really looking forward to this trip The Times Square Edition did NOTHING to make us feel special at all.  The whole mess with the credit card has made it even worse and they apparently doing nothing to fix the problem.  The Edition is a great chain and we have always had great experiences in other locations, but this one does not live up to the customer service we are used to!!!!  There are plenty of other great hotels in Times Square, do not waste your money at this property.

title: Almost perfect
text: Gosh I loved this hotel. I wasn’t crazy about staying in Times Square (I hate TS), but it ended up being fine. I had read many reviews on this hotel prior to staying, so was kind of prepared for the experience. The doormen on the ground level entrance were friendly and always with a greeting and a smile. Once you enter the hotel the scent that so many have talked about subtly hits you. I loved it. Check in was fast and super friendly and I was offered bottled water. I went early expecting to store my bag, but I was allowed an early check-in which is always appreciated. I can’t say enough about the sleek, modern design of the hotel. I truly loved it. It has a sexy, youthful Miami Beach vibe that was wonderful. Elevators are always available and whisk you up to your room. I booked through a third party and was hopeful for a small upgrade, but prepared for just an entry level room. I try to book through the Marriott app when I can, but the price difference through the third party was about half of what the Marriott rate was, so third party it was. I was given a king room on the 15th floor with a very nice view of Times Square. The room was spotless and, again, very sleek with a minimalist approach to design. Extras that you expect in 5 star properties were there: robes, mini-bar, steamer, and bottled water. I loved the Le Labo toiletries, also with the hotel’s signature scent. The bed was incredibly comfortable with very nice linens. The bathroom was partially connected to the room with just a curtain from the wash basin area. The toilet and shower are in stalls with frosted glass doors. It was actually one of the larger hotel rooms that I’ve had in Manhattan. Not large, by any means compared to hotel rooms in other cities, but for NYC quite allright. No turndown service was ever offered, but I never requested it either. Housekeeping was invisible and very efficient. Once, while waiting on an elevator on the 10th floor lobby, I was asked by a gentleman how my stay was going. I thought he was just another guest being friendly, but it turns out he was the GM of the hotel. I had breakfast in the hotel restaurant every morning of my 3 night stay. The restaurant is truly beautiful, service good and the food I would describe as good, not great, but overall fine. My stay was perfect until the last night of my stay, which was a Saturday night. Around 11:30 pm I noticed that there was a lot of noise below the room. At first I thought it was just the revelry from Times Square on a Saturday night, but once I tried to go to sleep I realized it was coming from inside the hotel. The hotel nightclub was evidently below my room and the noise level was obnoxious. Thumping bass, a DJ on a PA system and shrieking party goers made it absolutely impossible to sleep. I finally realized that falling asleep was not going to happen and called the front desk. The receptionist was genuinely apologetic and offered to send up earplugs or allow me to move to a different room for sleeping. I tried the earplugs, which did nothing, and finally at 2:30 am I asked for keys to another room. They were promptly sent up and I walked up to the new room and finally was able to get some sleep. The next morning I called and spoke with a manager and voiced my complaint of why on earth they would have someone occupy that room on a Saturday night. He was apologetic, but the damage was done. I asked for 60k Marriott points (which I thought was very reasonable) which is the equivalent to one nights stay in the hotel. He granted this without hesitation. I checked out later that morning and went to the Ritz Carlton Central Park. Luckily, I wasn’t dragging from little sleep, so I was still able to still enjoy my vacation the next day. I would definitely return to this hotel, but would be very wary of room assignment, especially if you’re staying on a Saturday night. The unfortunate incident still didn’t effect my overall impression of the hotel too much, as the rest of the stay was perfect. A stunning hotel with fantastic service, just get a higher floor (there are 39) if staying over on a Saturday night. I’ll be back.

title: In the heart of midtown..
text:
If you are looking for a hotel that is near the theater district look no further. We stayed 2 nights & exhausted ourselves.  It’s exceptionally clean, a quiet oasis from the frenetic Times Square that you probably came to see. My husband has mobility issues and was able to  navigate through unusually large crowds. & traffic  We saw Funny Girl & Mr. Saturday Night. Billy Crystal is amazing & deserves that 2022 Tony Nomination.  Also managed to get in a visit to the Guggenheim. Go for the Frank Lloyd Wright architecture & see Vasily Kandinsky. 
I’m giving the hotel a 4 star rating rather than a 5. The breakfasts were not quite what I expect with a hotel of this caliber. Just meh. Ask for Fernando if you need help with taxi service. Friendly & made me laugh.
Yes, the hotel is pricey ( it’s graduation time ) and yes it is crazy midtown but you are in Manhattan. We travel to experience something new not to relax when we visit  . BUT the hotel is a quiet place to relax. Get a high floor, look down at Times Square.

title: Not a 5 Star.  Maybe 3
text:
I never write reviews, but feel compelled this time. 

Sure it’s clean and near Time Square, but the quality and size of room is not even up to 3 star standards.  It really makes me question the rating system and Marriott who operates the Edition chain.  

The room has no separate bathroom.  The sink is next to the bed and the shower and toilet open right into the bedroom.  The walls between shower and small toilet area are opaque glass providing no privacy.  A 5 star hotel and not even its own bathroom?  Horribly misrepresented.

Last time I had a sink in the bedroom it was a Howard Johnson and that was the extra sink (and they had fried clams).    Shame on you Edition and Marriott.

title: Just amazing
text:
O novo 5 estrelas de Manhattan não desilude. Localizado no centro de Manhattan com todos os restaurantes e lojas a apenas a alguns minutos a pé, o The Edition é sem dúvida a melhor escolha para se ficar. 
Empregados extremamente bem educados. Lobby e quartos muito bem decorados (apesar do quarto ser minúsculo).

title: The Edition Always Satisfies My Needs As A Bougie Gay
text:
No matter what city you’re in, you can always count on The Edition to make your stay worthwhile! Even though I live in NYC, I like to treat myself every now and then to a staycation and almost always choose The Edition to fulfill all my needs. On my most recent stay, I was blown away by the thoughtfulness and care of Dennis Benjamin who works in Guest Experience. He was so polite and professional and wanted to make sure I gave him the praise and recognition he deserves.
Fun fact: there are 2 Editions in NYC in very different neighborhoods. Check them out!

title: Time Square too noisy
text:
Consiglio questo hotel per alcuni elementi: personale gentile ed efficiente.
Pulizia delle stanze e degli spazi comuni.
Camere piccole e bagni piccoli ma efficienti. 
Ottima colazione ( non a buffet) servita al 9 piano nella bella sala/veranda.
Bella vista della camera, eravamo al 39’!piano. 
La vicinanza con Time Square non l’ho apprezzata per l’eccessiva confusione e anche  rumore nelle stanze ad ogni ora del giorno e della notte.

title: A getaway inside of Times square
text: This place certainly represents what the EDITION brand is. The entrance is in busy Times Square but as soon as you walk in you feel relaxed with the Le labo scent and minimalistic decor. The service here is top notch and very personable and it all starts with the upper management. Riley (front office manager) is a class act and you can tell he leads his team by example, I’ve seen him at the reception desk, front doorway in the cold or just waking around the lobby greeting guests! Jeffrey and Beck( lobby bar managers) are the same leading by example whether it’s bartending serving or interacting with guests. Some more people who stood out to me are John from concierge with very quick but personable service. Joel from the restaurant who is a true profesional at his job whether it’s connecting with his guests or knowing the menu like the back of his hand! The restaurant terrace and gardens is amazing also. I went there for my birthday dinner and breakfast twice and wish I could’ve went a couple more times if my trip was longer. I highly recommend the crème brûlée French toast with the blueberry jam on the side! Joey and Jerome from the bell team are amazing and remember me every time I stepped back in the hotel and greeted me by name and asked how my time in New York has been going. Bryan from reception was very efficient at his job while checking in a line of people but still delivery personable service. Overall this is the place to be in Times Square for good service and great pictures!

title: No problems at all.
text:
After missing our flight to the Maldives, we decided to stay at The Edition for a day before attempting our next Qatar flight the next day (if you want to make a Qatar flight from JKF, you better get there 3hrs or more in advance).
We actually initially went to the other The Edition (which i LOVE) on Madison Ave, by mistake because i didn't realize there was one in Times Square. 
Nonetheless, the bellhop helped us find the hotel, helped us through check in etc. The hotel itself is well appoint enough for a one night stay. We live in NY, so we weren't really going to TS to sightsee, nothing to see there anyway.
Yes, i understand the rooms are small but it's TS, same way your room may be small in Paris.
You're in NYS, specifically Manhattan, you shouldn't need to spend a dime on room service. There's food ALL over and around the corner. There's a chicken and rice spot i love on 53rd and 6th, check it out.
All in all, excellent staff, excellent hotel. Hmmm i don't think we'll go there again unless we miss another flight but it's def worth staying there if you're coming to NYC to sightsee.

title: 4.5 Stars
text:
If you are looking for a 5 star hotel, this is not your destination. 

Excellent location, excellent staff service, but things are missing: It does not have a SPA/Pool/Wellness Center or similar. Breakfast is a la carte, but it is perhaps too "pretentious". We ordered a rather bad egg sandwich, a "normal" coffee, and a mediocre orange juice. For example. 

The rooms are fine, but they lack spacious closets, so you can't hang all your clothes. There are only 3 drawers, so it's not remarkable either. The bed is big and comfortable, and the pillows are fine. Cleanliness 4/5. 

Perhaps things are missing to reach the category of 5 stars. It has a very complete bathroom, fantastic shower, and many amenities. The best thing about the room is the view over Times Square. 

It is appreciated that the TVs are modern, which allows the use of Netflix, HBO and others. 

We stayed at 2 rooms, floors 34th & 37th.

Español: 

Si buscas un hotel de 5 estrellas, este no es tu destino.

Excelente ubicación, excelente servicio del personal, pero le faltan cosas: No tiene SPA/Piscina/Wellness Center o similar. El desayuno es a la carta, pero quizás demasiado "pretencioso". Pedimos un sándwich de huevo bastante malo, un café "normal" y un  zumo de naranja mediocre. Por ejemplo.

Las habitaciones están bien, pero carecen de armarios amplios, por lo que no puedes colgar toda tu ropa. Solo hay 3 cajones, por lo que tampoco es destacable. La cama es grande y cómoda, y las almohadas están bien. Limpieza 4/5.

Quizás le falten cosas para llegar a la categoría de 5 estrellas. Tiene un baño muy completo, una ducha fantástica y muchas amenities. Lo mejor de la habitación es la vista de Times Square.

Se agradece que los televisores sean modernos, lo que permite el uso de Netflix, HBO y otros.

Nos alojamos en 2 habitaciones, pisos 34 y 37.

title: Excellent staff = Excellent experience
text:
Totally impressed with the staff and experience at the Edition hotel - Times Square.  My wife and I received a nice and genuine greeting.  The check-in process was informative, friendly, and efficient.  We received excellent recommendations from John at the concierge desk, and VIP treatment from Samantha in Room Service.

Overall, I was blown away by the hotel staff.  All hotel employees were friendly, knowledgeable, efficient, and  excellent customer service.  

I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Times Square.

title: The best Luxury experience in Times Square
text: This team is outstanding and the hotel is truly a standout experience in Times Square. Staff are helpful, friendly, and genuine. Special shout-out to Maribel in Housekeeping who worked around my schedule and left me a wonderful little note after she was done. Will be back soon!

title: This hotel scammed me
text:
We ordered a room, and the clerk at the hotel said the room is on the small side and recommended we order another one, and they will contect the two rooms on arrival.
So, we arrive at 1am from a 6 hour flight with two little tired kids, and the receptionist tells us they couldn't fulfill my request to connect the rooms, and that he can provide separate rooms only.

I tell him that I can't put a 6 Year old and a 2 year old in a separate non connected rooms, the guy answers that it would be my choice.

So now i have to pay for a room i can't use. It's not like I have any choice at 1am with two kids.
I feel like I was scammed.

The receptionist didn't do any effort to solve the situation. His solution was to put the kids in a separate room. I am still not sure if this was out of stupidity or cruelty, but I will not come back to this place.

AVOID

title: BAD EXPERIENCE: PREJUDICED AND UNPREPARED STAFF
text:
The hotel is clean, well located and has a good structure.
However, it is easy to see the lack of preparation and lack of training and management of employees.
If on the one hand some are kind, others are disrespectful and prejudiced.
At breakfast, for example, the main waiter who was serving the mornings of March 18, 19 and 20 (unfortunately I don't know his name) is rude and prejudiced. That person lacks a lot of training and management. Serves rudely, without looking at the customer. In an aggressive tone of voice. It's so gross it's impossible to describe. I should have filmed that. When he realized that my wife and I were Latinos, when I asked a question about the menu, he aggressively answered: "Look at you guys, the cheapest are those". I wasn't even talking about money, and my breakfast was included in the reservation.
At the front desk, something very similar happened. The attendant, Miss NICOLE, a young woman in her early 20s. Desperate, monosyllabic, rude, arrogant. Horrible.
I suggest you guys train your employees more and manage their behavior with customers.
The service must always be with a smile on the face and seeking to kindly meet the demands of customers. Please managers and owners, think about that!
IF YOU'RE LATINO, DON'T GO TO TIMES SQUARE EDITION: THEY ARE PREJUDICED, BAD TRAINED AND ARROGANT.
It was one of the worst experiences we've ever had.

title: In the heart of Times Square
text: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel. Clearly, it is right in the middle of Times Square and our children loved being in the middle of everything. We found the staff, specifically the doorman, to be very friendly and helpful. We had two side by side rooms. I do prefer connecting rooms for our family of 5 and we were told that configuration is not available at this hotel. The rooms are relatively basic and compact as expected in the middle of NYC. We ate at the Terrace restaurant which was a nice experience. Housekeeping was reliable and the desk staff were helpful. We didn’t visit the gym or lounges. I will definitely consider staying here again in the future depending upon our room needs.

title: Fine but nothing special
text:
Rooms are tiny
The bathroom is non existent as literally is prt of the room
Service was stream less 
The location is not the best if you are not looking yo be close to broadway
Lobby, bar and restaurant are nicely done
Good Tequila selection on the shelf at the lobby bar 
Did not full fill expectations for an Edition Hotel

title: Perfect location for your Broadway show vacation!
text: A minimalist hotel that is in the perfect location for your Broadway vacation!  You will never know it's here.  Make sure you try their AMAZING restaurant called The Terrace as it is the most beautiful setting and you'd never know you were in NYC!

title: Fantastic and friendly hotel
text:
I visited New York for the first time, staying at time square edition with my twin sister. Uk 

We have had the best experience in NEw York. 
The hotel was lovely from start to finish, 
The room was lovely, so clean, the bed was so comfy, the restaurant, the food the bar area, it was all perfect.
The reception staff, the concierge, house keeping were all so friendly, the door men too, nothing. Was to much, the service all round was fantastic.we will defiantly stay here again. The location os perfect. 
I high recommend anyone who wants to stay in time square to stay here. It’s perfect. 

,

title: Times Square Treasure
text: Not a big fan of staying in heart of Times Square, but friends selected EDITION.   Very pleasantly surprised by this quiet, elegant, stylish boutique hotel.  Rooms small but comfortable, quiet, very clean  and  well appointed.   Bars and restaurants are impressive spaces and ideal to unwind from the busy streets.  Minute you walk in you just sense a calm and relaxed place.  Accommodating and welcoming staff.  Will definitely return!

title: Peace above Times Square
text:
For all the hatred the position of the hotel gets, it is pretty good for Times Square. Way above the melee below, on the 39th floor with a view of the city, I found a measure of peace. 

Yes it’s all a bit much after a while: the overpowering ubiquitous Edition scent pumped through the air system, the fake green wall (guys, really?) and the manufactured “cult” feel. But it’s a solid hotel. 

True the rooms are tiny, unless you’re in one of the corner suites. Your suitcases will be in the corridor by door. And God help you if there are two or more of you per room. There is no bathroom really, just an open plan counter top with a sink and two glass cupboards - one with a toilet, the other with a shower. But this is Midtown New York and it is a brand new hotel. I didn’t really expect much else. 

Staff were variable. Some appeared flustered and impatient when asked to do something (note to Marriott: this is marketed as a luxury tier property, I don’t care how trendy it is). Others were sweet and thoughtful, like the one who gave me a 39th floor room to celebrate my 39th birthday. 

The B&O speaker is a nice luxury touch - rather than the cheap Bluetooth speakers you normally get in hotels. The glass I looked out of to my City View was not just dirty but also covered in flecks of paint. I know this is New York but I stress again to Marriott: this is marketed as a luxury tier in your collection. 

The robes are amazing. The towels are underwhelming. The Le Labo toiletries are decent. The bedding is good. 

The bar and restaurant were pretty dead, which is surprising for a new place in New York. Didn’t eat or drink there but perhaps better in warmer weather. 

The gym is decent, well stocked and has a great view - which is a genuinely rare and luxury touch. Many five stars chuck their gyms into windowless spaces. 

I’d stay here again, but the rates are currently too high.

title: Unfussy Luxury
text: The Edition is my favorite go-to hotel.  We stayed at the West Hollywood  Edition in November and have been dreaming of it since.  Coming to NY for a long weekend I first looked at the locations available in Manhattan.  Time Square would not be a go-to for me, but to stay at The Edition made that all better.  Upgraded to a high floor overlooking Time Square was nice.  The room is small, but it’s NY.  So clean and light feeling.  Everyone here was amazing!  From the time we arrived the doorman took us up to check in and even to our room to help with baggage.  The housekeeping was amazing- including a nice note when we got back on day 2.  Can’t say enough good things about this hotel!  Can’t wait to try another location of The Edition!!

title: Great recovery!
text:
After a very rocky start, thanks to Daniel, (Front Office Supervisor) things got better and quickly.
if you need to book a queen room be ready for a closet size space.
If you can afford a corner suite stay there.
It is aTime Square property so be ready for the noise.
It appeals to millennials and those who think vive is more important than substance.
Modern, somewhat minimalist.
Kind staff.

title: New Shoes gone missing from our room
text:
The stay would have been great if it wasn’t for one important issue. A pair of brand new shoes went missing from our room.
I did a lot of shopping during the visit and missed one new bought shoe box wasn’t there when packing. When on the flight home I go over the shopping expenses and realize. As we land I call the hotel immediately assuming the box will have been found in our room. Nobody knows nothing. They say they will call back. Nobody calls back. I mail them, no reply.
At this point I’m shocked and not sure how to proceed.

title: Stunning hotel with welcoming and friendly staff
text:
My boyfriend booked this hotel for a surprise trip to NYC for my 21st birthday and our entire experience was perfect. The hotel staff couldn’t do enough for us, both, when we arrived to check in, as well as any queries we had through email prior to the trip. Our room was stunning, modern and overall just exceptional with an amazing view of Times Square. The guys on the door were always attentive and always ensured any issues we had were solved as well as the staff and manager who checked us in being super helpful and professional. 

We can’t thank the staff enough for making our trip so enjoyable and I’m so grateful for the extra mile they went to, from everyone wishing me happy birthday to all the other things they did for us! We can’t wait to return to NY and when we do, Times Square Edition is definitely where we will be!

title: Top Tier Hotel Stay!
text: I’ve always had Executives rave about this hotel and I was able to stay here recently and could not recommend this hotel enough. First, every staff member is helpful and pleasant. The lobby bars are great places to hangout and meet people.  I love the le labo amenities and how clean , elegant and beautiful your bedroom is, the lobby and hotel spaces.  The food is always delicious and it’s truly a  top tier hotel. Definitely my go-to for work and pleasure. It is also pet friendly and I was able to bring a dog who was truly spoiled here. The only drawback is being so close to Times Square and construction but you can literally walk to 6th avenue and avoid the madness.  Otherwise, 5 stars alll the way. This hotel will ruin any other hotel for you!  Could not rave about it anymore!

title: Mehr Schein als sein….
text:
Das Hotel hat eine gute Lage, zentral am Times Square gelegen.
Das Design ist ansprechend und die Zimmer sauber.

Wieso ich dennoch ein „mangelhaft“ gebe resultiert aus der unglücklichen Verbindung eines völlig unfähigen Managements, welches durch einer völlig gestörter Selbstwahrnehmung in welcher die Lage als zentrale und wichtigste Eigenschaft gesehen wird.

Das Personal legt die für die USA oberflächliche Freundlichkeit auf, ist jedoch mangels Schulungen völlig überfordert und kann den Service welchen man bei dem Preisniveau erwartet nicht erreichen.

Besonders negativ zeigt sich das „Lügen“ oder wie der Amerikaner sagt, das „Bull-Shiting“ im Edition wird versucht das von ihnen gebuchte Zimmer als  „complimentary Upgrade“ verkauft. 

Bei der technischen Ausstattung ist anzumerken, dass dass Deign im Vordergrund stand, jedoch die Funktion außer acht gelassen wurde. 
Dies macht sich durch Wartezeiten am Lift von bis zu 10min bemerkbar um von der Lobby (10 Stock) auf Straßen Niveau zu kommen. Die Aufzüge zu den Zimmer sind auch nicht besser.

Auch beim Restaurant, dass gleiche Bild, ansprechendes Design aber auf den Kaffe wartet man 30 Minuten. 

Die angeboten Speisen und Getränke sind von ausreichender Qualität, spiegeln aber nicht annähernd die Preise, welche dafür genommen werden wieder und diese lassen sich auch nicht durch dem NYC-Aufschlag erklären.

Im ganzen eine unerfreuliche Erfahrung.

title: Hidden gem in the heart of the Theater District
text: A classy & chic place to stay in this part of Manhattan. The theaters are at your doorstep but you can escape to this hidden gem; “hidden” because of its unassuming entrance on a side street. I almost wasn’t sure I was in the right place. Also we always struggled to find decent fine dining here…the restaurant and its staff are truly top notch- the wait staff superb! It’s a day later and I’m still dreaming about dinner. The rooms are small but smart & elegant. All the staff are exceptional. The porter, Jerome, went out of his way to make us feel like we were regulars despite our 24 hour stay. We will be back:)

title: Posizione perfetta
text:
Hotel eccezionale a meno di 20 mt da Time Square
Design, Lusso ed attenzione per il cliente si fondono rendendo il soggiorno bellissimo
La colazione in terrazza e’ un’esperienza indimenticabile, così come le cene nello stupendo ristorante al nono piano.
Camere piccole ma confortevoli e lussuose
Unico, piccolo, neo, armadio veramente piccolo
Consigliatissimo, ci tornerò

title: One of the best
text: One of the best Marriott properties I’ve ever stayed. Front desk agent was nice enough to recognize my platinum status and upgrade us to Times Square view room. Stuff were extremely friendly, rooms super clean and service was the best. I would definitely stay here again.

title: So sad...
text:
The Hotel and the style are pretty nice. Unfortunately, 2 things make this Hotel an absolut no go, especially for the high price.
1) Directly next to the Hotel is a massive construction side which is operated 24/7. The noise is so disturbing that you cannot sleep even with closed windows. You even suffer from this noise during breakfast.
2) The staff is really not interested in the guest well being. They are unfriendly and give you the impression that you are not welcome.

title: Great Experience Overall
text: Great long weekend stay at the EDITION.  We had a 17th floor corner balcony suite.  The view was great-- looking directly down 47th Avenue to the river.  The rooms are meticulously designed with every detail considered.  Our suite had a large soaker tub, separate shower, and heated floors in the bathroom.  Beds were very comfortable.  The automatic drapes were a nice touch. Staff was very responsive, especially housekeeping.  Breakfast at the Terrace was very special the first day as we were sat on the terrace, but the second day in the dining room, the service declined.  The food quality was consistently good.  It would have been nice to have a few kid-friendly options on the breakfast menu....a waffle, some cereal perhaps?  There were no room service menus to be found, not on the app, not on the website, not on the TV...so we never ordered.  Too many options right outside. We found it odd that there was no coffee in the lobby in the morning.  The in-room Nespresso machines are convenient, but not the same as a hot cup of joe.  The rooms are noisy.  No question about it.  And ours had a huge digital billboard right outside, so even with the blackout drapes there was plenty of light to read with all the lights turned off.  I would suggest the hotel include a sleep mask and earplugs in the welcome kit.  We bought our own at Duane Reed.  This hotel is a great location for seeing everything in midtown.  We will definitely stay again, but may sacrifice the view for a bit better sleep quality.

title: Girls first NYC trip
text:
We booked the two-bedroom suite for a girls trip to Broadway.  Amazing views of TS from the 37th floor, our daughters were in love.  The guest relations even arranged for birthday decorations and a treat in the rooms. 

Hotel staff was amazing, even when the request was coming from a 12 year old.  My daughter had asked for some items and they were brought up within minutes.  The doormen even whished her friends happy birthday as we walking in and out during our stay.  Room service was some of the best we have ever had, breakfast was perfect.

Our only disappointment was  parking.  We drove down, and I am very familiar with NY as family lives in Manhattan. Upon booking, valet parking was available according to their website.  While it may seem like a small thing, when your arriving with children and a car full of bags it can be very frustrating.  The street its on is under construction and is one lane only, so your blocking traffic as your unloading.  The parking lot is close, only a 5 minute walk or so.  On the day of departure, as we lug all our gear out with our luggage and shopping bags, there are no doorman to be found. 

It leaves a bad taste to stay in a luxury hotel and then at the end of our trip we are dragging our items across TS to our parking garage.

title: Excellent Friends Trip!
text: Excellent hotel, rooms are beautiful, facilities great and all the staff were amazingly helpful, special shout-out to the doormen who are so welcoming!! Make sure you check out the bar and Terrace Garden restaurant, you won’t be disappointed!

title: Wonderful experience during honeymoon stay in New York City
text: My wife and I had a wonderful experience staying at the Edition on our recent stay in New York City.  While its right next to Times Square, the hotel rooms are very quiet.  The GM of the hotel was kind enough to arrange for a special cheese board and some festive decorations for our room to make our honeymoon stay extra special.  The staff are excellent, the views are exceptional, and the overall ambience and cleanliness is superb.  I would definitely stay here again on my next visit to New York.

title: Incredible Location and Spectacular Food & Drink Options!
text:
This was my first trip back to NYC since COVID and this hotel provided the warmest welcome! I flew solo into town on a whim to see Lady Gaga and Tony Bennett at Radio City. I had two main criteria when I was booking my hotel: that I could easily (and safely!) walk to Radio City and that there was at least one in-house source of food. It's crazy how many hotels in the city still haven't reopened their restaurants and I wanted to be able to get a meal without leaving my hotel if I had to. 

When I discovered the Edition, I was immediately drawn to the photos I saw of The Terrace bar/restaurant. It was stunning! It was just as beautiful in person, and I really enjoyed the dinner and drinks I had there!  The service was great and everyone was very attentive. I also had drinks in the lobby bar a couple of times and enjoyed that space as well. There is an outdoor option for drinks and food at the Terrace as well as a small outdoor space for drinks off of the lobby bar. Especially from a COVID perspective, it was great to have the option to enjoy a meal or a beverage outside.

The rooms are very small, but as a solo traveler, I didn't mind! They are very comfortable and welcoming. I loved the artfully draped throw blanket- it makes it seem so cozy! The rooms are designed to maximize the space you do have and the storage solutions in the room are creative and get the job done. 

The location of the hotel can't be beaten! I booked a high floor superior room with a view of Times Square and ended up on the 30th floor. It was very quiet up there and I could also see out to the Hudson River, which was lovely! It was a quick walk to Radio City and I felt very safe, which was so important as a solo female traveler!

I got room service breakfast the morning I was flying home and it was insanely good. I STILL think about the pancake I had, that's how delicious it was!

This hotel is a gem and I can't wait to return! I'm actually heading back in a couple of months and bringing my daughter along for a fun mother/daughter trip. I looked at a few other hotels with slightly bigger rooms for that trip, but I quickly came to realize that the location, convenience, and service of this one are unparalleled anywhere in the city.

title: Super Clean & Brand New Everything
text:
First off I'm a germophobe, so I looked for a newly built or renovated hotel in NYC.  I found this hotel and I was soooo happy the moment I walked into my room on the 21st floor overlooking Times Square.  We stayed Friday to Monday, so there was plenty of action the entire time.  Some noise at night which quickly faded.  The housekeeping did an amazing job cleaning our room... not even a droplet of water would be left in the shower, replacing all the toiletries and wiping the entire room bathroom sink clean.  The whole hotel has this lovely scent, which I believe is their signature scent that is also in their toiletries.  I could smell it from down the block when I walked towards the hotel.  The staff is friendly, courteous and helpful... walking down the block to hail us a taxi whenever we needed one.  Always greeted us with a smile.

Rooms are small as you expect NYC but it was so efficiently designed with clean lines and great storage solutions.  If you love modern and minimalistic designs you will love it here.  The entire place is immaculate.

We had room service and ate at the hotel restaurant, and it was all amazing.  It's gourmet food, freshly prepared and plated up so elegantly.  Even the coffee there was 5 star and I am a coffee connaisseur.  I only drink dark roasted, ground coffee and I was pleasantly surprised.  The food quality is superb here.  Most hotel food tastes like it came out of a box, but that is not the case here.  It is a tad expensive, 18% gratuity automatically added for room service.  They come right back and get your tray when you are done eating, which keeps the place clean in the rooms and hallways free of bugs like I see in other hotels when food hangs around too long.

Even though the hotel starts on 10th floor, the elevators were super quick going up and down.  Can't beat this location either 47th & 7th, walk out to everything - food, starbucks, Disney Store, Friedman's, Big Bus Tour pickup at the corner, street entertainment.  EVERYTHING.  

Foot police presence made me feel very secure as a tourist.  We had to stop NYPD for directions several times and they were always cordial and helpful to direct us where we wanted to go.

title: BEST HOTEL IN NEW YORK
text:
This is our first trip in 3 years since the corona and we were a little bit anxious,so I correspond a lot with the hotel and they gave me very detailed answers which really make me want to already be there.
The moment you entered the hotel ,you feel that it is high level hotel,the 2 doorman in 1 second assist us with our several luggages,the smell,is amazing at the hotel
They asked me in email what time is landing our flight and it was really very early,10 minutes after our landing I received a message that our room is ready plus they upgraded us to high floor 34.
I don’t take it for granted the early check in,specifically those days  they have so many protocols to clean and prepare a room ,so a HUGH THANK
They upgraded us to a premier room at 34 floor 
The room is really clean,smell amazing,a little small for us specially we have many luggages,but we are trying to manage with the space.
The design is beautiful,all so modern ,the view is AMAZING 
I sent many requests and received all of them in MINUTES,a big BRAVO 
IT Is very easy to communicate with them and they are so efficient,a real 5 stars hotel
The breakfast at their garden is wonderful,really worth to try it,great food excellent service plenty of food
We were supposed to move after 2 nights to another hotel for 3 more nights  but with such welcoming and PERFECT SERVICE we decided to extend our stay at this hotel
We are celebrating our 18 anniversary and the first day they sent us sweets and a bottle of Prosecco,and a lovely written by hand note (not typed with computer)so thank you so much,really appreciate it
We used to travel a lot in New York and will do it again and we would love to come back to this hotel ,we tried a lot of hotel in New York ( including,the Waldorf Astoria ,the Loews few times) but this is the BEST HOTEL by far we ever have been and definitely BEST SERVICE ,best personal touch a Hugh CHAPEAU to all the staff
I highly recommend it,looking forward to continue our stay and enjoy it thank to all the personal at this hotel.
Also usually there is always a long wait for elevator in NEW YORK HOTELS but here it is less that 1 minute and the elevator is already here
So if you come to NEW YORK this is the hotel
Thanks for everything 
Scarlett
We are looking to discover more and more this hotel and think it is the best choice

title: Excelente hotel, 100 por ciento recomendable
text: Nos hospedamos 12 dias, fuimos en familia, al principio nos llamo la atención su entrada pero a medida que seguíamos nos impresionaba cada vez más y más..  Al dia 12 no nos queríamos ir, es de una exquisitez impresionante, el aroma del hotel se siente en las sabanas, en los jabones, hasta en nuestra ropa cuando llegamos a Uruguay.  La habitación es sumamente cálida, colores beige y blanco.  A pesar de estar en pleno Time Square y de estar en alojados en un piso 33, nos e sentía absolutamente nada, un placer descansar allí.  Destaco a los señores que estan en la puerta son muy atentos, siempre pendientes de absolutamente todo para colaborar a los huéspedes.  Volveríamos sin dudarlo.

title: July 2021 Stay
text:
Stayed here for a leisure trip to NYC in July 2021. I had high expectations, as this hotel is rated 5 stars. Most of my expectations were met. I had a premier room that was well-appointed, quiet, and extremely comfortable, with an excellent view of Times Square. The door staff was very welcoming. Obviously a great location. I had plans to have late-night tapas or a small dinner here, but the lobby bar only serves drinks.

Prior to my trip, I made a few requests for my room, and received confirmation my requests would be taken care of. Unfortunately, most of my requests for the room were not honored. When I checked out, I mentioned my requests weren’t accommodated, and the person at the desk said “oh, sorry to hear that” instead of trying to make things right. 5-star hotels should get these details right.

It’s not on the same level as the Ritz-Carlton. It’s similar to some Luxury Collection hotels I’ve stayed at, but can improve by making sure the details are taken care of.

title: Must stay in NYC
text: This hotel is fantastic.  From the minute you are treated by the front entrance staff to check in and the restaurant service.  Everything is amazing.  The food at the hotel restaurant was delicious and the rooms were very nice!  Everything you need in an efficient space.  I would definitely stay here again.

title: Excellent property, location and staff
text: Will by my new "go-to" NYC hotel. From the moment I entered the property from the doorman and staff to the front desk personnel all were friendly, warm and welcoming. I had a could of special requests and all where handled impeccably. The entire staff remembers you and welcomes you back as you come in. Everyone is top notch. The rooms are crisp, clean, modern with minimalistic style. Everything was spotless and had a wonderful fresh scent. Kudo's to the management and the team at this hotel. You really know how to treat your guests and make them want to come back. I plan to come back 12/31/21 - 01/02/22 (If space is available).

title: Best hotel in nyc! Best Marriott hotel we ever stayed in!
text: We are so glad we picked the Times Square Edition. True luxury. Felt like a fancy 1 of a kind boutique hotel but it’s Marriott. Special shout out to front desk staff like AMY and great doorman JOHNNY for truly exceptional service and the bartender + bar manager as well. Our room was amazing. Nice balcony directly above the action of Times Square. Huge bathroom. Luxurious linens. All was fab. To be honest, we stayed at a “okay” Residence Inn a few days before this trip that was just fine… but this stay at the Edition made it a memorable perfect escape. You will not be disappointed in this choice. And I’m picky.

title: Birthday trip
text:
I stayed here for 7 nights.
The hotel is very beautiful. The rooms are small, but very nice and cleanz
You can enjoy one of the best breakfast in NY on the terrace. It’s simply outstanding!
The staff very nice and profi.
We will definetly come back here

title: Amazing hotel in the heart of Time Square
text:
I really enjoyed my experience here. My friends and I booked this right when it opened after a remodel and Covid. Our rooms were so clean and plenty of space for 2 people. Prices are reasonably considering its in the heart of Times square. The staff here is really friendly and the Marriott Bonvoy app is great when you need to request anything or if you need to chat with a live agent. They do feature a nice wide open bar and outside patio. 

The staff here is great as my room was spotless every day I came back from a long day roaming the city. The alcohol in the rooms have a little bit of everything. The technology here is great as well as the TV was state of the art. As was the speaker and switches in the rooms as well. I'm not sure what kind of mattress we had, but sleeping there every night was amazing. The doormen as well were great. They would find our Lyft/ Uber drivers, request drivers, assist with bags and the doors. Highly recommend this hotel if you need to stay in mid town and get great views of the city. If you want all of the amenities like a gym and restaurant that won't break the bank this isnt your spot.

title: Edition is Back, and I loved it 可能是紐約服務最好的萬豪酒店
text: 目前剛下榻，服務不錯，但是因為剛剛恢復營運，缺很多東西，房間的人造皮草沒有放置，想要購買一樣也沒有貨，可是服務人員目前是紐約最好的，比起ParkHyatt以及Andaz 或Plaza我更喜歡這邊。

title: Certainly a NYC favourite of mine
text: Elegantly modern hotel with a relaxing cocktail lounge and a clean gym. I was impressed to find the room provided a suit steamer, as some five-star hotels in NYC do not. The true gem of this hotel is the restaurant with is as magical inside as it is on the outdoor terrace.

title: Amazing experience!! Great service!
text: We were one of the first guests at the hotel (february 2019). It was awsome, super different, looks like you are getting inside a night club. Great services. They sent us a very cute gift that was representing our different routes to meet there.

title: Good for NYC on 4th visit
text:
Stayed a few times and all have been a bit average to be honest! Drop off outside is a nightmare due to all the building work going on, so you do have to literally just jump out! 

Front desk service really depends on who you get, some are really friendly others just can't be bothered. 

Rooms are small, but no smaller than other rooms in the city!  At least these are new and well thought out, although they could lose some of the furniture that takes up valuable space.  I'd suggest you upgrade to the next room up as the extra space is worth it. 

Rooms service is great and so are the staff they are always so friendly and stop for a chat etc.  As do housekeeping and the nightly room attendants. 

Its a solid hotel, just don't expect to many bells and whistles, for that you need at least another $300 on your nightly budget! 

Clean, excellent location just needs a bit less attitude from some of the staff.

title: Wow - perfektes Hotel
text:
Wunderschönes Design, aufmerksamer Service und wirklich stylish. Eine Ruheoase direkt am hektischen Time Square.

Concierge Service war auch sehr hilfreich - besonders Tea. 

Pro Übernachtung erhält der Gast einen Gutschein für Konsumationen und einen Gutschein für den Wäscheservice - sehr praktisch, aber nicht kummulierbar. 

Der Stauraum im Zimmer ist sehr limitiert.

title: Subpar service for a luxury hotel...
text:
Not my personal choice for location since I'd rather not be in Times Square. I am a former NYC resident so this is generally an area I avoid. Circumstances on this trip required that I be in the Time Square area. This place seemed nice and offered a "2 Bedroom" apartment. The room wasn't really a two-bedroom. Rather, it was just two separate hotel rooms that then had a third door you had to enter before you could enter either hotel room. Odd but fine. The rooms are nice and I particularly like the showers. These aren't that ridiculous but popular European style so common in hotels across NYC in which water goes all over the bathroom floor because only half the shower is covered. These showers have full coverage so kudos to the designer. Beds are comfortable and both rooms had good views into Time Square. The service is lackluster. One day our rooms weren't cleaned at all and when I arrived home at 6:00PM, I had to have call down for house keeping. When then left for dinner and when we arrived back all house keeping had done was sloppily throw the covers back on the bed and rearrange a few things. For multiple days, staff kept leaving garbage/dirty glassware/2 day old room service. Even once I would call down, they would still come up and leave the room unfinished...still leaving dirty glassware or not replacing used items, such as shampoo. On another occasion, staff left a cleaning rack of some sort in the room and in the other room left dirty black cleaning gloves. I've attached pictures of what the room would look like once staff was called to come clean the rooms again...

Drinks at the bar were excellent, though the food we tried was terrible. The chicken bites at the bar had so much inedible gristle in them, we didn't eat very many...After those, we went elsewhere for food.

title: Small room with world’s tiniest wardrobe
text: The room was small with hardly any division between the toilet and bathroom area in general. The cleaning was not done in a timely manner. The worst was the wardrobe space. It was tiny!!! Breakfast was expensive and not great.

title: Good, not great
text:
Stayed here for 4 nights with my wife and overall happy with the experience. Location is good, walking distance to most of the attractions we wanted to visit, but I wouldnt stay here next time due to the noise factor from Times Square and construction. 
Staff are generally very friendly and helpful (especially doormen & concierge), rooms are tastefully decorated and although small, generally functional. The bar and restaurant are very cool.

I'm not sure why, but I just expected more. I do a lot of traevl for business and stay at a lot of hotels, and I expected a wow factor from this property that didnt eventuate. Anyway, overall it was very good, but next time I'd probably try the mid town property to see if my expectations of this brand are realistic or not.

title: Great location, staffs are nice
text: First impression was we able to check in early, hotel itself located in good location, nice to walk around. Room was lovely, nice mood and tone , great view of the Time Square. Staffs are nice and friendly, they always recommend us good restaurant to try, so we went as they recommended and no disappoint! Thank you to you all! Only comment was about noise from the construction outside. They provided you the ear plugs and eyes mask which is good, but not the last night may be you will considering add this as the amenities.

title: Fantástico
text: Hotel Fantástico, mesmo no coração de Times Square. Quartos muito bons, com todas as comodidades e vista para a cidade. O serviço é muito prestável. La fica o Paradise Club, um dos espaços nocturnos mais badalados de Nova Iorque. O restaurante do Hotel é lindíssimo. Aconselho

title: Nothing for Titantium
text: I am Titanium with Marriott and my biggest pet peeve is when a property does not acknowledge the status which takes a minimum of 75 nights to achieve. I booked this hotel 2 months ago for 3 nights and checked in today. They put me in their most basic room right next to the elevator on the 14th floor (40 floors mind you). I asked about Titanium upgrade and nothing was available. This is the 2nd property in New York where I've run into this same issue (The Lexington). I do not suggest staying here. Far better choices with Marriott where they treat you like valued customer. -Josh

title: Great experience - sore ankles
text:
Excellent hotel, as good as the existing hotel downtown.

I had a great view of Times Square, the bar was great food top notch. The staff were excellent.
The location is perfect - it’s easy to get cabs or walk and there are a lot of things on your doorstep.

The only niggle is the room sizes (which are equivalent to most midtown hotels) and a fixed bed with hard corners meant that i cracked my legs / ankles way too many times.    It’s a niggle - the bruises are now faded and it would be long before only a happy memory remains

You should try it - it really is special AND right by Times Square

title: Great Hotel
text:
Step change compared to most hotels around, rooms super nice, food/restaurant /bars super cool, food incredible etc.
Only minus is the famous destination fee that makes no sense, ie you have to spend 35$ a day or you don't get it back. Leaves a bad feeling.

title: Outstanding service, excellent location
text:
This is such a great location in Times Square/Theatre district (right beside Hershey's World, if you know the area), and the staff are outstanding - very professional, friendly and accommodating.  Definitely one of my top hotel stays in NYC and I'm there 4 or 5 times a year.  

I was traveling with my son so we needed a room with 2 beds, which I think are the smallest of the rooms they have, but it was absolutely fine for the 2 nights we stayed.  We were in the city to see a couple of shows and to do some shopping, and we easily accommodated our shopping bags in the room along with our 2 large suitcases and backpacks with room to spare.  I also really appreciated the cleanliness of the rooms.
