We enjoyed room service for breakfast and dinner and it was excellent, and I believe it's offered 24/7.  There is also a Nespresso maker in the room which was awesome - I'm up at 5am daily to work for a few hours and really enjoyed the convenience of a hot coffee first thing.

I sincerely appreciated how helpful the staff were - I had a few requests and packages delivered and they were prompt and helpful in meeting each request I had.  I will definitely be back.

title: They helped us create memories!
text: We got engaged this weekend and Danny, who worked with Guest Experiences, was incredibly helpful. He organized champagne, these incredible chocolate truffles, a hand written note and he took it upon himself to print a photo that I sent him and he had it framed. The staff has been nothing short of accommodating in every way and we have truly enjoyed our stay and will definitely come back based on our experience. The room was beautiful, overlooking the exact spot where I proposed on the giant red staircase in Times Square. This area will now hold a very special spot in our hearts. Thanks again for helping to create memories!

title: Awesome Hotel!
text: stayed at the Times Square Edition recently and had the pleasure of working with Ryan. Great guy - super helpful, very knowledgeable, and all round awesome dude. Thanks, Ryan - we thoroughly enjoyed ourselves! love love love this hotel. Excellent location, incredibly clean, ultra modern, and super comfy robes! Ten out of ten will stay here again. I researched many NYC hotels and we are soooo glad we chose this gem.

title: Incredible!
text: I loved absolutely everything. Decor. Location. The customer service is outstanding and the energy of this hotel is amazing! Recommend it 100%. This will be my go to when flying to new york city for now on.

title: Friendly, good location with a few buts
text: I had this review in draft mode for a long time. I stayed here for SIX nights. My first room was noisy from the next door neighbours who played loud rap in their room. It was them or me. The friendly hotel staff immediately relocated me and dealt with the other guests later, I was told. Yes, the rooms are small .. small for NYC and you can hear the noise of Times Square but the view was great and I actually had some good sleeps there. Breakfast was great and that bar … yes noisy but hey its NYC! I rated it mid range but it was somewhat pricey when we stayed.

title: Claustrophobic, Loud, Pretentious, Dark......
text:
There seem to be 2 separate hotel experiences here.  If you book a suite or get upgraded to a suite it sounds like you will have a great experience.  

The check in process wasn't bad.  You basically enter on the street in a dark nothing room and are taken via elevator to a swanky Miami feel check in desk.   It was incredibly crowded with people everywhere.  Just sitting around.  It was after normal check in but felt like a hotel where everyone was waiting for their rooms.  I found out later the rooms are so ridiculously small people just hang out in the lobby.   

I was told at check in that all of the suites had already been sold.  In fact you could purchase one online.  I am Ambassador with Marriott but was told they would not upgrade me for the 1 night.   I found out later they had already upgraded "their allotment" and they would rather a room be vacant than upgrade me.   It was infuriating.

I figured that the room however would be nice as I was given a "Time Square View" and this was an Edition Luxury hotel at a pretty hefty price.  I was insanely wrong.   The room was hysterically small even for NYC.   There was no bathroom, there was a tiny glass box with a toilet and one with a shower.   A sink was in front of those two rooms with a curtain around it.   The closets were insanely tiny.   I am a small guy but you still had to kind of scoot around the room.  This room was designed for only 1 person.  The view as nice....  BUT the noise was unbearable.   Horns, sirens, people screaming all night long.  

When I went to the lobby to have a drink it was over-run with people trying to get out of their rooms like me.  I was told of the great outdoor space at the restaurant lounge area yet that was closed off with the blinds pulled tight.  I was told it was because of falling ice.  

The only saving grace of the property is the proximity to the theater district and Time Square entertainment. 

I would never stay here again.

title: Definition of Elegance and Friendly Service
text: I stayed at this hotel back in August for a girl's birthday trip after our flight was canceled and this hotel was truly the definition of elegance and had the friendliest staff I have ever met. As soon as we got there, the bellman offered to store our luggage, opened the door for us, and even pressed the elevator button for us. When we went up to the beautiful front lobby, all of the agents smiled at us and invited us right up to check in. We explained to the agent that our flight was canceled, but we were grateful to stay an extra night at such an extravagant hotel. He gave us waters, got us into our room, and as soon as we walked in, we realized that he put us in a high floor room with a side view of Time Square!! The decor in the room, the bathroom amenities down to the softest robes I have ever worn, and the gorgeous layout was just so elegant. It was so nice!! The front desk agent also sent up a small bottle of wine with a card wishing my friend and me a happy birthday! It was such a great way to end our trip, especially after our flight frustration. We are already planning our second trip back to this hotel!!

title: Für NYC top
text:
Wir waren 4 Nächte im Edition, es ist modern, sauber und die Zimmer für 250€ je Nacht günstig und ausreichend groß! 
Lärm ist schon heftig, wenn man sonst ohne jeglichen Verkehr auf dem Land lebt!
Frühstück gibt es für die Hälfte nach kurzem Fußmarsch.

title: Best Hotel Experience Ever
text: One word - OUTSTANDING! We booked a room here for our wedding night last Saturday. We were greeted with complimentary glasses of champagne at check in. We then learned our room had been upgraded to a suite. When we walked in there was a chilled bottle of champagne and fresh fruit with a wonderful note. We felt SO special on our wedding night. When we were leaving on Sunday morning, a bell man walked us to the corner and had us stand on the corner while he stopped traffic (literally) to get us a cab. We recommend this hotel 100%. The smell is so divine. Rooms are spectacular. Customer service is on point. Food is amazing (we got room service twice)! Thank you  Ana with Times Square Edition guest experiences!

title: Loved this hotel!!
text:
It was our first stay at an EDITION branded Marriott property and I loved this hotel!  The times square EDITION is a beautiful and relaxing property in the middle of the chaos that is times square.  As soon as you walk through the doors of the hotel, you feel a sense of calm as you breathe in that EDITION scent.  And then even more calm as you get off the elevator into the lobby.  The public spaces are all beautiful and each have a unique design.  I loved the terrace restaurant for brunch, which was so unique for a times square restaurant.  And 701 west's bar was very elegant and a great/romantic place to have a drink with your spouse!

Yes, the rooms are small, but how long do you plan to hang out in there......you are in NYC, get out there and explore!  I really liked the room though, which has that lifestyle luxurious feel to it.  The bathroom amenities had that same scent you smell throughout the hotel.  

So, I definitely recommend this hotel if you don't mind staying in the times square area!  It is something times square needed and it doesn't disappoint.

title: Disappointing (restaurant service, size of room)
text: I am a Marriott Platinum member and stayed at the hotel in November. The room was extremely small, with no storage space for luggage. Probably the basic room size at this hotel, an upgrade to a larger room (not sure they have any) which should come with my status would have been nice. The lack of storage was about manageable for me as a single traveller, but for a couple with lots of luggage a real issue. Didn’t like the open bathroom design or lack of bathtub. The strong points of the hotel are the common areas, restaurants and bars, which are really nicely designed and trendy. Gym was also nice. However, the service at breakfast and lunch was a disaster, very slow, items described in the menu were not brought (juice, cheese), and when I asked for them, staff expressed surprise that I would insist on getting a complete order. I won’t be back.

title: Génial !
text: À toutes les personnes qui aiment le beau et le bon dans un beau cadre lounge tendance cet établissement est fait pour vous ! Rien à dire, tout est neuf propre et moderne. Le personnel est au petit soin. L’emplacement est un point de départ idéal stratégique pour visiter New York. Nous reviendrons sans hésiter !

title: Immer wieder klasse
text:
Wir waren für 5 Tage im Times Square Edition Hotel.
Über die Lage muss man nichts mehr sagen. Zentraler geht es nicht.
Beim Betreten des Hotels steigt einem sofort der typische Edition Hotel Geruch in die Nase. Alleine der Geruch in den Hotels der Marke ist jeden Euro wert.
Das Hotel ist recht neu und daher in einem tadellosen Zustand.
Wir waren sehr begeistert vom Restaurant welches mit reichlich Blumen eingerichtet ist. Das a la carte Frühstück war ok, jedoch kann man dies bei einem solchen Preis auch erwarten. 
Ebenfalls sehr hervorzuheben sind die Mitarbeiter.

title: Wonderful stay, beautiful views!
text: Lovely stay with impeccable customer service. When we arrived in a cab, a door man was standing outside of the Hershey store and just knew we were staying at the edition and walked us to the hotel. Lucky timing I guess! Very modern, small room with very little bathroom privacy. This was the supreme times square view room. Lovely room, only downside was the person next door - all hours of the night there was bumping and blaring music. It kept us up all night, even with calls down and security asking them to turn it down. I’ve NEVER even anything like this before, it was unbelievable. Overall lovely stay though.

title: Special stay and thank you very much!
text:
My boyfriend and I stayed in the hotel for 5 nights. After staying for one night, he has magically become my fiancé with the help from Greg Devino, Daniel, Ana, Anna and Tiffany. They provided a lot of assistance in planning the proposal, not to mention, Daniel and Anna are the best photographers. I am very happy that they captured the special moments for us. I can never forget my stay. Thank you all! 
Location wise, it’s the best. The hotel is super clean and spotless. There’s a broadway show in the hotel. Breakfast area is nice and has a winter garden. I love the express everything bagel breakfast and my morning monkey smoothie. Must try!

title: Wow
text: After having stayed two nights in a loft at the public hotel in NYC I was not expecting much by the Edition hotel. I was wrong. This is an excellent hotel, rooms are fabulous and staff very helpful. I will go back for sure!

title: Unforgettable First Trip to NYC!!
text: I have stayed at many luxury hotels throughout the world and this one has got to of been one of the best! We spent two wonderful nights here, and words cannot describe how much I enjoyed my stay at The Times Square EDITION! Not only was it my first visit to NYC, but my friend and I were taking this trip together before she moved out of the country - so it was a very special trip. Everyone made us feel very welcomed and no request went unnoticed. A huge shoutout to Ms. Suki for treating us like royalty on this very special trip. Suki provided us with custom restaurant and activity recommendations after hearing what we were interested in doing. Simply said, our trip wouldn't of had been as successful without the help of Suki. Excellent service aside, I would stay at The Times Square EDITION again just for late night milkshakes! To sum it up, we moved to the The Plaza for our last three nights in the city, and would have loved to of spend our entire time at the EDITION. The customized service we received was truly priceless.

title: Wow in times square
text:
Amazing hotel.
Brand new
Spotless
Amazing staff
Remarkable rooms
Nespresso coffee makers
Clothing steamers in room
Stream on your tv
Incredible room
Right in the middle of everything
Great food. But expensive.
Highly highly recommend

title: Amazing Hotel
text: For sure it was not the last stay here. Lovely staff, extreme clean, unique architecture and of course a perfect location is all together absolutely stunning. Was here with my wife and we had lovely days in New York. Many many thanks...

title: Family weekend in NYC
text: My family loved our two night stay at the Edition. It was the right combination of cool, location, value, service and amenities for us. The hotel has several sleek and comfortable lounges to relax in, as well as very good restaurants and bar areas. Good enough that non-guests were definitely a good portion of the clientele. The staff and service were impressive - we somewhat expected a hotel this modern to have an attitude and be less than enthusiastic about our kids - but instead we found 'Four Seasons" level of staff attentiveness on top of being engaged and fun with our little ones. While the rooms are fairly small, we had what we needed and it was very clean and designed well. And after all, you're in NYC and in a fun hotel, so you want to be out and about. All in all, the Edition would be at the top of our list if we visit midtown NYC again.

title: Beyond expectations
text:
We stayed for 3 nights in 2 separate trip. Warmly greeted by doorman and assisted with our luggage immediately. We arrived early but they still manage to get us a room, which is unexpected.
We left in between for almost a week, upon our return again, the bellmen - unfortunately because no and tag was wore, I cannot get any name, spot us right away and greeted us with our name !!!! SUPERSTAR !!! 
This is of recognition was never asked for and never expected of. 
THANK YOU EDITION for making our trip memorable !

title: Nice hotel
text:
i was excited about staying at the hotel as it is relatively new.  It is a really nice hotel.  On level 1, there were always door men holding the door for guests, which was nice.  The lobby and lounge area were beautiful as were other dining and bar options.  The room, while small, was very nice and comfortable.

The reason for the lower rating is because I got sick from eating the pork belly at the bar (one level below the lobby).  My tummy did not react well to it and i started getting sick about 4-5 hours after eating it and that night was painful.  I let the duty manager next day know, who was very nice and professional about it.  The only other time my tummy has reacted so violently to food was once in India.

The location at Times Square can be a positive or negative based on your perspective.  Factor in some extra time when leaving for the airport as the street is one-way (west bound) leading into Times Square and so you to get through that mess before you can start heading away from it.

title: Mildew Present at. A Five Star Restaurant
text: I paid almost $400 for a five star restaurant and found mildew stains all over my pillows. I complained to the front desk. They said they would fix it and didn’t. I ended up getting sick because the problem was not fixed. When I escalated my complaint to the general manager, he totally disregarded my complaint and said that it was stains from cleaning???! I ask you do the pictures below look like stains from cleaning sheets, and if your cleaning techniques cause stains, wouldn’t you change your techniques??!  He offered no compensation for my inconvenience and basically told me to deal with it. I have severe asthma attacks that can be triggered from mildew. How disheartening to experience this level of disgust at a five star hotel! If you are going to have a problem at least take a customer service class and address the issue politely and with compassion and empathy. The general managers first name must be RUDE because he is definitely that. I will NEVER stay at Times Square Edition in the future. EVER!

title: Great stay by Titanium Ambassador Member
text: I had a wonderful stay at the Edition. The place is sleep and modern. The location is excellent. And the staff is first rate. I received first class help from Daniel Macias, the Guest Services Manager. He assigned me a terrific room and was very friendly and helpful.

title: Anniversary night
text: My husband and I went to a Broadway show for our anniversary and decided to spend the night in the new Edition.  While the room was a bit cramped, it was fine given we were only there for one night, plus the facilities are beautiful!  Highly recommend for a weekend getaway in the heart of it all!

title: Service, Cleanliness, Location Top Notch
text: My family and I just returned from a last minutes stay at the Time Square Edition. We were looking for a fun hotel in a great location that balanced luxury and location. The Time Square Edition was a perfect hotel for us - the location couldn't have been closer to Time Square but once you were in the hotel it felt like a luxury yet modern oasis.  What really made the stay great was the quality of customer service, from Daniel the front Desk manager who went above and beyond to take care of us to the rest of the team.  I was blown away with how well the hotel was run and how well we were treated.  I highly recommend the hotel and look forward to returning again.

title: Overrated. Overpriced
text:
Pros:
1. Location
2. Design is amazing. Super sleek and clean but can be lush and bohemian too
3. Gym is perhaps the best in any urban NYC hotels
4. Great cocktails 701West
5. The food in The Terrace is beautiful. The vibe is also cool

Cons:
1. Room is super tiny. Waaaaay smaller than we thought. While the design is clean, the space usage could be better
2. With the same price like Miami Edition, the room you'll get in Times Square Edition is smaller. As an avid traveller and a Bonvoy member, I found this very annoying
3. Bathroom design and furnishing selections are strangely uncomfortable. So basically anything about the rooms are not comfortable and is the total opposite of the retaurants and bars
4. Slow check-in. Staff weren't trained enough to answer just basic questions i.e gym operation hour, restaurant specialty, and late check-out

title: Small uncomfortable room
text:
This room was new and sounded like a great idea based on reviews.  The bed was comfortable however we both hurt ourselves in the shower handle, and I kept stubbing my toes and banging into the ultra modern furniture and angles, so cramped.  Style won over comfort really disappointing.  Staff was rigid and not helpful at front desk when I left early for another luxury property which much larger and more welcoming. 
Daily resort fee ridiculous.

title: Bad experience
text: The staff was very Arrogant.  Rooms weren’t clean.  Way overpriced for what you get in return.  They also charge you for not using the "credits" they "give" you if you don't use them.  Sounds crazy but true.

title: Best and friendliest service in NYC!
text:
I've stayed overnight in NYC more than 20 times by now and I have never had friendlier and attentive service than at this Edition.  My husband and I stayed here one night, this past Saturday.  I rarely write reviews and this might be my first hotel review ever.  My husband has worked for Marriott for close to 20 years and we've stayed in their hotels all around the world.  From the moment we arrived to our departure, it was nice people helping us with the door, elevators, checking in and out, and making reservations at their Terrace restaurant.  Every. single. person. was  so lovely.  

The room was bright and modern.  I will say, the rooms are on the small side, but that isn't surprising for midtown Manhattan.  The bathroom is a bit more of an open concept than we typically enjoy, but it was fine.  Everything was clean.  The toiletries they offer are quite floral in scent.  I enjoyed them but I did think this are not particularly neutral, so I'm not sure how universal they would be to all that would use them.  I generally think that men tend to use the provided toiletries more than women and I think the scent might be off-putting to many.  By no means a deal breaker, just a note.  

The hotel has a "destination fee" of 35 dollars a night, which you can use towards food and drink at one of their restaurants.  During an intermission at the UCB Theater show, I called to see if we could get a reservation for one hour from then, 9pm, so we could enjoy the chocolate souffle at the Terrace Restaurant.  The host I spoke to on the phone was so helpful and cheery when we met at the restaurant shortly thereafter- I wish I remembered his name!  They were able to accommodate us in their lush and green room which was a lovely end to our night.  Thank you everyone at the Times Square Edition- it was a great experience!

title: Great Staff; Minimalist Design May Affect Comfort
text:
This Ian Schrader-designed hotel is a few steps off Times Square which can be a blessing and a curse.  It certainly plunges one into the heart of lively Manhattan and from our room window we could see some of the flashing neon signs if we chose.  While the hotel literature describes this as "explosive", trying to get to the hotel and into it around 9 on a Saturday night was a headache. The hotel has a very popular nightclub with lines out the door but the doormen were there to help guide us through the throngs and run interference for us to the elevators.  Crossing Times Ssquare at that hour is also difficult but it certainly gives one the flavor of New York City at its most tourist-y frenetic.  The interior of the hotel is plain and serene (when one gets to the lobby floor, the 10th, and out of the line for the nightclub.  The king room we had was small, as most New York hotels are because of the value of real estate, but very attractive and spare.  The bed and pillows were wonderfully comfortable; bath towels were plentiful and thick and nicely absorbent.  The shower is dual, one waterfall from the ceiling and another a hand held that was a sleek looking but at times awkward to manage wand.  Closet space is very small, with 20% of the space taken up by two lovely bathrobes (couldn't they have put those on a shelf to give us more room for our clothes?).  If two people occupying the room had hung up all of their clothes and their winter coats they would not have fit in the small closet.  There are two drawers total with none at the bedside, part, no doubt, of the desire for spare design.  But that meant we had to put items on the nightstand ledge and also on the ledge along one wall that doubles as a desk--that means more clutter, not less, as part of the overall ambiance.  There are charging ports and plugs in abundance (hooray) in keeping with the target demographic I am guessing.  Only on our third day when we read the small print in the hotel brochure inside the folder did we learn that some of the waste bins were for recycling and others were for waste.  (Why not discreetly label them?).  And while we were urged to re-use our towels by hanging them back up there was only ONE SMALL hook in the whole room and no towel bars.  Hanging up two bath towels, two wash cloths and two hand towels on one small hook is laughable.
There is a lovely Nespresso coffee pot but it is so jammed in to the mini bar that it was difficult to operate/hard to get the water container in and out without dripping a bit on the bottles and items in the mini bar. My conclusion is that design (and perhaps economy) trumped comfort for customers when the hotel was created.

On the other hand I cannot say enough about how nice, helpful, friendly and pleasant the staff were from the reception staff to the housekeepers to the doormen.  The staff made the stay.

title: Rooms Over Priced and TOOOO SMALL
text: I am ambassador elite with over 130 stays at Marriott hotels. I have stayed at the Edition in Miami Beach and London. Both of the hotels are great but this one is a disgrace. First the rooms are so small there is no where to put your luggage. The desk counter is so small you can't even do work in your room. The bar staff talks bad about customers and don't believe that anyone can hear them. Never again would I stay at this hotel. They should close and start again.

title: Best hotel
text: Love love love this place. Rooms are cute. Food is good at the many restaurants. Bars are sexy. Staff friendly. Decor is unique. Hotel Guests can be annoying but mostly cool people. Great location. Great hotel.

title: Aaaaaaaaaaaaamazing!!!!!!!!!!!!
text: I have to say I’m the many many times I’ve gone to New York this by far was the best experience ever! I always stay in Time Square because I love the excitement and the fact that everything‘s open 24/7 but this time I stayed at the most amazing hotel! From the moment I checked in with Vladimir who went above and beyond! I mentioned it was a last minute trip and actually on Thanksgiving day, within two hours we jumped on a plane and we’re also celebrating an anniversary and he sent an awesome amenity. I also witnessed him handle a very needy client in the most kind professional manner! Our room was amazing with amazing views, the restaurants and the club that were right there in the hotel were  the best I had ever been to, especially in time square. The club the hottest club to get into which of course we had no problem because we were staying there. When we went out to the street we saw people in line to get in. There were performers along with great Security, I felt totally safe! The staff could not  do enough for us! There  was the beautiful hand written note that came with our amenity that was more than just a short sentiment from Andren. There was the housekeeper Tenzin Rabgyal that I had to get coffee from that just was the most professional, courteous and kind housekeeper I’ve ever met. Then there was our check out which we were blessed to Vladimir again who took care of a small issue for us immediately. Finally on our way out in the middle of a sleet storm there was Aaron  who negotiated a reasonable price and put us in a suburban safely to the airport all while he walked us to the car with an umbrella. I can go on and on but this truly was the best stay for me, from the property to the staff who went above and beyond, to the amenities. Oh, and dare I forget the Terrace restaurant that when I posted a picture everybody I knew asked me where I was! Simply amazing and more than I could’ve ever expected These name mentions are truly an asset to this hotel and our amazing experience at The Edition!!!! I will be back !!!

title: Really Dramatic Hotel Concept in Times Square
text: One gets an idea of the dramatic flair encountered here right at the entrance - we walked up to the discreet doorway and not one but two doormen opened the door for our grand entrance. The you walk down a long hallway with moody lighting and get into the elevator - which brings you to the lobby. Times Square is a madhouse, but inside this hotel it is very quiet and lush and sophisticated in a very modern way. We enjoyed cocktails in the lobby bar (good, welcoming service) and dinner at 701 West - which is gorgeous. Food was good - service was good. If you are looking for a WOW hotel in the heart of the action - this is a great choice. We were seeing a Broadway show and this is a nearby excellent dinner or cocktail option. I look forward to staying here soon.

title: Terrible Staff in Bar, embarrassing behavior and zero call back from manager AVOID
text: Hotel is nice and location is good, but don't dare ask the bar for anything. I am loyal Marriott member and have stayed all over the world at different Marriott brands and thought this would be a good one considering its a 5 star hotel and wanted a 5 star experience. While the hotel is trendy and in a good location, the bar staff is horrendous. They embarrassed me and my girl friend when simply asking if they served food, making a joke out of it and saying rude things. I call management and request a call back and to my surprise zero call back to discuss the issue. This was the same way as I was treated at the Ritz Carlton in St Thomas and had to go to their EVP at corporate to resolve. I need a response asap on the bars behavior, how you will rectify the issue and why management never called me back. Absolutely embarrassing when I am loyal to the brand and spent thousands of dollars this weekend at your hotel.

title: WOW! Times Square has been waiting for you!
text: Wow, I am a frequent traveller who loves the bright lights, loud noises and excitement of  Times Square. I also love a luxurious hotel with an incredible guaranteed view, great location, clean,  a comfortable bed, modern/high tech  look feel and amenities,  a luxurious bath room with and separate shower and freestanding  bath! a balcony and excellent service !  The views are amazing and the room and vies are exactly as good as they look in the pictures, almost not heard of! The Times Square Edition  is my perfect match!  Thank you! On this occasion I also had the additional requirement of guaranteed connecting rooms for my family which yes they have! It is called the family room. Considering the room sizes are always on the smaller side in any times square hotel, these rooms are well designed so that you can still make the most of the space without feeling cluttered. I have 4 large suitcases plus more in my room and a roll-out bed! Then in our connecting  room our daughter has a queen size bed , bathroom, views and plentiful space. The service is impeccable and the restaurants and bars are a unique amazing experience!  This will now be the only place we stay in NY City!

title: Best hotel stay ever!
text:
I can’t begin to express the incredible experience I’ve had at this hotel. I travel to NYC often for work and even lived here, in the past. Considering my knowledge and past experience, Times Square Edition hotel is one of the most attentive, traditional customer service providing hotels I have ever experienced! 

I came to NY for a birthday and celebration of life weekend, for a dear friend of 32 years. From the pre-visit email from Ana and Suki, to the attentive and caring checkin service from Rukhshona, to the friendly smile and baggage service of Joey, and the caring after checkin call from Riley - no other hotel in Times Square can top their services. 

I lightly mentioned to Rukhsona that I wanted to surprise my friend with a banner and balloons in her room. When I shared with Rukahona that I was unable to find the decor - she consulted with concierge services and when we returned from a brief outing, the room had balloons and a birthday message. Fantastic surprise. 

In addition to the AMAZING service, the rooms are clean, modernized, technology enhanced, spacious and bright. Great location. 

I am now hooked on Edition, for professional trips as well as business. Thank you to this wonderful staff for an unforgettable birthday and life celebration.

title: Terrible Staff!  Horrendous Experience.
text:
We had two rooms for 3 nights and from check in to check out experienced nothing but frustration.  I chose the hotel for it's location and am not usually bothered by sub-par service.  This time, however, the mistakes and oversights were constant and completely unacceptable.
1. Doormen were rarely available to open the ridiculously heavy doors (often chatting with each other or flirting with guests. (they can't see guests coming through because of the curtains even if they were paying attention)
2. One of our rooms had a disgusting odor which I'm guessing was the body odor of the previous guest.  We spoke to someone in housekeeping who quickly sent someone up - the solution was to mask the smell temporarily with a putrid spray and then open our window in the middle of winter!!! (Window had to stay open all 3 days as the smell never lessened)
3.The staff in the lobby bar and amongst the rudest and low-quality/trained I've ever dealt with.  We waited 25 minutes and asked 3 separate times for our order to be taken.  Finally a nasty waitress came over and said, "So what's up?" What's up? We want drinks!  She made no apologies and was very direct in letting us know she could care less how long we waited.  NICE!!! 
4. I spoke to the manager who seemed shocked and offered to buy us a round of drinks- by that time we were so disgusted with the entire scene we decided to just go up to our stinky room and call it a night. (Also infuriating was that the night manager told me the general manager would be calling me on Saturday to discuss what had happened in the bar that night- BIG SURPRISE- NO CALL)
5. I wanted to surprise my friends with chilled Champagne waiting in the room.  However, the concierge, who was French, sent up ice buckets and champagne glasses but NEVER PUT THE CHAMPAGNE ON ICE!!! So when we got to the room we had 2 warm bottles of Champagne and lots of ice.  Did I mention she was French?
6.One of my friends just MOVED a candy bar in the mini-bar and we were charged $10.  To clarify- the candy was not eaten, just moved slightly!
7. Rooms are tiny.  We normally stay at the Westin or W- and will do so in the future.  The size of these rooms was just silly- even by NYC standards.
8.Our bill wasn't correct at checkout- but they were nice about correcting it.
9. We tried to have dinner in the hotel's restaurant on Saturday night but were told we would have to sit at the restaurant's bar because they were fully booked.  We noted that not more than 10% of the tables in the restaurant were occupied- to which we were told, the kitchen is backed up and that's why we can't seat anybody.  Well, how would we get served at the bar then???? What's the difference???? 
I get it that this hotel is going for a hipster, cool vibe but when did a lack of common sense, poor manners, and terrible, rude service become hip or cool?  Hotel staff need to up their game, and go through service training again.  Still would love to speak to whomever is in charge of this train wreck!!!!

title: Great Location but Small Rooms and Too Many Mistakes
text:
Supposedly, this new luxury hotel from the Marriott Group is exceptional.  First, the hotel is located in an outstanding location in the heart of everything.  The bell staff were welcoming upon arrival and check in was fine except our room was not ready as promised.  Also, they do not offer the standard Marriott Elite amenities for the highest level Marriott elite members.  Is if they do not care!!!  

The room was so tiny and supposedly a Premier Room.  You could hardly move around in the room and no room for bags.  The bed was very comfortable and nice amenities and shower.  The view over Times Sq. breathtaking too.  I suppose they do not want you spend time in your room.  Also, no water bottles in the room (but these arrived in the night).

They also have a $35 destination fee which is not disclosed in the reservation.  What if you refuse?  And trying to get credit for the fee is not easy for food as there are so many conditions to the fees and time and location limitations.  The restaurant had excellent food for breakfast, well-prepared and tasty, but the service and food were extremely slow.  Also, the door to exit the hotel takes the strength of a giant to open and is like a castle door.  I assisted a disabled man open the door as there is no way he could open and no bell men were in sight.

Perhaps the hotel will improve in time but at this point, I am recommending the W Hotel across the street which treats Marriott top elites with dignity and respect and provides the perks associated with the level.  Also, the rooms are bigger.  I found this hotel stay disappointing.

title: Very disappointed!!!
text: We were so excited to stay at the edition but the room was so small (even for New York) that there was no where to put our stuff and after getting suitcases in no where to sit but the bed. The lounge on the 11th was great with fantastic cocktails and ambiance. Service was pretty good but that’s what you would expect.  Would never stay here again though due to high price and small room size. Also no cool lobby entrance as you enter in at ground and lobby on 10th floor.

title: Small, Narrow Room But Comfy Bed and Nice View of Times Square
text: We spent one night here recently.  The doors to the hotel from the street are heavy, and difficult to open if there is no attendant there to open them for you. Check-in is on the 10th floor, and was smooth.  Our room on the 24th floor was very narrow and small, but had a king bed, with an attractive "fur" throw, and windows that looked out on Times Square.  Fortunately, there are heavy curtains which block out all the lights when closed!  No bathtub, but a nice shower.  The bed was comfortable and there was no issue with noisy neighbors.  The room was very comfortable and we enjoyed our short stay.  The only issue was had was that we did not get our wake up call at 5 AM on time (it was about 15 minutes late), but, fortunately, we were already awake so it was not a problem. We would definitely stay here again.

title: Disappointed
text: My husband and I come to NY often before the Christmas holiday. This was our first time staying at the Times Square Edition and the first room we were in for one night eas like being in a cruise ship cabin. It was so tiny we were claustrophobic so we moved the second night or a suite which  was much better. More room and balcony was nice. Still disappointed that the hotel did not have one Christmas holiday decoration. We came here to get in the Christmas spirit as we live in Arizona and every store and hotel and restaurant we went in in the Time Square area was decorated with Christmas trees wreaths garland etc. this hotel did not have a wreath a tree and Garland or anything. When I asked about it at the front desk they said they wanted to stick with being simplistic whatever that means other than being lazy and simple and not wanting to decorate for the holidays but it was a big disappointment as we come here for the Christmas atmosphere and spirit. The food wasn’t very good not much of a choice on the menu. Would never choose to stay here again most likely, do you ascension the suite was much larger and nice but very very pricey for what you get. I don’t feel this is a five-star hotel and definitely not a hotel we are used to staying in as a five star!

title: Stunning room, outstanding hotel
text: I am a Marriott ambassador level member with 130+ hotel nights a year, most in luxury hotels, and I stayed for one night here this past week in a Premier Balcony Suite on the 27th floor.   The room was possibly my favorite hotel room ever.   Everything was perfect- layout, design, materials, and comfort.   The public rooms are no less great.   The gym is terrific- big, with excellent equipment and amazing views over Times Square.   The lobby bar and garden terrace are one of a kind, and the staff is wonderful- helpful, friendly and polite.   The hotel even smells great.   The only possible downside is if the noise and bustle of Times Square isnt your thing, but otherwise this is an absolutely luxurious, understated, beautiful, cool and friendly place.   I shall return.

title: Edition
text: Un hotel muy buen ubicado en Times Square, limpio y moderno con habitaciones pequeñas pero típico de Manhattan. Muy buen desayuno, buen servicio. Lobby en el piso 10, tiene muy buen restaurant y bar dentro del hotel.

title: A+ MUST stay
text: I do not like Times Square and prefer to stay far away from it whenever possible. However, I had a work conference right in TSQ. I found the Edition and am so glad I did. It was one of the most beautiful hotels I’ve stayed in and I forgot where I was when I was there—it was a heavenly sanctuary, sexy and comfortable. Thank you!

title: Best of the Best
text:
I had the pleasure of staying at this property in late October 2019 and it was beyond amazing. The staff was impeccably trained, customer service was world class, and the property was outstanding. There are not any negatives I can give. (Some people have complained about the size of the rooms in other reviews, and I did have a corner suite, but this IS New York City and small rooms are the norm.)

The location is ideal, with my room overlooking Times Square with ceiling to floor windows. Noise early in the evening was a problem, but was never a problem at night. The beds were very comfortable, housekeeping was incredible, and the bathroom and shower was wonderful. 

We did eat at the terrace restaurant, and it was great. In full disclosure, there is $35/day location fee, but you get this back in food and beverage credit (including room service) so we got our money's worth.

Overall, I have stayed at the best in NYC, and this is as fine as any property I have stayed at, and has the best location of the bunch. Highly recommend, and I am a very seasoned traveler with 30-50 stays per year for work and business.

title: Nice stay at welcoming hotel & staff
text:
We stopped at NYC for 3 days and this hotel was amazingly located at Times Square and we got a room overlooking the square and it’s action.
Room was tiny as typically the case in NYC, but was so functional and nice.
Staff were so helpful and welcoming from the moment they see you at the street every day.
We loved it and enjoyed our time there.

title: My new go to place in New York City
text:
I was a little skeptical about a hotel situated on Times Square but the early reviews were favourable .
Well we were pleasantly surprised- a lovely sweet smelling ultra modern stylish hotel where all the staff go out of their way to please, without exception.
Ok we had one day when the room was not cleaned early on or when our laundry was not returned when it should have been - but once we pointed out these minor shortcomings they were on it .
3 tips -
1. Ask for a room not overlooking Times Square unless you want neon lights flashing through your curtains.
2. Use the laundry and food / beverage $50 and $35 daily credit from the day you arrive - they are not applicable on the day of departure- that way you get value out of the destination fee .
3. Always access the hotel when walking from 6th Avenue - that way you avoid the zoo on 7th Avenue /Times Square.
But the very best recommendation of them all , my wife , who can be fussy , would like to stay there again if the opportunity arose .

title: Mooi hotel
text: Top hotel. Service was heel goed. We kregen dagelijks $35 op onze pas. Wel fijn om dat bij roomservice te gebruiken. Het hotel ligt heel centraal. Dim sum palace en red lobster waren beide op loopafstand.

title: TOP !
text:
Excellent hôtel très moderne.
Emplacement idéal et personnel charmant.
Climatisation silencieuse et superficie très correcte pour NYC.
Très bonne insonorisation.
Tout est neuf et propre.
Nous reviendrons sans hésiter.

title: Tutto molto bello pero ......
text: Abbiamo soggiornato con un gruppo di amici in questo splendido hotel con vista mozzafiato posizione centralissima ed abbiamo potuto apprezzare anche il ristorante sito all’11 piano, veramente notevole, unica nota stonata all’atto del check out abbiamo chiesto la possibilità di stampare le carte di imbarco inviandole alla mail dell’hotel, certamente il nostro inglese non è perfetto, ma i dipendenti di un hotel di questo tipo devono essere sempre professionali e risolvere gli eventuali problemi dei clienti, non superficiali e quasi irriverenti. L’appunto deve intendersi circoscritto ai soli tre dipendenti presenti alla reception alle ore 11,30 am del 04.11.19 tutti gli altri sono sempre stati precisi e puntuali

title: Stylish and Serene Hotel in Heart of Times Square
text:
I come to NYC for work monthly and have been trying different hotels around Times Square (close to office).  I’m loyal to Marriott as Platinum Elite.  This is my first stay at the Edition.  Here’s my ranking of the 4 hotels nearby I’ve stayed at recently.  I try to stay at <$300/night.  

Westin Times Square
Times Square Edition 
W Times Square
Sheraton Times Square 

Location:  44th and 7th Ave.  It’s one block off Times Square, which amazingly cuts down on the noise level a lot.  

Lobby/Common Area:  Like many NYC hotels, lobby is not at the street level.  The lobby bar and common area is open and very serene.  There is also an outdoor garden.  It felt like an oasis in the middle of Times Square. 

Resort fee:  Hotel charges a $35 amenities fee, which you get as a credit for food and beverage at the Restaurant or lobby bar. 

Room:  Platinum upgrade was to a “Times Square” view room.  Because it’s on 7th, you can see the lights but surprisingly quiet.  Room is average in size for NYC, but very well appointed and Lux feeling.  King size bed with faux fur throw,  club chair, desk and open sink.  Separate stalls for toilet and shower.  Awesome Le Labo bath amenities.  Robe and slippers.   The room was very comfortable for one person, might feel a little cramped for 2 people. 

Restaurant:  the main restaurant is one floor below lobby level and was very quiet during breakfast.  

Overall,  a very good stay and will be back.  This feels more like a boutique hotel and more exclusive.  The Westin rooms and bathrooms are larger and includes full breakfast at the restaurant for Platinum Elite.  I will likely flip between these two hotels based on price.

title: Buon hotel in posizione strategica a Manhattan
text:
Il Times Square Edition è un bell’hotel situato nel cuore di Manhattan. I principali punti di forza sono rappresentati dalla posizione strategica e il design della struttura e delle camere. La nostra camera era una Premier Room situata ai piani più alti dell’hotel con vista su Times Square: la stanza era ben arredata, molto pulita, silenziosa e con un letto king-size davvero comodo e un bagno con doccia. L’armadio era abbastanza spazioso anche se, a mio parere, sarebbe necessario prevederne un secondo. Il servizio di Couverture è eseguito ogni sera e prevede, tra le altre cose, anche la fornitura di bottiglie di acqua per la notte. Molto gentili e disponibili i portieri all’ingresso dell’hotel e il personale del Guest Experience Team (in particolare la Sig.ra Suki che ringraziamo nuovamente per il benvenuto a noi riservato); molto meno cordiale il personale addetto al check-in / Concierge e il personale di servizio al Lobby Bar e al ristorante The Terrace. 
Colazione e cena presso The Terrace buone ma al di sotto delle nostre aspettative, considerando l'elevato prezzo pagato.

title: bad service
text:
one of the worst welcoming and the way to speak to us me and my wife 
its our honeymoon and this is the first destination , sorry but i have been to all over the world, for me never saw something like this 
i requested its out honeymoon trip 
we arrived early morning and they want us to wait 7 hours here just to have the room

title: Nice But Not Worth the Price
text: We spent a recent weekend at the new Edition, and the biggest pluses are a great location a block from the trains and the chaos of Times Square and some nice public areas with garden-like greenery and views over Times Square. Negatives include sky-high prices for cubicle-like rooms. We booked the highest-priced room below the ones with private balconies, and the extra big bucks gave us a partial view over Times Square, a bed that we discovered to our dismay had a quilt bearing a huge stain from a prior guest (the hotel replaced it at our request, but it's hard to unsee something like that), and a tiny bathroom featuring a toilet divided from the shower and the rest of the bathroom by a barely opaque and think barrier that seemed to be the same material used for a hard floor mat. Neither coffee nor bathroom amenities were replaced the second day. Elevators are burdensome--to access our room, we usually had to wait in a queue at the hotel's entrance, often with significant waits for an elevator with space, to first go five floors to the lobby. Then, we had to do the same thing to take a different set of elevators to our room. It may not seem like much, but once you have to do that several times over the course of the day, you feel like your in gridlock instead of cruising along. I really hate the "Destination Fees" that hotels love to charge these days--here, it's $35.00 per day. The friendly receptionist informed us that we could use that towards food or beverages at the hotel, with the exception of one of the "hot" nightlife spots on the property. What she did not mention was that the $35.00 credit was only good for the first and second day of the stay, not our final day, and if the day's $35.00 was not used on it's issuance day, it could not be carried over. Our first day's $35.00 was thus useless since we checked in at midnight. And we were unpleasantly surprised that our $70.00 breakfast on our day of departure was billed to us (the hotel later agreed to remove the charge but only after lecturiing me about rules I should know on future visits). Another point in favor of the hotel is that our requested late checkout (based on Bonvoy Platinum status) was honored, and that's a huge benefit for travelers with late flights. We do a lot of weekends or longer stays in New York, and many other upper-end properties, including in and around Times Square, offer greater value and comfort.

title: Excelente en todo!
text:
Viajamos a Nueva York a celebrar nuestro 2o Aniversario de Bodas.
El hotel está Excelente en todo: ubicación, alimentos, bebidas, atención y servicio!
El único detalle es que aunque estábamos en el piso 23 con vista a Times Square, por la noche un grupo de motociclistas aceleraban muy fuerte sus motos y el ruido se escuchaba muy fuerte y era algo molesta, pero bueno, esto es algo ajeno al hotel.

title: Nice new refurbished hotel
text:
Right in the middle of the busy Times Square area without feeling that it is busy. Good lobby bar and perfect lounge area on the 9th floor where also breakfast is served.
They have there own club on the 7th floor. Nice but not extraordinary. All in  All a good experience.

title: Pleasantly surprised and amazed
text: We were looking for a hotel for 2 nights near Times Square.  Of course most were quite expensive as was this one, however Edition was not nearly as expensive as some others.  We were quite impressed! We had just returned from a cruise and arrived early (10:00 a.m.) fully expecting to just drop our luggage.  We were ushered in, told our room was ready and given royal treatment.  Room was beautiful, view of Times Square, amenities great.  Hotel staff was superior.  We were given a discount at the Hershey store and money to spend at the restaurant.  We would absolutely go back to this hotel.

title: Excellent location and extremely helpful staff
text:
I stayed for 3 nights and had a wonderful stay. The rooms are well equipped - although they are compact they have all amenities and are wonderfully furnished. I chose this hotel not for the room but for the location. Staying here made it so easy to see all parts of NYC whilst being in the heart of all of the excitement. 
The excellent feature however was the staff - guest services were amazing and were very helpful. Suki was especially helpful and made my stay truly memorable. Also having my delicious lunch delivered by  one of the staff who sang me happy birthday truly made my day.  A very special stay and I highly recommend this hotel

title: One night at Times Square Edition (work)
text: Stayed one night at still relatively new Edition Times Square.  Checked in on mobile app and received electronic key before I arrived.  Hotel overlooks Times Square with a lobby on 10th floor.  Several options for drinks / food, pretty solid workout facility and most important nice, modern, and comfortable rooms.  King bed with built in desk, chair with reading light, closet with steamer and minibar.   Lights controlled by various schemes from switch, rain shower, little speaker, and various other amenities.  Good use of space for small but typical size room in the city.  New go to for work trips!

title: Good but not Great
text: First the positives: staff are charming and try very hard - everyone across all departments excelled. Food is excellent and rooms well equipped albeit small even by NY standards. What doesn’t work is the ridiculous lift system - to get to breakfast you have to take two different lifts. Also incredibly, if your room overlooks Times Square, there are no blackout curtains so it is like being in a flashing neon light show all night. Also due to the construction projects on both sides of 47th St, the traffic is snarled up. Finally, Marriott need to get a grip of their environmental standards - laundry is returned in more plastic than currently resides in the world’s oceans. Overall a good stay but not sure I’d go back.

title: Wonderful !
text:
Great stay in a beautiful hotel !
Perfect view on time square !
Hotel close to everything in Manhattan !
The employees were super nice !
Nice big bed, good shower ...
When going back to NYC will probably go back here

title: Нормально, но в целом не очень соответствует ожиданиям
text: Отель на Таймс-Сквер. Достаточно чисто и дружелюбно. Номер дико тесный, вид не совсем тот, что нарисован на картинках и что хотелось бы видеть, хотя Таймс-Сквер частично видна. Высокий этаж, насколько я понял, это 30-40, у нас был 30, и в принципе это достаточно высоко, но вид не дотягивает до обычных ожиданий, на самом деле. В отеле берется какой-то ежедневный сбор за удобства, в который входит какая-то небольшая денежка на бары, прачечную и возможность посещения gym, но на самом деле это, конечно же, профанация (но с этим ничего не сделать). Ресепшн у них находится на 10 этаже, сначала едешь на одном лифте на ресепшн, потом на другом в номер. Персонал хороший, доброжелательный, расположение хорошее. Но обращайте внимание на площадь номеров, берите побольше, я взял относительно стандартный, но он очень неудобно скомпонован, и кажется, что очень и очень тесно.

title: Hotel ist schön aber es gibt ein echtes NO GO
text:
Das Hotel ist noch sehr neue gewesen als wir dort waren daher in sehr gutem Zustand. Die Einrichtung ist modern, designig und stylish, was uns sehr gut gefallen hat. Vorallem die Bar ist sehr schön. Die Zimmer sind ebenfalls sehr schön aber wirklich extrem klein - für zwei Personen mit großen Koffern gibt es definitiv nicht genug Platz um die Koffer abzulegen aber gleichzeitig auch nicht genügend Schrank um den Koffer auszupacken (nur 1 Mini-Schränkchen). Im Bad gibt es keine Möglichkeit Handtücher nach dem Duschen aufzuhängen, obwohl dies hier schon einmal angemerkt wurde und ja eigentlich ganz leicht zu ändern wäre. 

Das große ABER: Es gibt ein Destination Fee von 35€ pro Tag, der zusätzlich gezahlt werden MUSS. Dies ist vorab und während des gesamten Buchungsprozesses nicht ein einziges Mal erwähnt und begegnet einem wirklich erst beim Check In. An den 35€ pro Tag wäre es für uns nicht gescheitert, aber solche versteckten Kosten einzubauen ist keine feine Art. Das würden wir nicht mehr unterstützen.

title: Stylish am Times Square, pulsierendes Manhatten, tolles Haus........gerne wieder!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
text: Wir waren zur Fashionweek vor Ort und können das Haus nur empfehlen, sehr gut gelegen (Metrostation um die Ecke) sehr guter, aufmerksamer Service, die Extracharge für Telefon, Bar und Wäscheservice haben wir gerne und ausgiebig genutzt, sehr coole Räumlichkeiten ebensolches Publikum, Suite im 35. Stock mit Blick auf den Times Square grandios, (nachts muss man allerdings die Gardinen schließen denn der Times Square schläft nicht und es wäre dann sehr hell im Zimmer); Frühstück haben wir nicht genutzt da wir immer sehr zeitig das Haus verließen allerdings die wunderbare Rooftop Bar fast jeden Abend. Würde immer wieder hier absteigen!

title: Excelente ubicacion
text: El hotel cumple con todo lo que se le puede pedir, la mejor ubicación en times square, muy nuevo y limpio, atención por parte de todo el mundo impecable, la única pega si se le puede llamar así, es que las habitaciones son pequeñas, pero nuestra estancia de tres noches fue inmejorable en todos los aspectos.

title: Meraviglioso
text: L’albergo è bellissimo (sia le camere sia gli spazi comuni). Il ristorante ‘terrace’ è mozzafiato: un giardino vero sotto una cupola di vetro. I servizi sono eccellenti (lavanderia inclusa, corso di soul-spinning inclusi, palestra bellissima con vetrate su Times Square, hall bellissima, personale molto cordiale). Il prezzo non è bassissimo ma il rapporto qualità prezzo eccellente

title: Nice but small
text: Sono una cliente affezionata della catena the Edition e vi dico subito che se potete preferite quello in Madidon Square garden, Che a camere decisamente migliori e una location invidiabile. Questo albergo in times Square e l’ultimo nato della catena, è stato aperto nel marzo 2019 e ha gli standard di pulizia e design ma le camere sono microscopiche. Ho scelto una camera di categoria superiore ma dopo averne viste diverse mi sono resa conto che sono tutte uguali per cui non vale la pena investire in una tipologia di camera superiore. Quello che invece vale la pena è scegliere un piano alto perché il panorama su times Square è molto bello. L’albergo è nel cuore di Times Square, il personale è gentile e i ristoranti buoni. Il rapporto qualità prezzo non è dei migliori.

title: Over hyped Hotel
text: The rooms are tiny!!!! SMALLEST ROOMS IN NYC. Anyone who is a Marriott member there's zero chance of upgrades. I have stayed at this hotel 3 times no upgrades. My last stay i had 10 rooms, being a Ambassador and having 10 rooms one would think you would get upgraded NOPE. The doormen are fantastic always greet you by name, give great recommendations. They belong at a real 5 star hotel. Front desk personal needs work.

title: Know what you are buying
text:
Editions are a well designed, upscale hotel.  That’s the good.

But be aware of what you are purchasing. 

My gravest concern and be aware, see the empty lobby.  When I arrived there was no doorman and no security in the lobby.   For this reason alone, I would not stay here again.  A NYC Hotel should always have a doorman and security.  Perhaps the doorman we’re away getting a taxi,  but no luxury hotel should be without security EVER in this city, especially in Times Square. 

See the photo of the bathroom.  In the increasing competitiveness of NYC luxury hotels, bathrooms are large and extravagant.  Not here.  The bathroom is more than tiny and a curtain separates the room from the bathroom.  So if you want to sleep while another is using the bathroom, you will be awaken.

See the size of the room!  For this price, this is just not acceptable.  As a frequent guest as luxury hotels, I have never been in a room smaller for the money.

On balance, if you want Times Square and a well designed  HOTEL, the Edition is attractive.  But just understand the limitations of the design,where the bathroom allows little privacy, and the size of the room is tiny.

P.S. I notified management of the lack of security.  I returned to find a security officer with an ear piece stationed here. But it is a shame that it takes a complaining guest for security to be in place AT ALL TIMES.

title: Very brief but pleasant stay
text: I was only here for 12 hours for a quick business trip but interacted with enough elements of the hotel to write a review.  The hotel is beautifully decorated with modern decor but traditional architectural elements.  It really is an oasis in the middle of the grime and noise of Times Square. The standard room is beautiful (all white) but pretty small and the bathroom is not a separate room so there is little privacy.  Some nice features include wonderful slippers and robes, a clothes steamer, good lighting, lots of outlets, and nice hair dryer.  Room service was excellent and speedy.  Everyone I encountered was extremely gracious and service oriented.  The fine dining restaurant was also a lovely destination with excellent ambiance (great date spot), very good food and service.  The only downside is that the hotel entrance is very discreet on a one way street, making it very had for cab/Uber drivers to find.

title: One of the best service experiences ever in a hotel
text:
I recently stayed at the Times Square Edition, with my wife for an anniversary date night. I am happy to report that it was one of the best service experiences, hotel or otherwise, that I’ve had in a long time. The entire team - from the front desk, to the restaurant staff, to housekeeping - was welcoming, accommodating, and made us feel special at every turn. Suki and the rest of the guest experience team went above and beyond - although, while we felt like we were treated as if we were the only ones in the hotel, I got the sense that every guest is treated with this kind of personal focus, and that it is just the way they operate. Special call out to Brian at the front desk who warmly welcomed us - he set the tone, which the rest of the staff kept going. 

I have traveled a decent amount so have a pretty extensive sample of hotel experiences - I would put this in the top tier. To top it off, I realized two days after checking out that I left my brand new Apple Ear Pods I’m the room. The room decor is a clean white - a beautiful and soothing retreat from the intensity  of Times Square, but also serves as camouflage for Apple white!  The hotel team found the ear pods and put them aside in lost and found - one would hope this would always be the case, but rarely have I left something in a hotel room and been able to retrieve it. Just another example of the exceptional service level at this hotel, across the entire experience. Thanks Suki and team!!

title: Don't waste your money
text: My husband and I booked this hotel at the last minute, because our other "go to" Times Square hotels were fully booked.  I was looking forward to staying as the pictures made the hotel look beautiful.  The lobby was very nice and check-in was smooth.  The receptionist did say before we went to our room that it was very small.  Small is not a word I would use to describe this room.  Our room was not much larger than a closet or a prison cell.  It barely fit a queen sized bed and it is a good thing we did not bring much luggage, because there would have been no place to fit 2 full size pieces.  I have traveled extensively around the world and understand hotel rooms in large cities tend to be small, but this is next level.  Don't waste your money staying here.  There are many better options in Times Square that won't make you sleep in a closet. Shame on you Times Square Edition.

title: Superbe hôtel
text: Hôtel très bien situé, un peu bruyant tout de même côté Times Square, chambre propre et lumineuse, personnel sympa, climatisation trop fraîche mais dans tous les restaurants ou magasins qu'on a fait à New York c'est pareil, décoration et ambiance très bien. Juste le hall au rez de chaussée à revoir, trop sobre, pas de personnel à la réception, juste des portiers, il faut monter au 10ème étage pour la réception. Un spa serait le bienvenue avec piscine et salon de massage.

title: Modern Hideaway in the middle of Times Square
text: From the first interaction with the front door staff, this hotel is amazingly professional, refined, luxurious and trendy all at the same time. I don’t necessarily like to stay in Times Square, but if I’m in Manhattan for a weekend to see shows, there’s no better location. The staff is unsurpassed. Every single person enjoys what they’re doing, and that dedication is passed along to the guests. It’s now one of my favorite hotels anywhere.

title: Exquisite stay with outstanding personal service
text: We chose TS EDITION hotel for our celebratory stay (my daughter was turning 25 and we decided to meet up in NYC for this occasion) We chose it first because it is a very new hotel but the location could not be better - Times Square, and  also for the reputation of Edition Luxury line hotels we had stayed previously at other cities. Our experience was absolutely fabulous and exceeded all expectation for sure. Firstly, I would like to thank personally Suki Scott, Director Guest Experiences, for utmost personal touch and generous treats on my daughter's birthday, for personal time and attention prior and throughout our stay, I want to thank the whole staff starting from the reception and to the room service (Zonnie especially) who were readily available in no time matter to our slightest questions and requests, to waiters at the multiple dining lounges and restaurants available to the utmost convenience right at the hotel (beautiful outdoor terraces are not to be missed since they are true oasis right at the very heart of Manhattan). The only thing I wish for , would be for more time to stay and continue our EDITION adventure. Definitely outstanding hotel (I know you might read in other reviews that the rooms are small...well...bare in mind you are in NYC and right at Times Square  and if you spend too much time in the room , it is probably mostly in bed, and they are fabulous! PS so are showers and toiletries btw,) Also I found amazing that we had plenty of complimentary water and of course loved our twice a day room service (second being -getting ready your bed for the nighttime). All in all...As many times as we have stayed in NYC  previously, never ever had we have such a perfect in each and every way, stay and having this experience for such a special celebration will definitely be the main reason for us from now on to come back here again and again. (I have to tell you that the soundproof window system in rooms is amazing and we could not hear a thing of city noise with windows closed). So once again , thank you, everybody at EDITION for a very memorable amazing stay!

title: The only place to stay in Times Square
text:
Staying at the new Edition in Times Square was amazing. I was in NYC for a quick business trip and the location could not be beat. It was easy for me to walk a block in any direction and have full access to any transportation needed.

The staff at the property was kind, greeted me at every step through the lobby, and my name was used repeatedly by one of the managers, Suki. She took great care of me during my stay.

I entertained at one of the many bars, which my clients greatly enjoyed, and the rooms were QUIET right next to the loudest place in the city. I will be back.

title: Excellent service at a trendy NYC Hotel
text: Excellent service from the moment of checking in to check out to assistance to the car service for the airport.  Modern, small corner room overlooking Times-Square with very good amenities.  Bring a power strip with surge protection - limited outlets, although a business table with outlets in the Lobby Bar.

title: Fantastic stay in a stylish hotel
text: This is our second stay at an Edition hotel and I love the brand . From the moment we arrived the staff couldn’t have been more helpful and more friendly. The hotel is beautiful and has lots of choice for bars and eating etc . The Times Square location wouldn’t be my first choice however the hotel it’s self more than makes up for that . We have also stayed at the sister hotel in New York and the advantages the Times Square addition has is more choice of bars and dinning options within the hotel . The 701 bar is absolutely beautiful as well as the lobby bar . Rooms are small as would be expected in New York however the floor to ceiling windows add a sense of space as well as the tone of the decor . I seen a lot of reviews complaining about the $35 dollar per day service charge however this was not an issue for us as you have options to redeem this the main ones being $35 food and drink as well as an additional $50 dollars over and above that to spend on laundry every day , if you use these services it’s good value . we stayed in a premier Times Square view room and the view is just that it couldn’t be better. Wonderful stay and we will be back

title: Solid Hotel in Times Square
text: Personally I hate staying near Times Square because of the noise, crowds, and smells. However, the Edition, a relatively new property in the area, made my stay not only tolerable but pleasant. The rooms are large enough and modern. Fitness center is excellent. Bars and restaurants are outstanding. Staff helpfulness and attitude was variable but generally good.

title: Summer in The City
text: I really loved my stay here and the customer service was impeccable I wish the rooms were bigger because that would've been the icing on the cake however with the amazing rooftop and club I was hardly ever in my room thank you for an amazing stay I hope when I return I can explore getting a bigger room.

title: Fantastic view, great service. Modern trendy hotel
text: We stayed in the modern, trendy Times Square Hotel for 3 nights in September. We had a premium Times Square view room. The view really was spectacular, this was my first time in NYC and I certainly appreciated the sights from the room. Customer service was excellent, we used Tea the concierge for advice on what NYC sights we should visit and she gave us fantastic advice and booked our tickets for us. The room itself was quite small and minimalist, i guess that's fairly normal for this location, however it was clean and comfortable. We didn't eat here at all so can't comment on the food. The building has a nightclub spot which is located in the floors below reception, this doesn't affect the guests area apart from the lifts being busy sometimes when coming back to the hotel in the evening. Overall I would recommend this hotel, you are paying for location, not space, but I am glad we chose to stay here.

title: Beautiful hotel
text: Its location is remarkable, though whether it's a positive or negative attribute is certainly up for interpretation.  It is certainly in the thick of things, not typically what we would pick but given that we were in town for a short stay with two shows it suited our needs.  My expectations were low but they were exceeded for sure.  True service from start to finish.  Rooms were small but not cramped, decent for NYC, and there were clean and modern.  I was also surprised how quiet it was given the location.

title: Best new hotel in NYC - bar none!
text:
Having stayed in over a dozen four and five star NYC properties, this has to be my favourite so far! Brand new, a real oasis literally 30 feet from Times Square! Great views from the high view rooms of all the action in the Square!
Dining in the Terrace Room - outdoor balcony was outstanding!
The upscale lounge at 701 West was a great spot for drinks!
...add to that a nightclub on the 7th Floor that was just packed on Saturday night - well this hotel has it all.
Truly a five star resort with best location and great, efficient and friendly staff!

title: Disappointing service and experience
text: The hotel offers laundry credit with its destination fee but be careful with service!!! They lost my belt that comes with my favorite dress. Since they offer it as credit they outsource to many different laundromats and perhaps sub par quality ones! How is that acceptable. Moreover, the service was unprofessional - the manager was like “what do you want us to do, buy you a new belt?” and the staff are not well trained. You don’t just use your key and enter a guests room when they said can you come back. Also you don’t deliver room service by just entering the room with your own key unannounced.

title: Great hotel.
text:
Would love to give this hotel a 5 star rating, as its amazing. The location is awful though. And they have this ridiculous $35 per day resort fee. 
Service is superbly good, from the greeting at the front door, to the front desk, to the housekeeping. Staff cannot do enough for you. The room is quite small, but is very well proportioned, and beautiful inside. Le Labo products are an added bonus, and the big bed was extremely comfortable. 
We ordered room service once, was decent. 
Not really sure how they justify the $35 a day resort fee, seems to be a rather thinly veiled attempt at getting people to dine and drink at the hotel. The laundry and soul cycle benefits are irrelevant, I wonder how many people actually use this?
Anyway, great hotel, pity that its in the busiest part of Times Square, and the stupid $35 resort fee. We will stay in the other Edition next time.

title: Anniversary Trip
text:
A great hotel for a special occasion!   The staff was awesome and made our weekend memorable.  

In the center of Times Square, so the is plenty to do.   Minutes from the theater district, so very convenient 

The noise was a little loud on the lower floors of the hotel 

The in house Paradise Club is a must do.  While pricey the food and show were well worth the extra cost

The drinks and food were good but pretty expensive but the hotel is in the heat oof the city, so this shouldn’t be a surprise 

Highly recommend this for couples but would not recommend for families 

Very nice for a special occasion

title: Bedroom or bathroom?
text:
While I commend the hotel for what it is and appreciated the quality of service we were thoroughly disappointed with our room. We were told we'd been upgraded but after seeing the room - I couldn't even believe we'd even got what we'd booked as that was described as 'premium king'. The answer was we'd received a Times Square view, which I didn't feel cut it at all. 

The room was so small and, worst of all and the key warning here, the bathroom is part of the bedroom, which just doesn't work. 

There's no space or storage either. We were only there for 3 nights so didn't have too much with us. 

The photographer deserves an award for managing to hide the fact that the rooms are as they are. And there's not a mention in the room descriptions about the way they're presented, which is just not 5 star and grossly misleading. 

Not only would I not return to this hotel I'll not use Edition again, despite being a loyal and regular Bonvoy guest.

title: Best experience my group have had at Manhattan New York fine hotels.
text:
Great location and very clean ,modern rooms, my group have been to New York many times and stayed in the different fine hotels , but this is the best experience we have had. The best thing is the friendly stuff and the seamless arrangement , great attention the hotel have made for us, from the check-in to the every service we need, no waiting and worries at all, especially guest experience director Suki Scott, gave us her gracious patience, and unselfishness help, and a lot of lovely surprises!!!
Definitely come back ! Thank you Suki !

title: Great hotel with a twist
text: Booked a Saturday night stay at the hotel. Great staff at the front door and front desk. Bar area was a little weak. No tv’s or music. Room was perfectly sized. Small but never felt cramped. Here’s the twist....they charge a $35 service fee that is offset by a coupon card to be used at the restaurant as a credit. Only problem is that it is only good the day of arrival and not departure. They never explained that. Seemed like a bait and switch, oh wait...it was. Be careful of hidden fees when checking in.

title: Nice, place, clean, great staff
text: Chose the hotel for price, and economic size.  The place was extremely clean and the staff was awesome. the view from the 38th floor was awesome of the square and walking to anywhere was a breeze.  If you are looking to stay in the busy place, I'd recommend.

title: Totally recommend it
text: The attention was second to none. Have stayed at the best hotels around the world and the attention here was as good as any other. Didn’t feel like I was in the middle of Times Square.  I recommend the dinner and show at the Paradise Club. Worth the money.  Thanks Daniel Macias for expeditiously resolving a very small issue i had. The staff here makes you feel very special.

title: Will Be Back
text: I typically avoid Times Square like the plague but staying at the Edition TS has made me change my mind about that. From the moment I landed off a red eye from CA, the service was amazing. From front desk to the lobby bar, every individual was personable, friendly and the epitome of what I hoped the experience would be. Design elements were amazing in all the public spaces. Light and bright in some spaces and slightly dark and homey in others. It was the perfect place to invite others for a drink, coffee etc. My favorite space may have been the lobby bar as the bar team was super easy to talk to and quick and efficient. We did check out Paradise Club one of the nights and it was definitely a cool scene with some questionable individuals but fun nonetheless. Can't wait to come back and stay again. This is the first Edition Hotel I've had a chance to stay at but won't be the last.

title: amazing location
text: The hotel is absolutely amazing, great rooms and wonderful staff! We waited for quite a while until our breakfast was served, or actually someone to say hi and take our orders, but I still want to give the hotel 5/5, because the other staff members went out of their way to accommodate us!

title: Super!
text:
L’hotel e’ davvero bellissimo!
Le stanze sono un po’ piccole ma la nostra aveva una vista splendida su Times Square.
Il personale e’ preparato, gentile e sempre disponibile.
Complimenti anche per il ristorante!

title: An Excellent Edition!
text: We had the pleasure of staying at this nearly new property over a weekend and we were extremely pleased with the hotel. We were initially a little concerned that we were going to be perched above Times Square and that it would be noisy. The property seems to be extremely well built and the soundproofing was excellent. Other than the usual sounds of the city such as first responder vehicles and the like, it was as peaceful as could be expected. The rooms are on the small side but they are beautifully appointed and extremely comfortable with good lighting and really well thought out. The staff are a major highlight and a positive for the property. Super friendly and polite and very service-oriented. From the front door, to check in, to the lounge to the hotel operator, and even the chambermaids, everyone seems happy to be working there and they go above and beyond to help make guests feel welcome. Warm smiles and pleasant greetings are in full supply! We would not hesitate to recommend this property and we will definitely stay there again.

title: Excellent service
text: The service was great.  We had a beautiful detail waiting for us at the room once they learned my wife and I were there for a special occasion.  She even lost her bracelet and they returned it to her. Modern hotel, beautiful, excellent location, but the best, its staff.  Thank you

title: very cool hotel
text: We got three rooms at the Edition hotel and loved every minute of our stay.  The rooms are very comfortable, clean, and modern. The service was impeccable. We also loved the location.  We were on the 39th floor, so we didn't hear any street noise at all. We are looking forward to staying at the Edition when we visit NY again.

title: Beware of Destination Fee
