text: The Hotel by himself is OK but they charge 35 USD Destination Fee which was not communicated at time of booking. Therefore for me it is unacceptable. There are a lot of Hotels which charge you not a fee on this amount so I will never book again!!!!!

title: Wonderful hotel
text: Service was excellent. The rooms are small yet typical for the city. Everyone friendly and really went out of their way to he helpful! Will stay again. The lobby smells wonderful. Rooms were surprisingly quiet.

title: Good and not so good
text:
First hotel is brand new and therefore great time to visit.  Terrace restaurant is beautiful and food is very good.  Even more overpriced though than to be expected though.  

Rooms are incredibly and oddly small with the exception of the 26 suites.  If you plan on spending any time for anything other than sleeping don’t stay here.  

Common areas and bars are very nice.  

Staff is very courteous .  

Toiletries le labo are exceptional.  

$35/day charge added to the daily rate seems to be a bit over the top.  For the charge you get a credit for food and beverage plus 50.00 credit for laundry, however, I wouldn’t think the hotel would need use this questionable ploy to keep guests on site for food and drink.  

Bottom line is for the price paid the rooms at this property are way too small and the location is a bit much unless you really are seeking the craziness and crowds of Times Square.

title: Brilliant location
text:
Stayed here for a 4 day break in New York and it was brilliant!   The room was a good size for a city hotel, and the view of Times Square was memorising.
Hotel staff were all very helpful and the roof top bar was the perfect place to start and end our evening. 
We didn't notice noise - unlike some reviews.  And generally Times Square is quiet by midnight.
Would definitely recommend it

title: A trendy hidden gem
text: The Times Square Edition hotel offered calm in the hectic location of Times Square. The rooms, although small are very comfortable and clean. The bar terrace is fantastic. The location of the hotel is 5*, very easy to walk to a whole host of attractions from the hotel.

title: Spectacular hotel in the heart of NYC
text:
As with all EDITION properties, this is a spectacular hotel.  From the time you step into the lobby you know you are staying in a high end property.

The room was a good size.  The bed was very comfortable.  It was decorated very beautifully in a modern aesthetic.  

The staff was warm, welcoming and very helpful.  If I needed anything they were right on it.

The location is fantastic.  You are right in the heart of NYC and you have easy access to many tourist attractions, broadway and public transportation.  

My only complaint is that being right in Times Square it was a bit noisier than I would have liked.  But turning on the white noise app on my phone helped drown it out.

title: Nice stay
text: Nearly new hotel right in the heart of Times Square.  Be prepared for some noise and lights, even at 35+ floors up.  But hey, its New York!  Staff were great, save the front desk staff which were surprisingly only average.  Rooms are very modern / European and also very small.  The sink is IN the bedroom with a curtain to divide.  Id suggest you only stay with someone you know very well.  Bar looked nice.  Certainly an upscale clientele at this hotel.

title: An oasis above Times Square but be prepared for small rooms
text:
I stayed her for 4 nights as part of a business trip.

There is much to like about this hotel. The location is literally right on Times Square which if that is your bag is a good thing. I personally am not a fan of Times Square - why does anyone want to go here? - but that is not the fault of the hotel.

The hotel is modern, beautifully appointed and brand new. The reception is on the 10th floor and the restaurant and bar are stunning and with great food and service. One morning I was in a rush over breakfast and at my request I was served and out in 15 mins, yet my omelette was still delicious. Great service.

What you will have to get used to is a very small room. Sure it’s well appointed and the amenities generous but you will have to edge your way around the bed and the wardrobe and seating are cramped. I know NY has small rooms but this is a first for me, even beating the Standard High Line for an authentic dolls house feel.

I was on the 38th floor and the room was beautifully quiet and peaceful.

My only issue was the Wi-fi tech. For some reason my Chromebook would not reliably connect so after a period of time I could not get Wi-fi which made work (on my bed because the desk is literally a shelf) difficult. My iPhone was fine.

Also when I was “issued” a Marriott Bonvoy digital room key, the physical key stopped working. Inexplicable.The tech in this hotel is hit and miss so I would suggest the leadership team here have a word with their systems department...

If you want to stay near Times Square then this is a quiet, beautiful hotel with a gorgeous bar and restaurant. The rooms are small and the tech anything but modern.

title: Non un hotel 5 stelle
text:
Arriviamo dalle Bahamas per goderci gli ultimi giorni di vacanza, abbiamo tanti bagagli . Ci hanno dato una camera minuscola per tre persone. Chiediamo se ci fosse la possibilità di avere una camera più grande co esito negativo. Mi dicono che l’hotel si concentra nel servizio. Telefono al Guest Service per fare riordinarle la camera dopo le 21,00, torniamo dopo cena e la camera non e’ stata fatta !!!! Complimenti per il vostro meraviglioso servizio.
Assolutamente non all’altezza di un 5 stelle!! Telefono al front desk manager per il servizio pessimo, mi risponde che le camere sono così sorvolando per il pessimo servizio!!!! Complimenti per il vostro Hotel 5 Stelle !!! Forse non avete  nemmeno un idea di cosa sia un 5 stelle !!!!

title: A green escape at the worlds cross roads
text: I am a fan of The Edition so we decide to brunch and the new Edition in Time Square at The Terrace. First it’s surprisingly tranquil in the green house space with doors open to the terrace. I chose to have the Angel of Music since we were in the heart of Broadway. It was a light refreshing summer cocktail that pumped up the Rose’. For my main course I had the classic Steak & Eggs, but the breakfast potatoes were no  ordinary potatoes they were twice fried and so delectable. The steak was perfectly prepared. My friends loved their meals as well. One piece of advice, if your in a hurry select another place, the service was not fast, but nice.

title: 1 nighter
text:
I only spent one night here but the stay was fantastic. The guy who checked me in wasn’t too friendly or welcoming and he should smile more but everyone else was awesome. The door guys and the waitress Natalya, and the guy who checked me out (with the beard) were awesome and super kind. 
The room was beautiful and super comfortable. I reserved the “Time Square View Room” but didn’t get much of a view- they might’ve given me the wrong room. I mean, I could see Time Square but just a tiny part of it through the crack of my window. The entire stay was awesome. The only thing that irked me was that there was a dirty ring around the toilet bowl.

title: Hôtel surfait
text: Un hôtel comme beaucoup aujourd’hui qui veut se donner un style cool, différent ... ça commence dès le lobby ambiance salon de lecture du 16ème, murs noirs , très peu de lumière . Quel contraste avec la rue . Nous avons séjourné une nuit dans une chambre avec deux lits . La taille est suffisante pour une nuit mais franchement , nous n’aurions pas aimé y rester davantage . Pour un hôtel de cette catégorie , pas de bouteille d’eau dans la chambre. En revanche 32ème étage , pas de bruit. Pour une nuit au cœur de Times Square pourquoi pas .. encore faut il pouvoir payer le prix expensive .

title: Herrlich und richtig stylisch
text:
Unser erster Trip nach NY!

Durch Zufall bekamen wir im nagelneu eröffneten The Times Square EDITION ein Zimmer mit Blick auf den Times Square zu einem moderaten Preis!

Die Lobby dieses extrem stylischer Hotels ist im 10. Stock; Restaurants, Bars und Club sind auf 7-11 verteilt.
Unser Zimmer mit toller Aussicht war auf 32 und wirklich stylisch!!!

Durch die Lage ist dieses Hotel perfekt für einen City-Trip - wir haben fast alles zu Fuß erreicht; muss man aber nicht!

Next time NY - next time EDITION!!!

title: Très bon Etablissement
text:
Très bon établissement.
Qualité de service notamment des "Doors Mans", et de la réception.
Le service d'étage est un peu moins "parfait", oubli de faire la chambre, remise des produits d'accueil un peu aléatoire.
Les lits sont plus de standard Européen qu"Américain en terme de taille et la chambre aussi d'ailleurs.
Néanmoins, un hôtel moderne et sympa mais sans doute moins adapté pour une famille qu'en couple ou en déplacement pro.

Un excellent hôtel qui peut encore s'améliorer sur qq points néanmoins.

title: Outstanding stay!
text: We were only there for one night (a few weeks back - sorry for the late review!) but the staff left a lasting impression in the few interactions we had.  Special thanks to both Tea and Suki who went above and beyond on several occasions to be sure we had everything we needed and then some. The door + bell staff were also extremely pleasant and eager to help at every turn. It was a great stay overall, but it was the kindness and attention to detail that Suki and Tea showed that now have us calling the Edition our home away from home after just the one visit. Can't wait for our next stay!

title: 5 stelle
text: Ho soggiornato in questo hotel con la mia famiglia. Camere nuovissime e pulite ma soprattutto personale gentilissimo. Ristorante dell’hotel sembra un giardino all’aperto. Anche il bar offre una vista impagabile.

title: Amazing Experience!
text: Wow! Everything about this hotel is amazing! I recently stayed at this hotel for 2 nights/3 days, first of all all the staff is amazing, so courteous, you truly feel welcomed in this hotel (Pablo is amazing!) I can't emphasize it enough, very attentive hotel staff! The design is minimalistic yet so inviting, every little detail was well thought, very beautiful design. The room was simple and beautiful, great bed, toiletries (Le Labo) shower, robe, slippers, I mean we loved everything. We had dinner and drinks on their Terrace and outdoor gardens, the place is magical. We also went to the Paradise Club, nice and crazy! The lobby bar was nice as well, make sure you sit outside, great views! We would definitely stay there again.

title: Our best ever hotel stay!
text:
I've traveled extensively for work and pleasure and have never been treated so well at a hotel. My family of four had a heckuva UBER from the airport and as soon as we pulled up the Crew of Aaron and other great doormen carefully grabbed our bags and welcomed us inside. This would be normal at any hotel I suppose, however, I noticed our doorman checking the UBER seats front and back to make sure we didn't forget anything. As soon as we entered the main entrance we had the best feeling of relaxation. 100 degrees out with added humidity, noise of Times Square was instantly gone. Replaced was a pleasant smell and refreshing temp.
 We were early for check in and was greeted not as an early burden for staff, but as them thankful for us being there. As soon as I approached the desk the staff asked if we could use some cold water. (I must have looked sticky) He put a call out to the maid service and said he'd call within 20 min. Our bags secured at the desk, left us to wander around the very modern public areas and found a spot on the balcony near the bar. Incredible view!10 min later we were headed up to our room with our doorman still in tow with bags who placed our bags where we'd like in the room. The rooms are New York size, but the use of space is great. Bathrooms are the perfect size and gave plenty of space for us. The lighting is unlike any place I've stayed. Very creative controls that let you control the several lighting arrangements. Comfortable beds and linens and extremely quiet. We never heard another door shut or another guest. We saw them in the halls but never heard a peep. 
Our coming and leaving the hotel was a pleasure visiting briefly with staff who remembered our names and always ended every interaction with can I help you or can I get you somewhere? Riley and his team at the front desk were all so great. 
Upon checking out we said aloud that we will miss the hotel fragrance. Boom,we were given some take home swag. 
From the greeting to the checkout our stay was fantastic and Aaron the doorman even hooked us up with a great ride back to the airport in a luxury SUV for the price of an UBER. Well done everyone, we will be back.

title: Charming place
text:
Great place to stay. 
The location is unbeatable and the room is modern luxury with class. Their lotion smells unique and amazing.
The staff are friendly and helpful - they went out to broadway ave to catch cab for me and gave fun perks out. The bar and food are great too. Highly recommend to anyone.

title: Wonderful experience
text:
I stayed in this hotel a couple of weeks ago, and I couldn´t be happier to have chosen it. You immediately feel the professionalism and the dedication to service that all the employees have as soon as you arrive. 
Huge thanks to Ms. Suki, Ammy, Jeron, Fernando and all the team in the front desk, they were always ready to assist us with anything with a unique kindness.   
The property is wonderful and the location is the best in town, we also tried 701West and the cocktails were a delight for our palates. 
It was our first time in New York and we will definitely have lasting memories of our stay thanks to the EDITION.

title: Beautiful Hotel
text:
I stayed one night for business at The Times Square Edition in May. The hotel is a few blocks from my office, so it was convenient to be able to walk in to the office.

The room is small (though that in itself is normal for NYC). The toiletries are Le Labo, so that is great. I wasn't a huge fan of the room design itself. There was only one hook in the entire room. There is basically no desk--it is just a long table that has a chair. This made working from the room inconvenient. I also wasn't a fan of the split toilet/shower design.

I was a little irritated with the front desk. I asked for late check out and was not given it. A colleague, however, asked 15 minutes later and received it (and he has no Marriott status while I do). This lack of consistency (as well as some difficulties splitting part of my bill to a different card) really showed that the staff is still learning.

All in all, I'd stay again, but not for business.

title: Poor Service
text:
Staying at the hotel currently and experienced bad service

1. Returned to the room at 5:30 pm after full day site seeing and the room was not cleaned. When checked with the staff, the reply was the hotel has many rooms so it was not cleaned. That’s a bad reason. 

2. Slow service at the breakfast. Took almost 1/2 hr for the food to arrive. 

Let’s see how the next 2 nights go.

title: The Edition sets the bar
text: I usually do not stay in Time Square, but I was curious about the new Edition property.  Edition truly delivers on it's promise of truly luxurious accommodations — complete with a dining scene that has Michelin-star ambitions.  The staff is incredible.  The attention to detail from the doormen to the wait staff really made me feel at home.  I will ensure to stay at the Edition anytime I am in NYC for work.  It is now my favorite brand.

title: Great hotel
text: We stayed at their location on Miami Beach and decided to try them in NYC. Great hotel, fantastic staff, very friendly and helpful. Room was on the corner with a balcony over looking Time Square. We were surprised that we couldn’t hear the noise from outside besides the bikers that revved their motors. Bed was very comfortable and the suite was a descent size and very clean. I would recommend this location to anyone that wants to be in the middle of it all. For me it was way to busy however I will try their other location in NY. We have a great stay and they did everything right, I just didn’t like the location

title: Birthday Staycation
text: I haven't posted on Trip Advisor in a few years, even though we have stayed in many incredible hotels in NYC including many Marriott properties, Hyatts, Hiltons, and a few lesser known ones.  All were fabulous.  But, not as FABULOUS as The Times Square Edition!  Suki in guest experience was one of the nicest and kindest people I have ever had the privilege of communicating with.  She made my milestone birthday something out of my wildest dreams.  Everyone is extremely friendly and accommodating at this brand new hotel.  The food is delicious. The hotel is spotless and downright gleams!  So many outdoor spaces.  Such elegance without ever being pretentious.  The room we had (corner balcony Times Square view) was exceptional.  There was truly nothing we did not enjoy about our overnight experience and we have already booked in another longer stay with family for October!  Again, we have been very lucky to have had so many great hotel experiences over the past 20 years together, some local and some in more remote locales and even in other countries.  But, something about this staycation definitely warranted a review and I am here to say that we LOVE the Times Square Edition and plan to keep returning whenever we can to experience an oasis of luxury and serenity high above the hustle and bustle of Times Square!  Thank you Suki and all team members for running such a well oiled machine and for making customer service seem second nature! Fans for life! The ADDITION of THE EDITION is grand!

title: Incredible hotel with a top-notch staff
text:
A lot of the other reviews on this page discuss the hotel itself in more detail, but I wanted to take some time to show some love to the first-class staff at this hotel!

I have been staying at this hotel weekly since April 2019 for corporate business travel and it has exceeded my expectations every time. 

From the moment I'm greeted by the doormen, I feel like I'm at home. If you are lucky enough to cross paths with Johnny, Tonin, Jose, or Jing at the door, you are in excellent hands. Through their attentiveness, knowledge, and energy, each one of them has made my Edition experience feel like home and they are a key reason I come back every week. They will make sure your needs are met throughout your stay and are hands down the best door guys in the city.

Additionally, once you reach the lobby, the front desk people are equally as bubbly and accommodating. In particular, Brendan, Brian, Rose, and Andrew G. have always been quick and attentive to any special needs or requests that I have had while maintaining the kindest attitude. Their hard work in always making guests feel comfortable does not go unnoticed, as they treat each guest (myself included) with the utmost respect and care in making sure your stay is worthwhile.

Additionally, dealing with the other staff/teams at the Edition (e.g. Andrea P. from the Sales team) has been nothing short of spectacular. Andrea and the rest of her team have gone above and beyond every time to accomodate any request I have had and always make sure that I am comfortable and enjoying my stay each week. I am super appreciative and thankful that Andrea and the rest of her team truly value my loyalty and have made my stays feel like home. 

As a frequent business traveler, it's tough to find a hotel that feels like home. However, the staff at this hotel truly have made my experience each week feel so special and have made this hotel feel like my second home. Thanks to you all!

title: Quick weekend trip for my cousin's birthday
text: My experience with my cousin was superb from start to finish! Before we even got to the hotel, the guest experiences manager Suki went above and beyond to make sure we had a great stay. They comped us a free bottle of champagne for my cousin's birthday and even wrote her a note. Those personal touches really go a long way with customers. Our room was really clean, the lighting was amazing (don't know how many people care about this, but when you are trying to do makeup this is key), the furnishings were beautiful and the bed was comfortable. My one complaint would be that because of the location in Times Square, it could be loud at times. Oh and they had Le Labo bath products which all smell incredible! I want to thank the entire staff for creating such a memorable experience for us. We enjoyed every minute!

title: An Amazing Stay - Yes, Even In Times Square
text:
Our stay here this weekend FAR exceeded our expectations and we already cannot wait to find an excuse to come back. I was certainly hesitant to book here given that it is fairly new AND located in Times Square. However, we had tickets to a show and were looking for convenience. 
I cannot say enough great things about The Edition. We arrived to a wonderful birthday surprise in the room (a sweet treat, wine, and a very cute note!). This level of service and attention to detail is what we experienced every moment of our stay. While The Edition is of course a more upscale hotel, what TRULY sets it apart is the staff. From the moment we arrived every single person we came in contact with was incredibly pleasant and went above and beyond to tend to any needs we may have.
 While this may be a small detail, it is this type of service that sets this hotel apart from most others. The hotel is beautiful. Every single space is decorated so thoughtfully. We enjoyed time spent on the amazing terrace enjoying delicious drinks in such a beautiful setting. (how was this Times Square???)  The service, however, will always be what we remember (and what brings us back). Each time we returned to the hotel, the doormen remembered us and referred to us by name. They hold the door, call the elevator, offer you water, the list goes on and on...
Long story short. Go! You will NOT be disappointed.

title: מיקום נפלא על הטיימס סקואר ומלון איכותי ומודרני
text:
המלון מתהדר בכמה עובדות, ובצדק. שף של כמה כוכבים שאחראי על שפע המסעדות של המלון, המקום עם הבאז הכי חם בעיר, הבארים שלו מלאים מדי ערב ביפות וביפים של ניו יורק ושל התיירים.

החדרים נהדרים, נקיים, מאובזרים להפליא, מקלחת כמו בחלומות שלא להזכיר את הריח של השמפו והסבון.

מגבות לבנות נוצצות ומדיפות ריח טוב כבר היו לי, אבל חלוק רחצה כזה טרם ראיתי בחיי. כל כך רך ומחבק, אממה, כמו הרבה דברים במלון המחיר 150$ מעט מופרז. אני מצרף צילום של החלוק ושל תג היצרן, חפשו אותו וקנו לכם כזה.

הבר מציע שפע ראוי לשמו של משקאות. סצינת הקוקטיילים מפותחת היטב. המחירים יקרים, אך השירות הטוב והאווירה מחפים עליו.

title: 4th of July in NYC
text:
Our stay at the Edition was excellent. Our room was clean modern and the floor to ceiling windows provided a wonderful view. The scent you get arriving at the hotel is so inviting you don't want to leave.  We had dinner and a breakfast in the Terrace Bar the food was excellent and service fantastic.

The staff of the hotel is so welcoming and guided us to our room and made us feel very welcome.

will definitely stay again

title: Oasis of clean calmness
text:
We stayed with family and it’s a new so very clean and fresh hotel with a hip vibe. 

Rooms were immaculate albeit small ( but understand that is NY).... you walk in from the craziness of Times Square to be met with an oasis of calm. Also Broadway and the theatres are on its doorstep. 

(For cheap tickets go to the TKTs booth 2 mins for 2:30pm. Queue and it opens at 3pm and we had half price tickets to King Kong by 3:15. You can only get them for same evening shows). 

All the young staff at hotel were super helpful and friendly and efficient so 10/10 there and high levels of security. 

They do have a nightclub on the 9th so lifts can get busy in evening but it makes it cool. 

We made mistake of having breakfast outside for first two days but actually for similar cost the hotel’s  breakfast was far better quality and classier than the tourist traps outside. 

Also make sure you go all the way through the restaurants to the back as they have are larger than they look with cool outside terraces. 

Only negative was the compulsory resort fee of $35 plus taxes. We managed to use some of the credit on laundry and drinks but away from the cost there is the embarrassment factor of people at the Hershey store downstairs refusing the 25% discount you get as part of paying the resort fee. My kids were told every day that it was only available on different counters  who then said not it was a different counter ... not sure why a high end hotel would embarrass it clients in this way and should just increase the hotel rate. Just assume you will be paying $37 extra a night and if you manage to use the credit that’s only a bonus so you don’t spoil your trip by focussing too much on this charge. 

Other than that and size of room nice hotel with good staff and so if I was watching a lot of shows or intending to spend a lot of time at Times Square it’s a good base. 

(Also note there is no parking - it’s all kerbside drop off and collect )

title: Birthday Celebration
text: I recently stayed at the Times Square Edition to celebrate my birthday and everything was simply amazing! I work in the hotel industry and have to say the service provided was top notch and the hotel is absolutely stunning! Special thank you to the Concierge Team who went above and beyond to make my birthday extra special! Megan and Tea surprised me with a nice welcome amenity in my room and provided me and my friends with a specialty cocktail in the Lobby Bar which was the perfect touch right before we headed out for an awesome dinner. Thank you, again for making my stay so memorable. I highly recommend this hotel and will be back soon!

title: Until Next Time
text: One of, if not the best places I have stayed. Our stay at The Edition set the tone for our NYC trip. It started with the incredibly warm welcome from Aaron at the door. He was extremely courteous, professional, and knowledgeable. He provided excellent recommendations and ensured our every need was attended to. After our warm welcome, we entered the lobby which emanated a clean and refreshing smell. Our room had a great view overlooking Time Square, the Hudson River in the distance through the gap in the skyline. My expectations were far exceeded.

title: Excellent
text: Great new ish hotel. Friendly helpful staff, rooms well appointed though small, modern clean and right in the heart of Times Square. We found the terrace bar really very good, good service and drinks and a little oasis from the hustle and bustle and breakfast was fabulous though pricey. We would definitely stay again a cut above the average New York hotel.

title: Amazing staff
text: Very professional and friendly staff, nice welcoming atmosphere, everything fresh and new. Super cool Times Square views from open terrace, well done drinks. Only thing to improve is breakfast: is a la carte (which i like) but i would say more options and better presentation  will be great

title: Hotel novo no coração da Times Square
text:
Sabe quando você vai a um restaurante moderno e caro e o chef international e renomado manda um prato gigante com um pouquinho de comida no meio e isso custa o olho da cara mas todo mundo adora? 

Pois é pegaram essa ideia e fizeram um hotel inteiro pensando nisso 

Os quartos são limpos e novos, a decoração é bem minimalista em todos os andares, até mesmo na recepção. 

Existe uma taxa de 35 dólares por dia além do preço da diária, que será debitada de seu cartão no fim da estadia, mas em troca você recebe 30 dólares de desconto por dia em alimentação, 65 dólares de lavanderia e 20% de desconto em alguns produtos da loja da Hershey's que fica exatamente abaixo.

O hotel é muito bom e um ótimo custo benefício, principalmente para quem quer ficar no meio da bagunça da New York, o serviço de quarto e suporte do hotel são muito preparados e atenciosos, mas não encontramos alguém que falasse português.

Cuidado ao pegar o táxi no aeroporto, o hotel é bastante novo e existe o risco do taxista não conhecer o lugar e por conta do sotaque achar que vc disse "Hotel Edison" (aconteceu comigo)

title: Simply the best
text:
We have just got back from one of best trips we have ever taken. We are fortunate enough to have travelled around the world and stayed in many 5 star hotels. I can honestly say this hotel was one of the best, truly amazing and filled with fantastic people who could not do enough to help. 

The hotel is like a luxury boutique hotel, almost giving the feel of your own private mansion, without losing the 5 star touch.

I would highly recommend this hotel for location, luxury and relaxation. The big time square screens are at your front door, next to the subway and then you are one step back into peace, tranquility and luxury.

The customer liaison manager Ana looked after us so well that we actually became friends and will stay in touch. 

Thank you to Ana and all the staff for our amazing trip. We look forward to our return.

title: One of the best hotels I’ve stayed at
text: I only stayed here for a night on a quick stop to nyc but I loved it. The hotel is great and clean - modern and minimalistic. But I think the service is what put it over the top. Everyone was so pleasant and helpful. They really made my stop in worth it. I’ll be back the next time I’m in town.

title: Excellent!
text: This hotel has everything to make the stay the better it can be at NYC. The staff team works pleasure to make the stay fantastic, they are always ready to help and works Very fast! My family and I arrived at JFK airport around 6am, and at Edition almost 8am - even being earlier than the common check-in time, our room was already waiting for us and we could enter the room at 8am! The rooms has everything to make it a 5 star hotel - big beds, preety decoration and good food. The restaurant is awesome and the room dervixe as well. The hotel is locares at the heart of Times Square and by paying the 35 dollar charge per day you get a lot of bennefits (in Ighor hotels, this charge does not allows the guest to nothing else but the common stay) - as 25% discount at Hershey’s store, a 35 dollars credit to use in the hotel’s restaurants and 50 dollars to use in laundry. Finally, can’t think a better place to stay at NYC than this! Thank you for the excellent staff team and hope to be Back soon!

title: Great location, tiny rooms
text: When we arrived, our room was not ready, so they offered us a drink at the terrace bar, which was very nice. One night we were awoken by the fire alarm at 2 am, followed by a very garbled message on the room intercom. Not sure what to do, we walked down to the ground floor with a few other guests.  We waited for about 25 minutes, and then were told that it was ok to return to our rooms. I would have liked to see a fire truck or a fire official, but was assured that it was a false alarm.  For this inconvenience, we were not charged for the night. I am not sure where this hotel would like to go in terms of marketing: there were other families (some with younger kids) however we found several adult entertainment items on the hospitality tray.  The view was great, but the rooms are tiny for 3 (2 queen beds) and the bathroom has no space to hang anything up or place for toilet bags.

title: Great for couples
text: When we arrived, the room was no ready, so they offered us a drink at the terrace bar,which was lovely. Our room was tiny for 3 people, 2 queen beds, on the 34th floor. On the second night, we were awoken by the fire alarm at 2 a.m. and then a announcement came on (in the room) which was totally garbled and unclear, so we left and walked down to the ground floor, where we waited for approximately 25 minutes. I would have liked to see a fire truck or a fire official before we were given the go-ahead to return to our rooms, but we were told that the hotel had been checked and it was false alarm.  For this inconvenience, the hotel did give us a free night. Overall, I am not sure where this hotel wants to go: there were families, but on the hospitality tray we found adult material. I think it is a great hotel for couples for a weekend in NYC, its got a great vibe and design.Not sure if I would stay here again.

title: Shoebox rooms
text:
be forewarned: this is a more attractive W HOTEL, overrun with an under 30 demographic. Yes, the public spaces are lovely and relaxing. However none of it is worth the claustrophobic shoebox rooms.  

The bed, which is not particularly great, is virtually in the bathroom. There is perhaps 18 inches on two sides of the bed and then about 36 inches on the window side. One 3/4 size arm chair. Another chair that is unusable because you can’t pull it out from the slab of wood that passes as a desk...without bumping into the bed. 

Amenities in bathroom: soap,shampoo ,conditioner lotion. That was it. oh wait I’m sorry Cotton balls and Q-tips. Not so much as a hook for a towel. The minibar was basically in the closet. 

The restaurant where you can get breakfast is absolutely beautiful. The food is, as expected, overpriced and OK -nothing more. We had a small breakfast there one morning to the tune of $70 And it was unquestionably great relaxing and lovely, if a bit price.  There is a Starbucks across the street.

We were there for a quick weekend getaway...Honestly couldn’t get out of what felt like a dorm room fast enough!

title: Hidden Oasis in the middle of Times Square
text:
Times square is a tricky place to find a relaxing environment. Edition has managed to create an oasis within the hustle and bustle of NYC. I was there to celebrate a birthday on the tail end of a business trip and the hotel could not have been more welcoming. I walked into a room with a light, breezy, spa-like feel, and a special birthday treat waiting for me on the table.

I appreciated the automated buttons within the room that control everything from temperature, lighting, to drapes and sheers. Bathroom ameneties are a delicious exclusive Le Labo scent and the kind of amenity bottles you find room for in your bag before leaving. 

Director of Experience, Suki Scott, hit it out of the park with every recommendation, reservation and interaction. Thank you Suki for making every minute of my very short stay at the Edition like a dream.

title: Perfume
text: Logo na entrada já se sente o perfume característico do hotel, que estará presente no quarto, no shampoo.. As pessoas atendem com  um sorriso e são prestativos. No quarto, a cama é confortável e o chuveiro bom. O restaurante achei lindo! E o meu prato estava delicioso! A localização é excelente, ao lado da Times Square. Super indico.

title: Very bad service and management
text:
The Times Square edition 

3 nights stay 
From the first day 
We checked in using Marriott Bonvoy application and we mentioned that we will arrive to the hotel at 4 PM 
And we asked for airport pick up 
Everything was good until we reached the hotel at 5 PM
Our room was not ready 
The first shock was the front desk did not even know how long we will stay until we receive the room 
Anyway, the stay ( what a shame) 
First night room was not cleaned and when we called them at 7 PM ( after we came to hotel to change our clothes) 
We came back at night ( around 11 PM) to find that they only made the bed and clean the garbage but did not add used items like ( shower gel, shampoo, tissues ) 
Did not change towels 
Took the used ones and did not get new 
They even did not clean the water sink in the bathroom from hair and tooth paste
Second night we are out all day and 7:23 entered the room to find house keeping did not touch our room
This hotel does not deserve a 3 star ranking and I advice Marriott Bonvoy to remove it from there system or mention that it is one of cheap hotels that is 1-3 stars max 
Well, I can’t say the location is not nice but the service is very bad

title: Better than imagined. Amazing suite.
text: The edition is on my top list of amazing hotels. We got the suite with the balcony overlooking Times Square. Just breathtaking. You can see all the lights and the happenings at the Square. The breakfast was great. Everything cooked perfectly which is hard for me to say since I order well done steaks. This one was perfect. The service just as expected. Everyone was super nice and attentive. I don’t have any negative remarks about anything. Even the smell coming in is special to the edition. Must come and see for yourself.

title: July visit
text: This is a nice hotel if you want to stay in the super crowded Times Square area. The bedroom and bathroom were nice. Although I will say the bathroom sink is poorly designed. The gym is spacious. There is no spa/pool area. The restaurant terrace area is quite lovely. No buffet but they give you a hotel credit for food and laundry. The hotel has its own scent, both in the common areas and bath products. I don’t care for the smell. Overall it’s a nice hotel.

title: Small rooms, but super service.
text:
I stayed here for the first four days of a seven night trip in May.

The hotel location is both a blessing and a curse. It's awful to get in and out off by taxi. On arrival, I asked to be dropped a block away rather than pay just to sit in traffic. But for getting around by MTA, it's great. 

The rooms are small, and the decor is beautiful. The room is well appointed and for a solo person, it wasn't impractical. For two people I would consider a suite but that is a big jump in price.
I had a Times Square view and I didn't have any issues with outside noise, nor indoor noise (except for the fire alarm for one night). 
I would prefer an empty fridge like they have at the Hyatt Centric. 

I had $100 food credit and used it for breakfast. The Terrace is gorgeous and the food was great, although at the prices I probably would have only gone the one time if not for the credit. 

The best thing about the hotel was the service. Everyone was incredibly friendly, especially the doormen. Even after I went to my second hotel, I passed by and they said hello to me and helped me with transport to the airport.

title: Love this hotel!
text: The Times Square Edition is a perfect hotel for a weekend vacation to NYC. The rooms are gorgeous, the bar and lounge areas are perfectly setup and the restaurant is as if you are in a tropical setting. You forget that you're in the heart of Times Square. It does get a little noisy if there's a big activity happening at street level, but otherwise a perfect upscale spot.

title: Poor arrival experience
text:
It’s a nightmare for cabs to pull up outside due to the building works so be warned you have to jump out and run. 

There was no one on the door when I arrived so quite tricky to navigate the heavy door with luggage and then try and work out that the unmanned counter is not in fact reception. You find a lift around the corner, not obvious and then work out where the front desk is. 

Once you find it, it’s not a pleasant experience! The man who checked me in had a serious attitude problem. 

Rooms are small, I couldn’t even open my case fully and it’s crammed with pointless furniture that you won’t use like an uncomfortable armchair. The side table was sticky where red wine had been spilt and the curtain had an obvious stain. 

Also, rooms are not so quiet, the alcove for the TV means you can hear the television in the next room. 

Aside from quite a few negatives. The night team and room service were all superb. It’s a comfy bed and the bathroom products are lovely. 

Would I come back. Not so sure it’s worth the hefty price tag for midtown.

title: Very cool!
text:
L’ingresso all’angolo della 7th avenue  confinante con Times Square, non promette granché , ma basta il tempo di arrivare al 10’ piano, trovare la reception ed il concierge e cambiare subito idea! 
Arredo di tendenza, accoglienza top e sistemazione in camera ottimale con vista super sulla piazza. Molto gratificante !
Le camere , in stile tipico newyorkese non sono spaziosissime così come i bagni, ma basta scendere al piano 9 della colazione per restare incantati. Ambiente e cibo curatissimo, dove è’ possibile gustare una slendida lobster soft scramble e una colazione americana a tutto tondo.
Molto affollati il bar e gli spazi comuni fino a tardi, anche da avventori esterni.
Ottimo!

title: Parfait !
text:
Nous avons séjourné en couple durant 4 nuits dans cet hôtel à deux pas de Time square. L’hôtel est neuf, le personnel parfait avec beaucoup de petites attentions. Nous avons trouvé cet hôtel au design parfait. Une terrasse qui donne directement sur Time square façon rooftop. Comme tous les hôtels américains on vous facture 35 dollars par nuit obligatoirement qui vous serviront pour prendre une collation le soir en rentrant de l’hôtel. A noter la possibilité de se rendre dans une salle de sport (inclus) que nous n’avons pas testé. 
L’emplacement est bruyant mais en plein Time square. L’hôtel étant en travaux nous avions une chambre avec vue partiel sur Time square (pas mal quand même). 
La chambre est hyper bien équipée (défroisseur, sèche cheveux, peignoir, chaussons d’une qualité... c’est tellement bon de s’y glisser après une bonne douche et une bonne journée de marche !...). Bien que un peu petite franchement pour deux c’est suffisant. La qualité du matelas.. un régal.. niveau High tech c’est parfait.. Le service de chambre est fait chaque jour avec de petites attentions.. nous n’avions pas d’adaptateur pour prise américaine.. apporté dans les 10 mins sur un plateau..! Et que dire de ce parfum diffusé dans tout l’hôtel.. juste parfait ! 
Le seul défaut de sa qualité est son emplacement : Time square étant très bruyant avec beaucoup de monde..’c’est parfois difficile de rejoindre l’hôtel !

title: Awful for business - tries to be too cool, super small rooms and work area, everything impractical
text:
This is the second Edition hotel I stayed in (the first one is London Edition). I don’t understand the hype on these “cool hotels” - it just tries way too hard to be cool. Yes, the lobby area for hangout is pretty cool and hip for hang outs, but the rooms are simply awful. You get the signature barren walls, room and bathroom. The work “desk” is a pitiful crack slotted underneath the TV. Totally impractical. The bathroom is tiny. The noise from the street is audible. The room is extraordinarily small - I would say it would be hard to find anything smaller in any 5 star hotel anywhere in the world. And I am a Titanium Elite too...

In fact it’s so awful that I wanted to move out the moment I walked into the room. The room makes me feel like I am in a psychiatric hospital. It’s smallness and barrenness plus it’s signature fur laying on the bed just makes me feel like I am inside a prison.

I have stayed in many NY hotels especially Marriott properties. I would rather live in a motel than here. Unless you want to just hang out in it’s cool sky lobby during your whole stay.

title: Incredible experience !
text:
We came for couple days with my family and we had a great time here in NY, the hotel is beautiful and the staff is incredibly friendly and helpful, specially Dee and Gilbert ❤️Thank you so much for your attention and service and for the love show to our little daughter! Definitely recommend it for families and we will be back ! 
With Love from Colombia 🇨🇴

title: Wonderful weekend stay
text:
The hotel is hip, beautiful and very clean. Central location in Times Square so convenient to everything. Two highlights of our trip were the service and the food.

First, service all around here was just above and beyond. Everyone went out of there way to make us feel comfortable and welcome. Some of the best service we have had a Marriott.

2nd the food!! I normally avoid hotel food but this was exceptional. We enjoyed room service one evening and it was so good we decided to have breakfast the next. Wish we had more meals here. Clearly a talented chef is developing the food offerings. 

Rooms are small, same as most in Times Square but stylish, comfortable and clean. Added bonus, our window popped open allowing us to enjoy the fluke cool crisp evening weather.

Would not hesitate to come here again!

title: A Spectacular Father's Day Weekend  - Best Ever
text: From the moment we arrived we were completely WOW'd!  We entered our room and it took our breath away.  The view, the comfy bed, the bathtub. Everyone was friendly & professional. The food - to die for!

title: Luxurious Service  with incredible food.
text: This hotel made a weekend a mini-vacation. Definitely the place to stay in Midtown, especially if you are heading to a Broadway Show. Amazing view  of Times Square from the room, and the food is superlative . Reserve a balcony corner room to feel the full effect of the city. The food and wine pairings at 701 West were wonderful, and the service was truly first class.

title: Fabulous Hotel in New York
text: I am glad to have chosen this hotel for this time in New York. Service was exceptional since we reach the entrance door, all the staff was very kind and service oriented, my room was not ready because I arrived earlier so I was invited to the Bar for a drink until the room was ready..... soooo nice..!! room was very spacious and with a very nice view from Times Square.!! I would definitely recommend this nice place to everyone!

title: Fabulous new hotel in NYC!
text: Absolutely loved this amazing hotel-like Miami met LA in Times Square! Great vibe, signature scent wafting through the vents, light and bright rooms, rooftop terrace bars, friendly staff. Only complaint was could not get our room cleaned til 7 pm after calling 3 times.  Hopefully they work on that as it was the only negative. Step outside to Times Square and Broadway!

title: 最先端のラグジュアリー
text: 最初は新しさと立地で選びました。エントランスから館内全てインテリアが完璧です。ジムに至っては、旅の間も欠かさず通うほど、眺望と施設が整っています。部屋は言うまでもなく、素敵な空間。自宅よりもぐっすり眠れるベットマットにリネン類。コンパクトな作りが使いやすく、必要十分な物が揃っている。バスタブは無いが（スイート以外）慣れるとレインシャワーでも快適。特筆すべきは、スタッフの質の高さ。どのパートを受け持つ人たちも、明るく、仕事に誠実であり、安心して過ごせる。これは、クリーンスタッフに至っても同じこと。素晴らしい。その中でも特にコンシェルジュは、完成度が高く、これまで泊まった世界中の最高ランクのホテルに比べてもひけを取らない。レストランも必ず行ってほしい。宿泊者も外部の方も。場所が便利な上に、メニューもよく考えられていて、量の少ないパスタなど、一人旅の女性には特に有難い。全てにおいて、お客様目線で徹底的に考え抜かれたホテル。

title: Very nice!
text:
The only down side to this is the location, it’s great for Times Square, but Times Square isn’t really that great! 

Service, restaurants and interiors are spot on though! 

Would definitely choose a different place next time but glad we got to experience this

title: Excellent!!
text: Absolutely one of the better Marriotts. Service was exceptional, from the time we arrived to the minute we left. All the staff was exceptional. A total 180 for the experience at the Liberty hotel in Boston. I would definitely recommend this hotel to everyone!

title: In the Midst of the Activity
text: The Times Square Edition is an elegant place to relax.  Right there in the middle of the activity you can step onto the deck watch from above. Have a breakfast at the Terrace and Outdoor Gardens for a delicious meal.

title: Luxury price for mediocre service
text:
A brand new, hipster Hotel of the Marriott family that opened in March: definitely too expensive for what it offers and best for solo or a young couple for a very short stay.
It has positive: location is relatively not noisy for being on the side of Times Square ; the rooms are bright /extra clean/modern/ with a great view; breakfast served in a cute conservatory restaurant; there is a roof top terrace; the staff is very nice.
But plenty Negative: the rooms are way too small and offer zero storage, don’t bring any bag bigger than a carry on! The minibar is actually micro with space only for ridiculously expensive items; the nespresso machine is tucked in the back of  a closet so hard to fill it with water; there is no tea option; housekeeping never refills coffee pods/coffe cups so need to call in room service with related tipping; the face basin area is so small that can’t hold any towel, so you need to throw them on the floor after each use; there are Qtips, but no tissues; there is one elevator to lobby located on the 10th floor and the restaurant, but a different elevator to the rooms: so be prepared to double long waits in the morning to reach the exit. 
All together the price is too high for the service.

title: Amazing!!!!!
text: We had an amazing weekend at the Times Square Edition! Suki the Guest Experience Director made our trip unforgettable. The hotel is beautiful and the location was perfect for doing everything we wanted to while visiting NY. The second you walk in you’re greeted by friendly helpful staff and an amazing smell. Be sure to check out the terrace bar and the paradise club for drinks! We will DEFINITELY be back!

title: Super-Cool Edition Hotel hits Times Square
text: Even I felt cool in this modern, urbane, chi chi hotel. A newly-minted Edition property, this Time Square property possessed all the characteristics that make Edition hotels great. The architecture - perfect. The lobby, super-cool complete with succulent wall, cocktail lounge, and outside terrace.  Inside, for cold days, the perfect fireplace lounge invites one to sit down and sip cognac, which is exactly what we did one cold day in April. The rooms, while small, offer all amenities in a thoughtfully- and intelligently-designed layout.  No space wasted, the queen room I occupied offered quite a few tips and tricks for New Yorkers to espouse in their apartments.  The mini-bar, espresso maker, snack station combined intelligent placement with tasty and space-efficient choices. The closet, rather than containing a cumbersome ironing board and iron held a hand steamer instead.  A full-wall desk also doubled as vanity and table.  We did not eat there, but did enjoy the cocktail fireside lounge, and I am sure the food must be good.  We had great service, and I recognized the doorman from the mid-town Ritz property, taking on a new challenge in the excitement of Times Square.  Loved this property, and will definitely return on my next trip to NYC.

title: A new favorite
text: Had a wonderful two day stay.  Super location for our needs.  Room was small but comfortable.  Staff was exceptional, very friendly.  Drinks and food were good, waitstaff is still learning.  Overall, I would definitely recommend and will return.

title: Perfect for Business and Change of Scenery
text: I was hesitant about staying at this hotel based on the reviews. However, if you can, go head and visit. Yes the rooms are small, the edge of the bedframe can bump you, however the bed is so comfortable it makes up for it. There is a bit of space in the hallway for luggage. The bathroom and open sink area was not an issue and the shower was fabulous.....I don't see why it would be an issue with couples. The restaurants and bars were all great, albeit a bit pricey, but totally worth it. Service was great in all areas, and I would definitely stay there again!

title: UTTERLY DISAPPOINTED, STAY AWAY
text:
I stayed at this hotel for 10 days during May when I was in New York for business. Upon checking in, (I originally booked the best of their King Room), I was absolutely shocked how TINY the room was, the bell boy was very nice offered where to leave the luggage... my response was “Where can you possibly leave your suitcases?” (I have 2 Rimowa, and there is literally NO space to even open them!) In USA, everything was in square feet, and I had no idea... its just a 20sqm room with bathroom all built in... you cannot literally do anything in that room, I couldn’t breathe. I then requested a upgrade (which I paid additional) at US$1200 per night plus taxes and destination fees, upgraded to the suite, which was really just an oversized King Room by hotels in Asia standard... there is nothing special to it, but the place is so noisy, it is so loud that you hear everything, traffic, fire trucks and loud noises all day long and all night long (till about 3am)... they only give you one small bottle of water complimentary and you have to buy all the bottled waters at $8 each. The hotel manager charged my card with the pre-auth amount, subsequently they took a further $12000 out of my card on 6 separate authorisations, (total almost $30k they locked away), this was done without my authorisation, and without any notice to me... the bank blocked the card as they considered it was a suspicious transaction... I tried to speak to the hotel manager, many calls over 4 days, they did not call back, nor reply, NOT EVEN ONCE!  My door was left open after daily clean TWICE during my stay with my valuables still inside... luckily i didnt lose anything (that i m aware of)... I asked for a late check out... they were kind enough to offer me just HALF HOUR while my hotel bill was AUD$19,000! Upon check out, I asked the manager about all the problems, he did not seem to understand, didnt seem to care, and clearly didnt know what service meant.. there was no apology... but just arrogance. UTTERLY DISAPPOINTED WITH THIS HOTEL. 

So if you dont mind bad service, baby size rooms, and all day long noise.. then go for it... 

I cannot believe a hotel could get away with the size of room like that and still call themselves 5 star! Such disgrace!

title: A sanctuary amidst the hustle of Times Square
text: I travel to New York City frequently and often stay in downtown hotels as they are usually a better match to my vibe. I rarely find my way to Times Square but on this trip, I needed to be there for business. I booked myself into the Edition as I have enjoyed staying at their properties in Miami, London, Barcelona, and Bodrum. This newest location lived up to the already very high standard set by its sister hotels. Times Square can often feel like a frenetic place, but this hotel is a sanctuary in the sky. My room was perfectly quiet with a picturesque view of the hustle and bustle down below. The bed was perfect, like sleeping on a cloud! The service was absolutely on point at every turn. The hotels common spaces bar restaurant nightclub and lounge served as perfect places to take meetings and entertain friends. The subway is located within one block and you can catch a train to nearly any place in the 5 Boros without making a transfer. This was SUPER convenient and I found myself zipping through the city at lightspeed! I highly recommend the Edition Times Square for anyone planning a trip to New York City.

title: A Memorable Experience
text: Our time at The Times Square Edition Hotel was truly memorable. The decor is exquisite, our suite incredible beautiful. High attention to every detail, exceptional staff and an ambiance worth remembering. Outstanding food, amazing views, excellent amenities... This is was not a hotel stay, but a truly memorable experience.

title: one word: HOME
text:
to sum up my stay... i felt at home. it is truly an amazing hotel in the heart of NYC. from the moment you walk through the doors of the times square EDITION, it is the people that work here that make this place extra special. they remember your name and welcome you always with a smile. 

from check-in, housekeeping, in-room dinning, turndown service, the restaurants and bars, this truly is a destination in itself. 

this new hotel from the ground up is beautiful. the rooms are modern, sleek and sexy. the mood lighting is really fun. so many USB outlets to plug in your gear. super fast wifi. the rain show is powerful. i love the EDITION bath amenities, le labo. they even brought me a few items i forgot to pack. 

in NYC it is hard to find a hotel gym that has everything you need. this gym is one of the best ones i have seen in a hotel. it’s open, full of all the top of the line equipment and has the best view of times square. 

but in the end it is the people that work here that make a stay extra special. huge shout out to the ENTIRE team at the times square EDITION! i look forward to returning very soon. my home away from home in NYC.

title: Dr.
text:
A new hotel tiny rooms , small closet, not enough space for me solo, can't imagine how a couple would manage, paid 750$ per night for an upgraded room with a view. Got a tiny room with almost no view, one have to twist the neck at the corner of the window to see a piece of Manhattan.  
The room is clean and modern, however the washing faucet is in the room behind the screen,  Very uncomfortably for a couple. Overall Not a good choice for the money .

title: A++ New York Hotel!
text: My sons and I recently stayed at Times Square the EDITION. Fantastic service, beautiful clean modern rooms and perfect location! I had communicated with the hotel manager since we were celebrating a 50th birthday and a high school graduation. We were pleasantly surprised when we entered the room to find a graduation gift, a birthday gift, champagne and pastries! I have stayed in many New York hotels, and I can honestly say that I have never received such special treatment. This is a new hotel-and they’ve got it right! Stay here!

title: Amazing Staff
text: I am not usually a fan of staying by Times Square but I really liked the Edition. The staff is what made all the difference. They were amazing and even have me rethinking my next trip where I’m supposed to stay at another hotel. The rooms were small but nice and the outdoor garden bar area was really nice. Again the staff was fabulous. I highly recommend!!

title: Upscale and surprisingly quiet (for NY)
text:
Sleek design just off Times Square.  Rooms are “intimate” (small), but comfortable.  And really quiet (no hallway noise, no street noise). 

Small, but functional bathroom area, which is NOT walled off from the bed area, but does have an excellent two headed shower.  Great bed and tons of outlets everywhere.  The hotel bar is a big draw.

title: Very Beautiful Hotel, Good Service, But Rooms are disappointing
text:
I understand that prices in NYC are high and that rooms are getting tinier and tinier but, in a hotel of this kind, I find disappointing that rooms are structured in an open space way where lavatory is in the room and toilet and shower are just "boxes". I may be a bit old school but I like proper separated bathrooms.

For the rest, staff is very well trained, atmosphere is cool, resort fee was quite convenient and the lobby/bars/restaurants great.

In the end, average, due mainly to the room (and it was a superior with Times Square View).

title: Stay away
text: Tiny cramped room in which the average bed is so dominant in the remaining space, that I have bruises on my ankles and legs from constantly banging into the bed. Zero storage means that your luggage and effects cannot be stowed, making the living space smaller still. There are hundreds of hotels in midtown. The Knickbocker, the Bryant Park, the Langham. All have cool bars and restaurants too but better, bigger rooms and without the inconvenience of the two lift journey from the street to your room. Avoid this hotel. It adds nothing but bruises.

title: Great Times Sq Hotel  - oxymoron :)
text: Normally never want to stay in this neighborhood b/c of the Times Sq tourist trap factor. Once I entered the hotel I never knew I was in Times Sq until I was out on one of their many bar / restaurant balconies. The main restaurant and bar on the 11th floor, 701West, was fantastic and not expensive by NYC standards (but their wines by the glass were no bargain). Once again, couldn't believe I was having such an experience in Times Sq.

title: LOVED IT!
text:
We recently spend the weekend at the Times Edition for our anniversary month. I had 4 rooms booked. We got there around 10 am. Amy, at the front desk told us check in is at 4pm however they do have one room ready. Why dont you check into the room, freshen up and visit the city and we will try and have your rooms ready when you get back.

When we got back after lunch around 1230pm she had all our rooms ready and had 1 room upgraded to a corner suite. 

Ana, their guest experience manager had sent us a hand written card along with a bottle of wine and some snacks. 

The bar on the 9h floor is happening. The service is awesome and they have a wide selection of liquor. 

The location can't be beat if you are visiting the city. It is literally at TIMES SQUARE and is walking distance from 5th ave if you want to do some high end shopping.

They went beyond our expectations. I have stayed at the Ritz, Peninsula and St. Regis in the city. I would put these guys up against anyone of them.

Not to mention it is a brand new hotel. The other hotels are pretty dated. We would only stay at this hotel when we do return to NY.

Thank you guys for a perfect weekend.

Viraj

title: Beautiful view
text: Most everything was lovely about this hotel except the rooms are tiny and there is no breakfast for those with the highest status at Marriott.  Also, the edge of the bed is square and it is easy to bump your ankle in the tiny room.  Location is perfect and staff is super nice.

title: Nice and cozy...
text:
Positives:

(1) Great staff all around from the doormen to front desk to housekeeping.
(2) Comfy bed, clean sheets, clean interior.
(3) Bathroom mirror lights up which is great for make-up. 
(4) TV is nice - good programming (free HBO Go) and you can pull it out and adjust it.
(5) Fast internet. 

Negatives:
(1) Very small. I was in a room with a king-sized bed on the 35th floor. I think hotel rooms in Seoul and Japan are bigger than the room I had. 
(2) Thin walls. I was able to hear my neighbor's "pleasant" shrill voice until about 1:00 a.m. Her voice was so "pleasant" that I just had to stay up and listen to it despite the fact that I had to wake up at 7:00 a.m.

title: Amazing hotel experience
text:
I stayed for 4 nights at Times Square edition hotel.
The whole experience was just wonderful. The location is just superb if you want to be in the middle of all Times Square/broadway action but enjoying an oasis right in the middle. From the courteous and helpful team at the door, always offering help and providing umbrellas when raining. Very attentive group, always w a warm welcome. Checking in was very fast and were able to upgrade to Times Square suite. Nice room, good sound and light insulation (being in Times Square very important )- top quality bedding and towels. Bars were top of the line. Great signature cocktails at the bar on the 10th floor and premium service by the staff. Went several times there- appetizers were amazing taste experience - go if you want to taste something special - not if you are hungry because it’s delicate and well balanced portions. Also bars have a very good ambience which is very entertaining. We did not have the chance to experience restaurants except for breakfast which was very good. Also the hotel has a night club which has a fun dance floor where you find an interesting crowd and occasional performances/shows which was definitely entertaining. You can sense everybody is paying special attention to customers and their needs. Definitely a 5 star experience - hope to be there soon!

title: Brilliantly conceived hotel
text: The Edition designed by Ian Schrager uses a minimum of space to create beauty, comfort, cleanliness and luxury.  Even with Times Square below, stay in the room was tranquil. Decor in a monotone clay color is pleasing to the eye, bedding comfortable and Le Labo toiletries wonderful. Staff at the counter is accommodating and Aaron at the front door could not be more helpful. Wonderful stay.

title: Faux luxury
text: The design of this hotel is absolutely stunning. However unless you are in a suite the rooms are extremely tiny. In the suites while they are unbelievably visually pleasing, they were not remotely planned properly. There is hardly any storage space and you will have to live out of your suitcases. There is exactly one small drawer and one small cabinet. The staff is super friendly but if you have a problem no one knows what to do. This property is newly opened and hopefully they will fix that issue. There is also A major nightclub on property and on the weekends you will have to deal with that. The crowd for the night club also overtakes the lobby bar so as a guest you will not be able to enjoy it. Also the new structure is not properly soundproofed and you should expect to be woken up with noise at approximately 6 AM. If you truly want a luxury experience and expect one this is not the hotel for you. I agree with the other negative reviews I recently read.

title: Hate it, hate it and hate it
text: The room is so small and barren, it reminds me of the cheap rural hotels in Europe that you have to use because there is nothing better.  I don’t even know where to put my carry-on bag!If you are Marriott Elite, it means absolutely nothing.  I was so excited to check the Edition brand, but it’s going to be once and done.

title: Friendly & Efficient Staff
text:
The staff made one feel welcome especially the door staff.
The food in the 9th floor restaurant was excellent as well as the greenhouse atmosphere.
The guestrooms are  bright and spotless.
A huge drawback is the frosted glass compartment that the toilet was located in. Because of this we would not stay here again but will come back to dine.
The only other negative was  stainless steel instead of silverplate in the restaurants. Unfortunately many hotels are taking this shortcut thinking that they can get away with it. Stainless steel belongs in hospitals and not in luxury hotels.

title: A getaway in Times Square
text: What an amazing gem right in the heart of Times Square.  It's a great location and the staff is very friendly.  The only downside was we had a Times Square view and it was a bit loud in the evenings, but I guess that's to be expected.  Would stay at this property again, but with a city view instead.

title: An Oasis in Times Square
text:
It has been quite some since I visited NYC and this is the first time I had the opportunity to take my family of 4 (with two teenagers).  My family and I could not have been more pleased with our stay at the The Times Square EDITION.  Every member of the hotel staff was accommodating, welcoming and friendly.  From the doormen, to the greeters in the lobby, to the front desk to the concierge's desk.
The hotel is in immaculate condition and I can only wish to be able to stay in a hotel so new on all of my business trips.  We were celebrating my wife's 50th birthday and the staff at The Times Square EDITION went out of their way to make her birthday special.  I was a little nervous about staying on Times Square during a busy week over spring break, but we felt like the The Times Square EDITION was an oasis within the craziness that is Times Square.  We only dined once for breakfast during our stay as we had already pre-arranged our dinners (via the concierge) prior to our stay.  The breakfast was excellent albeit somewhat pricey.  We were lucky enough to catch 3 Broadway shows during our visit to New York and all of these shows (Hamilton, Dear Evan Hansen and Wicked) were all within easy walking distance of the hotel.  Many thanks to the hotel staff of The Times Square EDITION.  We'll be back for more Broadway shows!

title: Was here for the opening
text: Great hotel, a bit noisy in Time Square and the black out blinds don't block out all the intense light from Time Square.  Clean rooms, great bathrobes and really friendly staff.  The gem is the Lobby Bar - probably some of the best drinks in the city and great decor.  Gym has a balcony and great views.  Cool touches and things to explore and post for social.  Worth to check out.

title: Who’s reviewing Ian Schrager, you must be kidding!,
text: What a poor example of anything Ritz Carlton...A sham to the brand... 3 miles south in Madison Park you will be thrilled... Better yet go to 59th and 6th and be pampered... as a platinum card holder who was curious and had business in the area , I gave it a try... never again..... All staff were pleasant , yet the property is inferior and I doubt it will survive under the brand. Stay home or elsewhere.

title: One of the MOST Incredible of Ian Schrager's Properties
text:
Not sure if you many of you are aware, but Ian Schrager is one of the former partners who owned Studio 54. I have to say that not only is this hotel one of the most elegant and comfortable stays, but all of the food service is incredible. I had one of the most amazing meals in a long time at Paradise Club which is on the 7th Floor of the property. The cabaret show at Paradise Club is a true experience for the senses and the dance party that the space turns into following the completion of the show is one of the most fun dance parties I've been to in NY during my entire NYC existance. 
I used to avoid Times Square, but this property is definitely bringing the cool back to this part of the city.

title: BEST Food, Views and Bathtub!!!
text:
Our suite was on Times Square.  It was spacious and perfectly designed.  We had our own balcony, which made our morning coffee time a sheer delight.  
The bathtub was one of the best ever!!!  
The amenities ($50 credit for dry cleaning and food credits) were very appreciated. 
Staff was professional and so very helpful!!!
The restaurants were perfection!!!
We can’t wait to return to The Times Square EDITION!!!

title: the good, the bad & the ugly
text:
Let's start with the good- excellent service in the hotel.  Clearly, they have all been very well trained.  
the Bad- woefully small rooms and even less storage. no drawers or chests- just counters and cubbies (yes, like they have in nursery schools). 
the Ugly- the toilet is surrounded by a glass enclosure that exacerbates the tiniest noise to uncomfortable levels (talk about a romance killer).
So, if you are traveling alone and want to stay in Times Square, probably a decent choice if you can find a reasonable rate.  However, this is not a quality destination (no matter how snooty the help in the restaurants are or how expensive the restaurants are.

title: Luxury Experience Overlooking Times Square
text: I recently had the pleasure of staying at The Times Square Edition and it was an overall awesome stay. From the moment I pulled my car up Aaron made my check in and valet experience worry free, The hotel reception was prompt and professional and both Amy and Rilely were friendly and enabled me to get to my business meeting with time to spare.Every aspect of the hotel was top notch.Over my weekend I utilized most aspects of the hotel from the well appointed fitness center with a magnificent view of Times Square to the profession bartenders serving very original crafted cocktails. The  room service was the best I've had with thoughtful and well paired selections,wonderful pastries and excellent sevice from both Donovan and Fan whose pesentations and descriptions made it a truely superb experience.Just footsteps from the non stop action of Times Square the Edition is a welcomed sophisticated respite.

title: Nice hotel but poor service and huge extra fees
text:
Can’t beat the location right in Times Square. Has a few decks with great views of it. Very comfortable room with lots of nice amenities like robes, slippers, free water, free shoe shine, etc. Most of the rooms are small, but don’t really feel that way. The rooms have open bathrooms which means the shower, sink and toilet all open out to the room. A bit awkward if you like privacy while showering and using the toilet. There is a curtain you can pull that blocks the bed from the bathroom and door. Still a bit strange. The rainforest shower was great and most of the staff we meet were nice with some exceptions. The fitness room was good but they advertise a great outside stretching deck that was closed every time I went. Very disappointing. 

#1 reason for the terrible rating is the Destination Fee and poor service at the end of the trip. The hotel charges you $35 plus $5.17 in taxes per night for Destination Fees. Something Marriott Int likes to do now at it’s full service NYC hotels to make more money off you. The credits you get for food, laundry and a few other things (see picture of the card they give you) expire at midnight each day, not the next morning at checkout. So if you arrive late that first day (10:30pm for us) the $35 just goes into their pocket. The SoulCycle class is not near the hotel and only for 1 person so not very useful. I used the $50 in laundry credit on one of the days since it was offered. Worked fine except they never replaced the rooms laundry bag or order sheet. Seems the didn’t want me to take advantage of that again. NYC has so many great restaurants that we enjoy, forcing us to eat at the hotel each day was disappointing and also impossible to have one good meal for $35. If they let you accumulate the credit so you can just eat one meal there would be ideal. The food options are not great. Ate at the lobby bar and the waitstaff seemed annoyed to help you. Wanted to remove an item from one of the sandwiches and was told we couldn’t cause everything is “pre-made and just heated up”. Tasted like that too. On our last night we tried to eat at the main restaurant but found out the entire place was closed for a private event with no notice, really screwing up our night. You talk to the managers and they just don’t seem to care.  The Destination Fees are just a money grab and a major pain for the guests. 

I will do my best to never stay at a Marriott Int hotel that charges these insane fees again. Shame on Edition and Marriott Int for treating your guests so poorly.  Make these “added values” optional if they are so great. Or easier to use, they end up leaving you with a bitter taste about the hotel and company.

title: Modern, clean, good location in Times Square
text: Rooms are small, but nice layout. Location at 7th & 47th is good for Times Square. Noise level from the street is mild. Lobby and bar/restaurant area are vibrant and fun. Bed and bathroom amenities are comfortable - nice to have a steamer for clothes :)  This is a good option if you are looking for a hotel in this area. Recommend.

title: Anniv. Celebration
text: Had a phenomenal stay at the Element. We travel extensively throughout the world, this hotel ranks as one of my favorite city hotels! The staff were amazing, especially Suki Scott who went out of her way to make our stay special. Actually all the staff were extremely helpful & friendly. The hotel has a cool vibe to it, everything was 1st class & tasteful. We loved our stay & will be back! Highly recommend this hotel!!!

title: Edition Rocks!!
text: This hotel was so beautiful and well designed. Room was spacious the way it was designed especially in the middle of times square. But most importantly the service was spot on from check in to departure. Everyone looked so polished and went out of their ways to help us and or to say hello. Such a great way to enjoy a vacation. Edition rocks!!

title: Destination Amenity Fee
text: When we saw this New hotel and booked it, we were so excited. But the experience was not that good. First, it's the Destination Amenity Fee. It's like force you to consume. When we were inside the room, we can hear people close their door from the corridor and the constant sirens from police and ambulance. When we turned off the lights, we can still see the outside lights through the  curtain. We had to leave the lights on. And the room is too small. When we turn on the heat, it's just too dry in the room. Even filled 4 glasses of water around the room, didn't  help. When I touched my husband, we even shocked from static due to the dry air. And it's not just once, was scared for a while to even touched each other.

title: AMAZING WEEKEND @ the EDITION
text:
We arrived in Times Square around 3pm, the surrounding area is loud and busy, as soon as you walk into the Edition you transition into another space. The music and ambiance of the hotel are very inviting and chic. Everyone was very welcoming and inviting when we arrived. We were escorted to our room which was modern and sleek. We loved it. We then had a light snack in the Terrace, which was absolutely beautiful. The greenery was spectacular, the food was very good too. We had dinner at 701W. The experience from when we walked in was impeccable. The hostess brought us to the bar area, which was relaxing and beautiful. Our server was extremely helpful with choosing a cocktail. We then were escorted to the dining room, everything was perfect. The attention to detail was amazing. The stemware is beautiful. They are very aware of food allergies and dietary restrictions. The food was delicious!!!! The pairing with champagne and wine was delightful.
After dinner, we went to the Paradise Club for a show, this is something that should not be missed. Following that, we had cocktails in the lobby bar which was a whole different experience. We enjoyed breakfast the following morning in the Terrace. The hotel has so much to offer, we will be back!!!
Thank you for an amazing weekend!!

title: A nightclub (that happens to have a hotel attached)
text: I've stayed before at the Edition in NoMad (and reviewed it very favorably). I liked the vibe, the commitment to the guest experience, and the high-end, modern fit and finish. The Times Square Edition is a different story. Perhaps this should be expected, but the vibe at the Times Square Edition is not serene and chill as was the case in NoMad. This Edition is aiming to be a nightclub, and it seems to achieve its goal. The elevator situation is a mess--at one point, of the three elevators to the lobby from the ground floor, two were roped off--yes, actually roped off--and reserved for guests headed to the nightclub below the lobby. This left me--a guest of the hotel--waiting over 5 minutes for the one elevator that was, at least allegedly, reserved for people headed the lobby (when I got in, the elevator stopped at the nightclub and picked up a load of drunk 20-somethings headed for the lobby, so I guess the elevator wasn't really reserved as I was told). The elevator situation wasn't an isolated incident. Everyone working at the hotel seemed more interested in the fact that is an entertainment venue than a hotel. We don't stay in Times Square often, and this stay reminded us why, but we were really disappointed by our stay.

title: Modern Trendy Bar
text: The Times Square edition has a pretty trendy bar. Very modern space and decor. Met some of my fiancé’s work colleagues for a celebratory drinks. We had a nice alcove space. Though they had to move the group due to mix up in reservations. They treated the group to a round and moved the group upstairs.

title: Great hotel but too bright
text: I’m writing this from my room at 1230 at night. On the 16th floor it feels like 1230 in the afternoon. Gorgeous hotel very modern (maybe too modern) but the black out curtains in the room are terrible and there is so much light pollution from Times Square it’s impossible to sleep. I had a 7 night stay booked here for next week and cancelled bc the light is that bad. I haven’t stayed in Times Square before so this might by par for the course but I expect a 5 star hotel to have sufficient shades to block out the light.

title: OMG, First stay at an Edition but not my last...
text: There are no complaints here. The location is right in Times Square but is pretty well isolate from the high energy environment some 30 floors below. Staff is incredible.
