Really spent the time to make sure the stay was excellent. Every is pleasant vs. my stay 2 weeks prior at another hotel, the staff was hit or miss on the happiness scale. No issues here, everyone had a smile. Room was good size for the location. Very clean. Internet was good. Mini-bar was present. Bath was super clean. TIP: The shower has a preset that prevents it from getting too hot. Just push the little button on the side of the temperature control to give yourself a little extra heat if you need it from all the walking you did during your stay. Food was great and quick. Entry is on 47th despite the large Edition fake entrance on the corner. Lots of subway stops within a few blocks walk. Taxis available as well. Will be back for sure. Must now check out the other Editions. Great stay.

title: Super
text:
Hôtel tout neuf ayant ouvert il y a seulement deux semaines. À l’arrivée on s’est occupé de nos manteaux et nos bagages qui sont arrivés directement dans le placard notre chambre pendant qu’il nous était gentiment offert un cocktail au bar. Les petits déjeuners sont excellents. Le personnel est attentif et sympathique. Nous avions pris une chambre avec vue sur la ville. Assez silencieuse pour l’endroit où l’hôtel est situé.
Merci

title: Amazing Service
text:
A group of girlfriends and I stayed two nights and we had such a great experience. You literally turn a corner and have a worker there asking “do you need anything,” “where are you looking to go,” “would you like water,” etc. I was amazed when two days in a worker who I met the first day remembered my name!

They really are going above and beyond. Great hotel!

title: Excellent Service
text: Beautiful hotel with impeccable service!! Everyone was extremely friendly and helpful. The doormen greeted us every day/night with friendly smiles and always offered a helping hand or in my friends' and my case pointed us in the right direction! I'd definitely stay there again!! Great location in the heart of Time Square.

title: Excellent Service
text: This was the best hotel experience I have had in quite some time. The property was beautiful.  The staff was amazing and extremely attentive. They paid great attention to detail and made sure that everyone in my party was happy and attended to at all times. Truly over the top service! I'll definitely be back!

title: Elegance and service above and beyond
text:
As a new addition to Times Square, this unknown and hidden gem should quickly rise to top of the hotel ranking list on Trip Advisor.  Having just opened two weeks ago, there was little information available on-line when I made reservations months ago.   People may also might be confused when booking that there are two locations now:  Times Square and the Flat Iron district.
This “new edition” to the luxe line of Edition Hotels is an absolute gem.  Elegant and refined, it is a wonderful departure from the hustle and bustle which await outside it’s doors.  With it’s clean lines and minimalist design it is the quintessential urban oasis.  The convenience of its location to Times Square literally outside of it’s doors is another plus.
Any concerns I had about bringing my twinagers to this property were quickly dispelled by the friendly staff.  Everyone, from the doorman, to the front desk, concierge have been so friendly, accommodating, and helpful.  I was impressed that they would remember our names and would also greet us when coming and going. 
This is quite easily one of my best hotel experiences having traveled near and far.

title: An urban oasis in Times Square
text: Around every corner is an insta-worthy photo op starting with the decompression area when you enter - offering beautiful spaces, quirky touches, tasty nibbles and sexy libations — kinda like a burlesque show: slowly seducing you and surprising you. It’s a little flirty, a little sexy, surprising and fun and leaving you wanting more — IN TIMES SQUARE. Actually, it’s feels more like a chance to see it up close without feeling smothered by the chaos. #timessquare #ilovenyc #newhotel #ianschrager #modernluxury

title: Gorgeous Hotel
text: We stayed here the weekend before the official opening and it was so wonderful.  This hotel is  beautiful and is an oasis from the crazy/terrible Time Square.  The staff were all very friendly and attentive.  The room had the best lighting, the best bed/sheets/pillows and the robe... omg.  Make sure you use the hotel robes, it was one of the best things I've ever put on my body.  Also, the towels, the best hotel towels I've ever experienced.  The steamer I ended up purchasing online after our stay because it was that great.  The herringbone floors I was swooning over.  I'm so very appreciative that my boyfriend surprised me with this hotel and showed me the New York I've been missing out on.  The only negatives I can think of were the echo chamber toilet room but, that's a minor detail, and the shower was a little small (for 2 people).

title: Beautiful Hotel
text:
Stepping inside this hotel you immediately forget that you have just escaped from the nightmare that is Times Square. Taking the elevator up to the lobby almost makes you forget that you're in a city, reminiscent more of a beach resort at an exotic destination than being in central Manhattan. 

The lobby and the hotel itself are absolutely stunning, and the staff are beyond friendly and eager to assist (going so far as to even walk you to the elevator and hit the button for your floor for you). 

Agree that the rooms are a bit on the smaller side, but that's to be expected for this part of town. The light color palette definitely helps make the space feel less claustrophobic, and the herringbone floors look incredible. 

The only fault I really could find is that the walls between rooms seem to be pretty thin and/or poorly insulated. I could hear the TV in the room next to mine crystal clear while they had CNN on, and I think they had their TV set at a pretty reasonable volume. I noticed noise issues the next morning too, as someone was opening/shutting closet doors and setting things on the desk space in the adjacent room and it sounded like the noises were being made in my room.

title: Best Hotel Ever!!!!
text:
This is by far one of the best hotels I’ve ever stayed at. From the moment you walk into the lobby you are greeted by welcoming faces that escort you to the elevator, up to the lobby and to check in. The hospitality is bar none the best I’ve ever experienced at any hotel I’ve ever stayed at in the entire world. The hotel is brand new and I hope they keep this experience going as it is one of a kind and truly astonishing how you feel and how they make you feel. 

While the room was not large it was extremely efficient with great lighting and nice little touches. It’s very thought out and extremely comfortable. The full size window that goes from floor to ceiling and wall to wall were truly beautiful to look at Time Square form. 

We had brunch at the restaurant on the ninth floor and the food was extremely delicious and the service just kept coming. We then had a delicious cocktail out on the terrace and what a beautiful room, all the rooms were just beautiful.

After being out in the city for two hours we just kept saying we wanted to go back to the hotel. There is no need to leave the hotel, especially for us because we live locally it was a staycation. We came back to have another cocktail out on the terrace because we enjoyed it so much and then went to dinner at the restaurant 701 on the 11th floor. Like everything else this restaurant was amazing, beautiful, over the top service and phenomenal food.  Don’t be scared of the flat price for dinner as you get what you pay for and we thought it could have cost a lot more for the courses and the quality with the service you would’ve experienced at a Michelin star restaurant.  

After dinner we went to the hotels night club called paradise. The club was extremely fun and welcoming. The music was the best and it wasn’t so stuffy with fake people it was just a extremely fun time with really cool entertainment on stage.

We can’t say enough about this hotel and want to thank everyone who took such great care of us. From the gentleman that meet you at the door and up the elevators to the ladies working behind the bar in the club and everyone else we encountered you truly made it the best 24 hours we’ve ever experienced at a hotel and we will be back 100% and refer the heck out of it.

title: New Hotel
text: Loved my stay here! I would like to give kudos to Fernando, Jerome, and Joey, all of whom had excellent customer service. I only hope other hotels in the city take note of the Editions' exemplary customer service and hire individuals such as these men, who go the extra mile. I enjoyed my breakfast at the Terrace restaurant on the 9th floor. The restaurant is stunning, you truly feel transported from Times Square (kind of reminiscent in my mind of Miami Beach/French Riviera). I am only sorry that I was too tired at night to have cocktails on their beautiful outdoor porch. I will be back, and will make a point to utilize this space next time. Also, as others have noted this hotel smells beautiful. I would buy that scent if they sold it and spray around my house and office. So to summarize, I highly recommend this new gem in Times Square.

title: An oasis in the middle of Times Square!
text:
From the moment we arrived at The Edition, it was obvious this would be no average Marriott experience. The hotel had only been open a few days when my partner and I booked a long weekend away to explore the city. Shortly after we booked, we were contacted by a representative of the hotel to gather details to enhance our stay. We mentioned that we were celebrating our anniversary, and arrived to a chef-prepared treat and free champagne. 

The room was small but beautiful with a fabulously comfortable bed. The hotel’s bar has delicious items to gnosh on. I highly recommend breakfast. Their kouign-amann is made in house, and delightful. Take a seat in the lounge near the fire and enjoy the sexy interiors.

title: Perfect for being in the mix of Times Square
text:
First time ever in an Edition hotel but it won’t be my last! 
The service at this hotel was BEYOND! The attention to detail from the moment we walked in the door. They knew our names, made sure we were comfortable, and provided such sound recommendations for our trip. Each night when we made it back to the room, there was turndown service and a lovely note. 
Aesthetically, this hotel was beautiful. The decor was sleek and exquisite without looking fussy and overdone. 
The saying, “you get what you pay for” held true here. We relaxed with a friend in the cozy dining area and had great wine. We also spent some time just relaxing by the fire. 
We will be back to the hotel because it became such a wonderful part of the trip to NY. They knew it was my birthday celebration and first trip to the city and they left a nice note and dessert in the room during turndown service. 
Oh- and the towels. They were like plush clouds. The bed was comfortable and the view of Times Square at night was amazing. We could see the performers on times Squaree from the window. 
We were in town to see Hamilton and it’s a quick easy walk from the hotel. Plus there were so many places to eat and grab coffee near by. Also, close to multiple lines on the Subway

title: New hotel with Times Square view
text:
Brand new (opened March 2019), contemporary design, clean room, friendly staff.  We had room type "Premier Times Square View" (Room 3505), photos of view attached.

Hard to maneuver in bathroom area with 2 people (doors for shower and toilet area opened into sink area).

Note: Hotel entrance is on West 47th St. *not* on 7th Ave (though official address is 701 7th Ave).  We started setting our Uber location to the hotel next door: Night Times Square (157 West 47th Street).

title: Absolutely First Class
text: This place is AWESOME! The EDITION hotel (Marriott) is at the Northeast corner of Times Square (across from TKTS) and has everything – Location, friendly and helpful staff, tasteful contemporary décor and good food. The rooms are small but have many thoughtful touches – comfy leather chair, high tech lighting, recessed flat screen TV and truly luxurious bath towels, shower rug and bathrobes. Part of the 9th floor restaurant is a covered terrace decorated like a private garden with huge palm trees, ferns, hanging baskets and pots of greenery. We had breakfast there and the food was delicious and artfully presented. We plan to go back within a month

title: Good Better Best
text:
I came in quick, in and out I had stayed at the other Edition a few weeks back and like it I booked this one for the location. OK...WOW. Beautiful place, staff is over the top friendly. Lots of places to eat and drink. Lobby is on the 10th floor and the restaurants seem to be scattered around. One you figure it out, it's great. Rooms are small, but its New York. It's new construction so the place is perfect. I was in a Ritz in LA last weekend and the age of the place showed, no matter how hard they worked. (Location made up for it) This place has both. Yes times Square on Saturday night is a zoo.The Times Square location seems to have their act more together than the Flatiron location. A quick breakfast and 
some drinks were very nice. Yes it's expensive, but they don't advertise as a budget place do they? Value? The new smell in NY alone makes it worth while.

title: Royalty in Timesquare
text: We visited the hotel with the first month of it being open. The joining king and double City views rooms where spectacular. Excellent staff, atmosphere and Service. Five star dinning experience and hotel experience in the middle of Time Square. Housekeeping manager Jason McGath and his teem made us feel like royalty. We already have plans to return when the hotel is fully open.

title: Beautiful Hotel - Amazing Staff
text:
This place is amazing - my husband and I stayed there this past weekend March 1-3 for our 3rd anniversary. It was their 9th day open when we arrived. The location is in the center of Times Square which was convenient as there is always something to do (or eat), we were quickly greeted at the front door by an amazing gentleman named Fernando, Fernando would take us up to the front desk and made us feel welcomed the entire weekend we were there. The front desk staff were eager to help us, all three of the front desk folks were attentive and knowledgeable, the hotel lobby was beautiful, it smelled amazing and was a nice blend of sophistication with modern fun, quite elegant really. We went up to our room that overlooked Times Square, the decor was lovely, the bedding comfortable and if we had one minor complaint about the hotel as whole it would be the layout of the bathroom sink/toilet/shower that we weren't crazy about but were comfortable with. 
We walked Times Square a bit and were surprised to find a small bottle of champagne and some chocolate from the Guest Experience Manager Ana, congratulating us on our anniversary. Later that evening we went for another walk and came back to our room to hot chocolate compliments of Fernando who had noticed we had left for a few (attention to detail). It was an amazing experience. 

Finally, we ended up in the lobby bar for some drinks and snacks. All of the staff at the lobby bar (I wish I had remembered names) congratulated us on our anniversary and shared their experiences whether it be in the hotel industry or The Edition specifically, there was no shortage of attention on us which is often the case with New York City hotels. 

We had a wonderful anniversary weekend, the hotel was beautiful and the staff was the best i've ever seen, which I suppose says something given the amount of time I stay in hotels for work/pleasure (platinum member). We will definitely be back.

title: Amazing find
text: The location of the hotel was just the first amazing part of our trip.  Steps from Times square, it provided great access to all the shows and restaurants we wanted.  So clean!!  The staff was so attentive and helpful every step of the way.  This new hotel was perfect for our trip!

title: Excellent Brand New Hotel
text:
This is a brand new property. I stayed with promotional rates from Marriott with quite a few benefits (including room service & laundry credits). Relative to nearby properties on Times Square this one is probably the best as of writing. Overall it was a fantastic experience.

Pro:
New hotel: super clean (like only so many people have slept in the bed, think about it).

Excellent design aesthetic: It’s about simplicity. Back and white contrasting colors. You either like it or hate it (over time I can see the white walls and furniture get increasingly dirty, also not sure if they thought about room acoustics - the echo is kinda annoying...)

Technology enabled: mobile keys, smart TV, conveniently located USB ports, one of the best room lighting control I’ve seen.

Staff on-point: they went above and beyond to fulfill all your requests (only complaint is that a few times nobody handled the front door, which is very heavy).

Service: Turn down included, very professional. Made it feel like home.

Con:

The desk is virtually unusable except for putting stuff on there.

As with any NY property, room size is miniature.

title: Beautiful hotel,  impeccable service
text: Just spent one night at the Edition and wish we had been able to stay longer. Every aspect of this hotel is first class. From the valet attendants, to the bellmen, (especially Joey), bartenders and front desk. We could not have had a better experience. We are already looking forward to going back. The hotel is beautiful and little details make it very special. From the faux fur throw blanket on the bed to the bar with crystal details throughout. Any staff member we encountered went out of their way to greet us and make sure our stay was enjoyable. Thank you to the staff at the Edition for a great experience.

title: Amazing
text: It’s as you would expect from the EDITION brand. Rooms are a little smaller than its big sister in Madison Park, but spacious enough. Amazing amenities, great service, products and the bed is the most comfortable thing you will ever experience. Great for business and also just exploring NYC. Location is also in the middle of everything. Perfection and glad to see this chain is expanding!

title: Oasis in the midst of Times Square
text:
After a long and busy day in NYC, this hotel is a welcome refuge.  Ten steps past the sliding entry doors, an elevator whisks you up to the quiet warmth of the 10th floor lobby.  Compared to the other mega-hotels in Times Square, the space feels intimate but not crowded.  The light tones and white wood panels make the space feel elegant without being stuffy.

While on the small side, the rooms manage to convey openness with a sleek design in tones of white.  The retreat continues with down comforters and feather pillows.

I spent one night at the hotel and hosted several guests for meetings in the restaurant and lobby.  The staff was solicitous and the food was excellent.

I've stayed in at least a dozen NYC hotels and this one is among the best.  I will absolutely return.  Elegant, comfortable, great value, and very convenient location.

title: Theatre weekend...new hotel...what could be better!
text: The hotel just opened this week and the entire staff is absolutely fabulous. We were greeted with personal service at every turn. Valet parking was a piece of cake, check in and front desk staff could not have been more welcoming. We decided to try the hotel restaurant for dinner and it was absolutely terrific. Do not leave till you've had the chocolate souffle dessert! The best part is that the hotel is 50 feet from the center of Times Square but it is literally an oasis of tranquility, quality and top notch service. WELL DONE.

title: Brand new beautiful hotel
text: Hello. We stayed for a preview night and really enjoyed our stay. We really liked the help, they all promote and speak highly of the Marriott co. The staff is really motivated and excited and hardworking. We really enjoyed ourselves.  The rooms are spacious  and new. Beautiful,  modern furniture. Tranquil and  quiet even though you are in the heart of Times Square. Amazing views!!!!! The lighting in the rooms and the detailing is perfection. The balconies are large and views of Times Square are just grand.  Room service was delicious and The lobby bar is great. I received excellent drinks made by Julia and then dinner in the Terrace was just what we expected.  The service was unbelievably excellent and the food and beverage was so so good. All the decor in the building is spanking brand new. This is the place to be. It is so modern, and clean and it smells great. Top notch skin care products are in the bathrooms as well.  Again though what makes a place is the staff and this staff takes pleasure and they are very proud to show off this new hotel. Special thanks to everyone, thanks for the amazing upgrade gift of delicious wine and cheese. We were surprised.  First class. Special thanks to Fernando on ground level for the great welcome and when you just arrive and special thanks to Jerome, bell hop. He really provided so much info on this structure. All the staff at the front desk and all the men who delivered are food are so helpful and knowledgeable.   Ty again. See you again.
